58.description: This place is definitely worth the wait, and there definitely will be a wait.The Original Pancake House, located on E 47th in the heart of Hyde Park, offers the ultimate brunch experience.By the ultimate brunch experience, I mean that it excels in all aspects of brunch. Starting with the house brewed coffee and fresh cream, you will surely get your caffeine fix in for the day. The coffee is fresh and aromatic, strong enough to wake you up, but not too strong as to overwhelm its flavor.From the coffee, we moved on to our breakfast entrees. My friend got the meat lovers skillet while I got the bacon and eggs. The meat lovers skillet looked delicious, with generous pieces of meat laid over oven-baked potatoes. My bacon and eggs was perfect for what I was looking for. The eggs were pretty standard, but those bacon...The bacon I had was the best bacon I've ever had, bar none. Cured to perfection, with a delicate ratio of smokiness to crispy sweetness. The bacon was crisp and thick, delivering substance with flavor. Honestly, you just have to get it.Our meals also came with either 3 buttermilk pancakes or toast. We opted for the pancakes, which were light, fluffy and filling. Finally, we also got an order of their apple pancake, which was their house specialty. I'm usually not a big fan of apple based desserts, but absolutely loved the apple pancake. Sprinkled with a generous amount of cinnamon sugar, the melted sugar flowed into every crevice of the pancake. The apples were fresh and warm, with enough tartness to counterbalance the overload of sugar. The pancake was even softer and lighter than our buttermilk pancakes, almost melting the moment it enters your mouth. If I could imagine what clouds tasted like, it would be that.On top of everything (though, the food is by far the best part), the service was attentive and the prices were extremely fair. I highly, highly recommend making the trip down here for this great brunch experience.

56.description: The food never fails me, and I've been trying something different every single time! Definitely one of my favorite breakfast restaurants. Near the lake too.Oh! One quick story: I lost my last favorite cubs hat there, and they were nice enough to hold it for me! Pretty nice of them.

29.description: I enjoy cooking, but breakfast is not one of my specialties. Interestingly enough, my husband and I often dine out for breakfast. This time around, my sister suggested this spot and it must be a Chicago favorite because it was packed! The waitress was attentive and the prices were low. I had strawberry crepes and as always, the hubby had french toast. We were both impressed and talked about how everything was so tasty and fresh. A simple spot with delicious food options and service.

42.description: Nicole gave us excellent service. She was understanding that we needed more time to study the huge menu, after providing us a bottomless cup of very good coffee.All omelettes are baked. Scrambles are available as well as frittatas, and a multitude of pancake and waffle variations.Any egg dish can be prepared with egg whites or Egg Beaters for a slight upcharge.You are given a choice of toast or pancakes with your omelette and scramble orders.The husband tried the veggie omelette with cheddar and pancakes.  I had the healthy scramble made with veggies (no cheese) and pancakes.  We requested honey instead of syrup because I'd read my Yelp reviews and noted that they have 'thin' syrup which I despise! Nicole told me that the syrup is house made and includes molasses as an ingredient. Personally, I think molasses goes very well with pancakes without being diluted by other ingredients.I liked my scrambler. The husband liked his baked omelette.  He told me the pancakes were too doughy, as if undercooked.  I must agree with his assessment.The restaurant itself is very comfortable, and the tables are NOT crowded together, which is nice and kept the noise down. We were able to converse, a special treat these days.There is free parking in the shopping center lot, but stay out of the spaces near the dry cleaners because you will be towed!!!We visited on a Tuesday about 10:30-11 and there were a few groups waiting for tables, but we were seated within 5-7 minutes. The waiting area is confined right in front of the washroom entrances, which could create problems during inclement weather when lines are long.I liked the food. Huge portions and s fair price point. If I'm in the area and we want breakfast, I'd return. However I don't think it's worth a special trip. Service is very good and I noticed that teamwork amongst the personnel is strong!  I like that, and believe that it's an indication that staff is treated fairly and with respect.I recommend The Original Pancake House when in Hyde Park!

23.description: Would have left a better review,  but every piece of flatware and water glasses left the distinct smell of EGGS! They probably need to change  the dishwasher  filter or something  , don't get me wrong  I like eggs, but only the one's your supposed  to  eat!   For the price we, (you )deserve  better !!!!

47.description: I ordered a spinach omelet from this place. It literally looked like a haggis. It was glorious.

8.description: When you need a good, hearty comfort meal, you should go here. It is a very popular place but parking is always easy to find. I've tried their original pancakes, skillets and their strawberry waffles. All of these are sure to be a crowd pleaser.Today, I finally ordered its famous apple pancakes. Oven-baked with brown sugar and Granny Smith. It's the perfect guilty pleasure.

31.description: I'm writing this review a little perturbed. My coworker and I went for breakfast two day ago. First when did two 4 oz cups of coffee total $6.38 cents that's $3.19 per cup. Secondly, The omelets are $11.49 of which they brought the wrong one. I ordered ham,spinach,mushroom and Gouda cheese.  They brought broccoli instead of mushrooms.  Well, when I brought to the waitress attention she said don't worry I won't charge you for the cooks mistake. Wrong, I got a charge for something I didn't order. Me not wanting to waste food I decided to keep since she wasn't going to charge me for what I thought was the omelet , No she didn't charge me for the broccoli. Duh! I didn't order broccoli , I order mushrooms. On top of which hash browns are now not included which you pay $3.69 for potatoes. So my omelet was a whooping $15.18. They did give you a side of pancakes....wow!  So in closing my breakfast was $18.37 +tax.....Never ever AGAIN!  I wasn't looking for a free meal but Damn this is absurd.....

34.description: This is a nice family restaurant. The service was quick on an early Wednesday morning. The hostess was terribly unprofessional. When we walked in, she wasn't at the hostess counter, so when she passed us on the phone to pick up a few menus, I hadn't taken special notice of her when she said "follow me". I was so turned off that she stayed on her obviously personal phone call while seating us. She placed the menus on the table and walked away, still without greeting us. The waitress was better. Because it was pretty early and not much of a crowd, we were in and out pretty quickly. The food was good. I had the veggie quiche (comes with fruit and delicious hash browns). My bf had the meat lovers special. His pancakes were so fluffy and yummy! It's an average spot with decent food. I'll come again. Hopefully the hostess puts the phone down long enough to greet us next time.

16.description: Great food, good service, good prices, free parking...what more could you ask for. Love this place, and have been coming here since I was a kid. Never had a bad experience and always order the same meal everytime and the food is always consistently good. Always get the junior plate which comes with pancakes, choice of meat (I get their perfectly cooked thick bacon) and order a side of hashbrowns which are the best in chicago. I love love love that their syrup is always warm when they give it to you....why don't all breakfast places do that? From the time I sit down, to the time I get my food and eat, this takes no more than 30 minutes every time whether I'm by myself or with 4-5 people. Beware of weekend mornings bc it gets extremely packed. I knocked them one star bc they need a larger waiting area (especially on weekends when it gets packed in there). They recently moved to a new and larger location, so no reason why the waiting area should still be the same size as their old location. They also need a new process for their waiting list. For years they hand you a number and call it when your table is ready. It's 2015 and time to update this process. Other then that love it!!!!

13.description: Thank you all the great reviews for this restaurant! We were looking for breakfast while we were on Chicago and this place looked delicious! We got there and it was packed! But only had to wait a few minutes to get a table for 2. The boyfriend and I each got the southwestern skillet. But I got mine with wheat toast and the boyfriend got the buttermilk pancakes. I also got a side of grits. It was so good!!! a little too spicy for me but amaze balls. It even comes with their homemade salsa that was so flavorful and a little spicy too. The southwestern skillet comes with sausage, potatoes veggies, and you get two eggs on top. I got it over easy. the grits was okay, it would've been better with cheese. yummy! when we left, there were still people waiting for a table! must be a popular place.

11.description: Great food and very kind and accommodating staff. I highly recommend the steak skillet!

39.description: Never been a big pancake fan, but someone told me these were the best pancakes in the city. I didn't believe them, but then I had them and now I'm addicted. Everything I've ever had here has been amazing. The bacon, the seasonal pancakes, the skillets, the only thing that disappointed was the apple pancake.

37.description: Food was ok but way overpriced. I won't return unless someone is treating. You want how much for a cup of coffee????

0.description: Great! Great! Great! The food was great the customer service was wonderful. I had a omelette on a Saturday morning and it was packed. True the place is on the small side but the omelette was the bomb and it came with three pancakes and the total was i think $15.00.Not bad for a small spot i'll try it again.

38.description: I did not order anything special just eggs and beef salami. Everything was good and our waitress was nice. She did not constantly bother us while we were eating and was alert to notice when we needed her.  However, the person at the register seemed to be in a rush to finish her personal conversation with another employee rather than politely attending to the guests who were trying to check out.

51.description: These pancakes were the best I ever ate.  Boom.  However, I needed a few refills on butter, I felt that they dind't give you enough.  Service was great.

27.description: This restaurant has delicious food.  I have been to their original location and now the new location.  New location is much bigger and wait staff can have better access to move around the restaurant due to more space.  Whenever I dine in, I get the blueberry pancakes that comes with the BEST blueberry compote I have ever had.  It's fresh blueberries with a very light syrup that is really good.  Most compotes are thick and not fresh.  Their breakfast potatoes are really good also and get the cheese melted on top - Heaven!  The last time I was there a few weeks ago, my meal was good.  The waitress asked me to remind her of the drink I ordered in case she forgets which that was a first but it wasn't an issue because she remembered!!  The only thing I would ask for improvement is 2 things.  1.  Not charge patrons for take out containers.  I think that is BOGUS.  Take out food has to be put in a container anyway so why charge the customer.  2.  This establishment is next door to Weight Watchers.  Management was asked if they would provide the Points Plus values for their food or come up with a lighter fare section on the menu and management said no.  I guarantee if this was done, more Weight Watchers members would patronize the establishment.

32.description: Go to brunch place in Hyde Park. Always expect a wait though; I've been here for early and late brunch and there's always a wait.  The food is consistently good; I usually get the skillet and I've tried the Dutch baby (it takes them awhile to make this but I think it's worth it to share with friends). The environment is very lively and the service varies. Prices are reasonable and the portion sizes are huge; I can never finish all the food here.

54.description: Food is great...you can't go wrong with any selection....BUT it's best to go before 4pm because this place really closes at 4 not 5...my boyfriend and I sat there for 15 mins without any attention given to us at all...such a rude experience this last time I went...

48.description: Place is crowded and chaotic but worth the wait for food . It was 5 of us and took about 30 minutes on a Sunday afternoon which was not to bad to me . Food was delicious and filling . Will definitely be back

44.description: Great breakfast place with friendly waitstaff and good food. It is the platonic ideal of a breakfast diner - friendly, fast, and totally community oriented. We ended up striking up a conversation with the table next to us while waiting for our food - exactly the reason I moved to Hyde Park. It does get busy, especially on weekend mornings, but the wait wasn't even bad. They could definitely improve the waiting area, but I understand the desire to get as many tables on the floor as possible.The Holland pancakes are delicious, done perfectly and so hard to find they they were a totally welcome treat.Breakfast staples - pancakes and eggs (I got the 2x4) were both executed well with the eggs done exactly as I had asked and light, fluffy pancakes. Delicious!

24.description: Great place, local and warm atmosphere, excellent service. The food is a bit on the greasier side, but you get what you come for...

7.description: This is a nice family restaurant. The service was quick on an early Wednesday morning. The hostess was terribly unprofessional. When we walked in, she wasn't at the hostess counter, so when she passed us on the phone to pick up a few menus, I hadn't taken special notice of her when she said "follow me". I was so turned off that she stayed on her obviously personal phone call while seating us. She placed the menus on the table and walked away, still without greeting us. The waitress was better. Because it was pretty early and not much of a crowd, we were in and out pretty quickly. The food was good. I had the veggie quiche (comes with fruit and delicious hash browns). My bf had the meat lovers special. His pancakes were so fluffy and yummy! It's an average spot with decent food. I'll come again. Hopefully the hostess puts the phone down long enough to greet us next time.

49.description: I ate here for the first time with my family last August and if I could I promise I would kidnap the cook if it wasn't illegal. Lol, I loved everything from the food to the staff...Really great food

40.description: When you need a good, hearty comfort meal, you should go here. It is a very popular place but parking is always easy to find. I've tried their original pancakes, skillets and their strawberry waffles. All of these are sure to be a crowd pleaser.Today, I finally ordered its famous apple pancakes. Oven-baked with brown sugar and Granny Smith. It's the perfect guilty pleasure.

53.description: Best coffee!  Consistenly great pancakes and bacon. The service is pretty good.  Espect a wait on weekends, no matter how early.  It's worth it.

30.description: I ordered Dutch treate and my friend apple pancake. They are both yummy, especially the Dutch treate. It's not the overly sweet American food you might expect. However, it does take a long time for the food to arrive. We waited for more than thirty mins!

46.description: On August 10, 2014 a party of 20 were reserved for this sit-down breakfast diner. On arrival we waited about 10 minutes for seating then the hostess took us to a table for 2.  Remarkably 20 was translated to 2. Five persons left and 15 remained. Some time later we got a table for 10. I  spotted a table next to that where diners were finishing their meal and after the left I immediately stood beside the table indicate a "hold" for the rest of our party. One passing waitress wasn't happy with  this and although I made every effort to enable her passing food to other tables she rudely remarked about my being in her way.   However eventually the extra table was cleared and we seated ourselves. We placed our order without delay. At 130pm, we had still not received our simple order of omelets. We had to leave for the airport. As we rose to leave Lizbeth our server came rushing with our order, far too late. I refused mine and some took theirs as a "take out". What service!I contacted the Franchisor's office in Portland, Oregon and eventually got a response form Steve Sczurek,the franchisee, who gave a weak apology about the inexperience of this new server, Lizbeth. No effort was even made to make any amends for the disservice we received and the collective waste of time. I could not recommend a visit to this establishment

1.description: Great food. Clean establishment. Staff friendly and quick to help each other to take care of guests. Had the eggs Benedict with potato pancakes, best potato pancakes in this neighborhood.

55.description: Theee best pancake house!Consistently great food, good service, and a light, airy ambience. Real butter, fresh eggs, and  great coffee (served with heavy cream)! Everything is made to order and in-house, from the sourdough starter to the fresh strawberry syrup. I've been a fan and regular since 51st Street. My favorite server, Ynobe, is great!

9.description: I visit this spot at least once a week. The food and coffee are always delicious and the service is the best on the south side.Whether you are a Chi-town regular or a tourist looking for the best breakfast in Chicago - visit this pancake house. You won't be disappointed.

26.description: So, I really like the food and my server was awesome but the hostess needs to learn to use words to communicate. She didn't greet me, say good morning or offer instructions as she handed me my number.

25.description: This restaurant gives you what you expect. Quality food and personal yet very busy staff. If you are a Chicagoan, you know the deal with breakfast. Most restaurants are swamped. You might have to wait but it's worth it. Try the skillets. Enjoy!

12.description: This is my favorite breakfast place in Hyde Park! I am very meticulous when it comes to cleanliness in restaurants and I am so happy that my silverware are always sparkling. This place has delicious food with great waitstaff. Food is always hot and fast.

59.description: I have been here several times and even went to this place when it was on 51st street. I must say the staff and food are consistent. There is always a crowd it doesn't matter the day it weather. If your claustrophobic the best thing I can tell you is don't go here. It's tight in the seating and wait area. It's old school in the wait area so don't miss your number being called. I just went there today....I was soo hungry I didn't post a pic because when I got my foodie devoted it! But I will probably return :-)

21.description: My favorite place to go for brunch in Hyde Park!I always have trouble deciding what to get here. There are SO many options, and the variety of pancakes is SO tempting. I usually go for the steak skillet with over-easy eggs. It comes with a side of pancakes (so I don't have to decide if I want a skillet or pancakes). Super filling, and I'm never able to finish it... I usually eat the rest the next day because I'm usually stuffed for the rest of the day! Prices can't be beat.A bit finicky with credit card splitting (I believe they only do two cards/table). If you come at a prime brunch time, be prepared to wait 40-60min for a table.

17.description: The food & service was delicious. Our server was very nice and courteous!!!

10.description: Are you ready to literally "roll" back to your bed after that?Great! You are up for a "food porn" moment!This place is just AMAZING! You could find, if you really look attentively, some fruits, somewhere in your plate...but who cares about fruit right? This place reflects exactly what's a real american "breakfast-brunch"! Be ready to wait a little bit but it worth it trust me! Close your eyes...You are in the late 50's, you enter in a crowdie place where you can smell butter, crispy bacon and pancakes...you smell it? Open your eyes...Here we are! It's time to order bacon and eegs, a blueberry pancake and a chocolate waffle and NOW you are the happiest dude in the ALL WORLD! Perfect place for a hangover ;-)

5.description: I don't know anyone that doesn't love this place! Their pancakes are the best I've ever had! I just went there yesterday and once again the pancakes were so moist! The caramel hot chocolate is very good, I could really taste that smooth caramel. I love that they top it with mini marshmallows and whip cream, yummy!!! I also get the make your own omelette and all I can say is "biggest omelette of my life, with lots of cheese!!!" I love the churchy vibe I get there but it does get really packed on Sunday's so make sure to get there pretty early. I will continue to try to come here once a week :)

3.description: Basically, it's a glorified IHOP, and that's not a bad thing. The scramblers were huge portions, full of fresh vegetables, and the accompanying salsa was surprisingly tasty. I opted out of the bread sides and got an overflowing side of fruit that was deliciously ripe. I managed to steal several bites of the pancakes that were super light and fluffy. The pancakes themselves tasted like plain white bread, but add a little bit of butter and syrup for that magical sweet and salty combination. It's just a simple place serving up some good ol' breakfast food with fast and friendly service.

35.description: Your typical breakfast menu with plenty of options to choose from. I had the corned beef hash and eggs with pancakes. It was a huge delicious plate of food. Plenty of refills on the coffee too. Quick, great service, but we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table on Sunday morning, so come early to beat the rush.

19.description: Nicole gave us excellent service. She was understanding that we needed more time to study the huge menu, after providing us a bottomless cup of very good coffee.All omelettes are baked. Scrambles are available as well as frittatas, and a multitude of pancake and waffle variations.Any egg dish can be prepared with egg whites or Egg Beaters for a slight upcharge.You are given a choice of toast or pancakes with your omelette and scramble orders.The husband tried the veggie omelette with cheddar and pancakes.  I had the healthy scramble made with veggies (no cheese) and pancakes.  We requested honey instead of syrup because I'd read my Yelp reviews and noted that they have 'thin' syrup which I despise! Nicole told me that the syrup is house made and includes molasses as an ingredient. Personally, I think molasses goes very well with pancakes without being diluted by other ingredients.I liked my scrambler. The husband liked his baked omelette.  He told me the pancakes were too doughy, as if undercooked.  I must agree with his assessment.The restaurant itself is very comfortable, and the tables are NOT crowded together, which is nice and kept the noise down. We were able to converse, a special treat these days.There is free parking in the shopping center lot, but stay out of the spaces near the dry cleaners because you will be towed!!!We visited on a Tuesday about 10:30-11 and there were a few groups waiting for tables, but we were seated within 5-7 minutes. The waiting area is confined right in front of the washroom entrances, which could create problems during inclement weather when lines are long.I liked the food. Huge portions and s fair price point. If I'm in the area and we want breakfast, I'd return. However I don't think it's worth a special trip. Service is very good and I noticed that teamwork amongst the personnel is strong!  I like that, and believe that it's an indication that staff is treated fairly and with respect.I recommend The Original Pancake House when in Hyde Park!

28.description: I have been to different locations but this one is my favorite.  Laid back atmosphere, not overly crowded, but still busy.  My food was TASTY. Had a veggie skillet and the potatoes on the bottom were just SO good and cheesy!  Pancakes were really delicious too!

45.description: This one of my favorite breakfast spot. They have the best pancakes to me. My only issue is they are always pack on the weekends

33.description: I love this place!!! Been going since I was in high school, when it was located on 51st street. Didn't matter if it was crowded or not. For me the service has always been good, food served in a good amount of time, and the pancakes are consistently good!!! My goto meal is the corn beef and hash w/eggs and pancakes.I recommend this location!!!!

43.description: Wait time is to long, if you dine in you can correct your order when it is brought to the table.. But if you order take out, you better check you order, you may have not received what you should have.  Lack of professionalism with some staff.                            Food is good, service poor.

2.description: Everything and I do mean everything was delicious!  There was a short wait, around 5 or the 10 minutes and our party of 4 was seated.Our waitress Aisha was wonderful.  She catered to every one of our needs and was very accompanying when a nearby booth became available and we asked to be moved to have more room. We ordered an abundance of food. The home style potatoes were absolutely delicious as a side. Other food included chocolate chip pancakes, meat lovers special, a create your own omelet, and a turkey link breakfast.  We had no complaints and plenty of full bellies. I will come here every chance I can get.

18.description: Good food. Original taste. You know what your getting. It's like a " been there done that " , you know it's cool. Have no time for mistake.

41.description: A home style breakfast that many grandmothers would be proud of. The service is extremely friendly and the portions are generous. Generous and tasty, so much so that it is difficult to stop eating even when you know the dangers of finishing a full plate. I love the biscuits and gravy, the biscuits are fluffy, flaky and light. The gravy is a wonderful texture, well seasoned and has just the right sized and amount of fresh sausage. I also love the thick maple cured slices of ham. I'm not usually for getting something as simple as eggs and ham, but at the pancake house it is a legitimate option. The sweet dishes are the likes of which that would make your inner child jump for joy.

52.description: It's decent. It's long been a boughetto magnet, but that isn't a deal breaker. I usually get the spinach crepes which are always yummy. The wide open space feels more like a cafeteria than a restaurant; don't come here to have a quiet, intimate convo in a discreet, darkened booth. Staff has been consistently good with service and communication. I come here occasionally; the only consistent drawback is the crowded front where you have to wait cheek by jowl for a table.

50.description: Its a good place to eat, however please get there early. On the weekends, the lines get long very quickly. Also I wish they would have wi-fi, I like attending early in the morning before work and sometimes would like to get some work completed. In terms of the food.  I like the spinach and mushroom omelette usually I get pancakes, but lately have been getting the raisin toast.

4.description: this place has serious breakfast ! The major downside is the waiting ! It took a while to order our food and to get it . It is a busy breakfast place so just be prepared to wait I guess . To the food !! Lol the waffles are awesome my pictures of the food are half eaten and may look to tempting but it was really good ! The pecan waffle is very good ! And just plain Waffle is as well ! But the Southern Potatoes ! So good !!!

6.description: My favorite place to go for brunch in Hyde Park!I always have trouble deciding what to get here. There are SO many options, and the variety of pancakes is SO tempting. I usually go for the steak skillet with over-easy eggs. It comes with a side of pancakes (so I don't have to decide if I want a skillet or pancakes). Super filling, and I'm never able to finish it... I usually eat the rest the next day because I'm usually stuffed for the rest of the day! Prices can't be beat.A bit finicky with credit card splitting (I believe they only do two cards/table). If you come at a prime brunch time, be prepared to wait 40-60min for a table.

22.description: Great food, good service, good prices, free parking...what more could you ask for. Love this place, and have been coming here since I was a kid. Never had a bad experience and always order the same meal everytime and the food is always consistently good. Always get the junior plate which comes with pancakes, choice of meat (I get their perfectly cooked thick bacon) and order a side of hashbrowns which are the best in chicago. I love love love that their syrup is always warm when they give it to you....why don't all breakfast places do that? From the time I sit down, to the time I get my food and eat, this takes no more than 30 minutes every time whether I'm by myself or with 4-5 people. Beware of weekend mornings bc it gets extremely packed. I knocked them one star bc they need a larger waiting area (especially on weekends when it gets packed in there). They recently moved to a new and larger location, so no reason why the waiting area should still be the same size as their old location. They also need a new process for their waiting list. For years they hand you a number and call it when your table is ready. It's 2015 and time to update this process. Other then that love it!!!!

15.description: 15 min or so wait. Pecan pancakes totally worth it. This reviews isn't long enough so I'm going to post some filler. The building is kind of small, we were shoulder to shoulder in the waiting area.

57.description: Love this place! The breakfast items are amazing, and the customer service is just wonderful. I had the vegetarian egg omelette, strawberry crepes, and house hash browns. The portion sizes were huge!! I always have the pack it to take home; thats one thing I love about American restaurants, it's like two meals for the price of one! The interiors are old fashioned and very clean. I always come back here for crepes! The best breakfast place in Hyde Park!

20.description: Mnmmnm mmmmmmm! So soft and fluffy. They need to start catering. The staff was cool too so it was worth the price.

36.description: I ate here yesterday and I did not enjoy my food. I ordered the Southwest skillet and it was less than stellar. It was chorizo sausage, hash browns, jalapeno peppers and I think onions.  I had to order some salsa and sour cream. I actually did not hardly eat it and left it. The pancakes were good. And the person that I was with ordered sausages, eggs and pancakes which was basic so he was fine. I do feel that they are too pricey for their offerings. Won't be back in the future.

14.description: This place is great! I've been living in Hyde Park for almost a year and can't believe it took me this long to check it out. Brunchin' is a part of life and this place hits the spot! We went on Labor Day (morning/afternoon) and it was pretty busy, but we only waited maybe five minutes for a table. Good thing because we came hungry.They've got plenty of the usual offerings, plus some gluten-free and vegetarian options as well - which was perfect for my friend whose a vegetarian (well, almost). I ordered the create-your-own skillet which allows you four veggies/meats/cheese (whatever your preference) and then each additional is extra charge. That skillet was huge (bacon, eggs, spinach, onions, tomatoes, cheddar cheese). Then they serve you three buttermilk pancakes with. It is rare that I have real buttermilk pancakes, but these are it!I'm not sure why I ordered lemonade with breakfast (but it was so good and so sweet)...I'm usually a big water drinker.Overall, my meal was great, my friend enjoyed hers...and I will be back.

1.description: So i'm working in the area today and I decided to stop here for lunch. My brother and his little freshman friends eat here alot after school between band practice and other after school activities. Now they have bragged and bragged about Golden's lemon pepper chicken so I figured I just have to give them a try. Well it was good! The chicken was fried nice and golden and the lemon pepper wasn't too overpowering. I definitely will stop by again if i'm in the area.

2.description: Well... This was everything you would expect from an always-open place-your-order-through-1"-of-glass fish place.  Frankly, I am not even sure why I had a glimmer of hope in my heart that this place was going to be good.I guess you just have to roll the dice some times...The fish was boney-bad, fries were undercooked, wings had an impressively little amount of meat on them, and the jumbo shrimp were of a consistency that can't explain.  I have honestly had better food in $0.75/person South American dive.This was the first time in a long time that I just tossed 80% of my food...  Sorry Golden Fish.

0.description: Feeding large casual groups...golden fish is a winner.  This place always comes though in a crunch.  The food has always been piping hot, perfectly seasoned and packed ready to go.

1.description: So, I give great ratings to places never. Not almost never, never.  But Emon is AMAZING! I've struggled with my natural hair for years, but Emon has taken me on a journey that has brought me to a place of ultimate happiness with my hair.  With Emon, I feel supported, I feel at peace and I leave looking fly!!  What more can you ask for in a stylist?? Part of me doesn't even want to write this review because I don't want a ton of natural haired girls running over to Emon and taking a whole bunch of spots up on her calendar so I have to wait weeks to get an appointment, but at the same time, I know how HARD it is to find a natural hair stylist in this city who makes you appreciate this incredible journey.  Emon inspired me to loc my hair, which I'm completely happy about, but she can do it all. She's amazing, and creative. And, she needs you to have a vision for your hair. She wants to cultivate that vision.  Check her out. I know you won't be disappointed.

2.description: Emon Fowler/Sarah Bellum Natural Hair Suite has made my natural hair transition a dream.  Upon meeting Emon she asked me "What is your vision for your hair".  I didn't have an answer at the time and at times I still don't, but Emon is a true artist and an expert with natural styles.  I can honestly say that each and every time I leave there - I love the vision of my hair!

0.description: I have been going to Emon since shortly after I did my big chop in April 2014. Under her guidance I've grown out 8.5 inches of healthy, shiny natural hair in under 2 years! We discuss my hair goals almost every time I come in, and she examines my strands and always gives it to me straight if they're not in the condition they should be in. My hair feels soft and smooth after her deep conditioning treatments and the products she uses are a dream. Her space is peaceful and she is incredibly sweet. I am so happy with her!

58.description: Came here yesterday to celebrate my Birthday with 3 friends. Service is a bit slow, but we wanted a leisurely early dinner, so it was wonderful. Our table had a shrimp & lobster pot pie, salmon, tilapia, and liver w/bacon & onions. All were FANTASTIC. Great sides, FANTASTIC cocktails. Our server was attending to several other tables, but took the time to remember our names and take care of us. It was also a nice touch that the owner & chef took the time to see how we were doing. This is off the beaten path, but worth it!

56.description: I came here with my friend on Saturday, April 5, 2014 for an early evening dinner @ 5:30PM & it was AMAZING! The service was friendly & prompt with our food (which was important as we had a theater performance @ the Harold Washington Cultural Center on 47th & King Drive, right down the street, @ 7PM which we made it there on time!). I had the Lobster & Shrimp pot pie & it was AWESOME: it was a deconstructed version whereas the creamy broth (much like a chowder) was on the outside of the "crust" which was actually a nice biscuit in the middle of the bowl (a cute all white deep soup bowl!) with plump, succulent pieces of lobster meat (alot of them!) & huge jumbo shrimps (that I had to cut with a knife & fork!), so good! My friend had the Lobster & Shrimp gumbo which was also tasty (as we tasted each other meals): again it had lots of seafood along with chicken, sausage, & veggies! The cocktails were great too, I had the Key Lime Martini (sweet & refreshing!). This was a wonderful dining experience & I'll definitely be back again!

29.description: Had a nice time here. They were partying on one side & we were eating on the other side. The chicken gumbo was delish. I'll be back for more.

42.description: There were quite a few diners in the main area, but still enough seats such that I didn't have to worry about people sitting on top of me.Homemade yeast rolls. Garden salad with raspberry vinaigrette. Seafood chili. Homemade corn muffins. Chicken, shrimp, and lobster gumbo. Salted caramel cake.

23.description: If you want to experience great food and people come to norm's. I love the Duck burger with a glass of sangria, it's out of this world.

47.description: My sister and I had an early dinner at Norman's Bistro. The food was great. I had the salmon cakes, corn pudding and greens. We also shared an appetizer of the asian wings. The wings were by far my favorite. I could've used a few more wings (maybe my sister and I shouldn't have split them), but there was more than enough food in my entree to compensate. Our waiter was amazing! She even suggested that we try the Sunday brunch which includes a variety of foods and live jazz band. I suggest you check it out.

8.description: Realizing how restaurants tend to fill up quickly for evening dinner on the weekends, I decided to visit Norman's Bistro during the mid afternoon on a Saturday. There were quite a few diners in the main area, but still enough seats such that I didn't have to worry about people sitting on top of me.Homemade yeast rolls. Garden salad with raspberry vinaigrette. Seafood chili. Homemade corn muffins. Chicken, shrimp, and lobster gumbo. Salted caramel cake.I have no extensive review. The service was laid back and the food was damn good. I like the fact that the bread was homemade rather than brought in from a bakery. You can tell by the texture of fresh, baked bread. The seafood chili and gumbo were full of flavour. Having been to New Orleans, I am accustomed to any dishes with a roux base being spicy, but the full flavour of the dishes at Norman's Bistro made up for the lack of pepper in the chili and gumbo. The salted caramel cake, I do believe, may have come from a bakery. It reminded me of the dobo cake I've had at Julius Meinl.I shall have to return again to sample some other menu items. I have a feeling the restaurant can pack out after 5:00, so it will be another Saturday afternoon excursion. It will be worth it.

31.description: It was nice spot.  I didn't know it had the back bar area. I've passed this place multiple times and on this day decided to stop in for lunch.  I had the liver plate with sweet potatoes and the cole slaw it came with a nice surprise as well!  The coleslaw had a welcomed sweetness.  I thought the sweet potatoes were creamy and cooked to perfection.  Being greedy, I also ordered the red beans and rice that I thought had a wonderful flavor to them.  It was something about those red beans and rice that will definitely make me return!  My fiancé had the gumbo which was great as well.  Thanks Norman!

34.description: I went here for brunch with high hopes and was disappointed. I'm going to blame part of this on myself. My love of breakfast had me ordering the pancake platter. I was looking forward to having sweet potato pancakes for the first time, but it was nothing special. The potatoes that came on the side were bland, but tasted okay once doused in hot sauce and salt. Eggs were bland as well.My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy platter. It came with steak on top which she said was overcooked and her biscuits were dry. Now...this is classified as a Brazilian restaurant, so I probably should have ordered something else versus going the normal breakfast route. I plan on coming back in the near future to try more of there main entree items. Also note service was fast although when we first got there it wasn't that packed. No complaints about service though.

16.description: Review in Haiku ExtraordinarilyGood cuisine and great serviceTopped with free smiles

13.description: There were quite a few diners in the main area, but still enough seats such that I didn't have to worry about people sitting on top of me.Homemade yeast rolls. Garden salad with raspberry vinaigrette. Seafood chili. Homemade corn muffins. Chicken, shrimp, and lobster gumbo. Salted caramel cake.

11.description: The staff isn't very attentive. It took up to 10+ minutes before someone came over to greet us. We had to wait awhile for drinks because the bartenders were celebrating another staff member's bday. The food is over priced and not spectacular enough to cost so much. I'm glad I tried it because it is a neighborhood restaurant, but I don't think I'll be going back.

39.description: We decided to try Norman's Bistro after seeing a review on Check Please. I ordered the Shrimp, Chicken and Lobster Gumbo. This was the best gumbo I've ever had. The corn muffins that came with were delicious too - didn't even have to add butter. The portions were very generous. Our server was very sweet and accommodating. The dining room was very comfortable and pleasant. Street parking was very easy to find. You should plan on making reservations if you dine on the weekends. I highly recommend Norman's Bistro.

37.description: They were out of lobster for the chicken shrimp and lobster gumbo. And this was this dish featured on Check Please! What a let down. But the chicken gumbo and seafood chili was good...The service was lacking.  Our server was Wanda.  She was nice but not knowledgeable of the menu.  I take it that she's new so I'm willing to go with it. Our food came out at different times. I don't blame our server but I do blame the kitchen.  My sister had the half chicken and she said it was good and well worth the twenty min wait that was posted on the menu. But it was supposed to come with a salad.  She got that salad ten min after the sever cleared her chicken plate. My brother ordered the Asian stir fry bowl. Although he said it wad okay, it was too sweet, only had 3 shrimp and arrived 20min after my sister's chicken.  I was served first but there was a mix up, I ordered a bowl of the chicken gumbo, a cup of the seafood chili and a side of sauteed collard greens. My brother ordered a cup of the chicken gumbo. I noticed that our sever didn't write any of this down. She gave my brother my bowl of chicken gumbo and correctly served me my seafood chilli. I took my gumbo from my brother and alerted our server of the mix up and to bring out his cup of chicken gumbo and my side of collard greens, that took 20min.My sister requested another glass of water,  it never came so my sister drank my glass. Surprisingly my sibling`s alcohol drinks came prompt and requests for refills were on point. But I ordered the white sangria and they were out of white wine. So I ordered the red sangria and it came 20 min later. It was good but like chicken gumbo, it wasn't what I truly wanted.A birthday party was going on at the tables next to us and I overheard them talking about how "I ordered ice for my drink 20min ago and it's still not here." Why are the sliced cakes coming out five min here or ten min there but not all together? It was a big party of about 15 ppl. They seem pleased but again the service needs great improvement to match the wonderful food.And I didn't understand why the buffet dishes were still out? Couldn't they put that away and set up once the dining room or the entire restaurant was closed?Nice crowd,  pleasant atmosphere, but please tighten up service and retrain kitchen staff to have all meals for the table prepared and delivered at the same time.  Will come back for the chicken shrimp and LOBSTER gumbo. If the chicken gumbo was any indication,  the lobster one will be well worth the return visit.

0.description: This food is soooo good. I decided to stop by for breakfast and had the pancake breakfast. Food was fresh, homemade and seasoned well. This is my new breakfast spot. I'm leaving the other restaurant around the corner.I can't wait to come back

38.description: We found this restaurant on Check Please! So we wanted to try it.  The location is a bit far out but the drive was not that bad and well worth it!!The food was phenomenal.  I had a roasted cajun catfish plate with sweet potato yam and braised collard greens.  It was totally out of this world.  I got to taste their chicken, shrimp and lobster gumbo as well and it was the best gumbo, totally worth $25 for the dish.We were so full and didn't have any room left for desserts.  May be next time.I give it 5 solid stars for the food and also for the service.  Oh also lemon drop martini and Manhattan were very good as well.

51.description: My experience was HORRIBLE at Norman's Bistro in Hyde Park/Bronzville!    This is how my evening went:* I arrived at the restaurant around 7:15 pm on 05/03/14 (please remember my arrival time).* We had a party of 16 - 20 people; they divided the table with server.  Basically we had 3 servers for our large party, which means everyone didn't get their food at the same time.  Some people were enjoying their food while other sat and watched.* The young lady that handled the section I was sitting was a little slow and didn't really know what was going on.  I ordered an Arnold Palmer and my uncle wanted half lemonade & half Sprite, the young lady mixed our drinks up.  She gave me my uncle's drink and gave my uncle my drink.....Do you not know the difference in appearance of the two drinks?  * Now it's time to order.  I was asking about their gumbo, I don't like okra; she had to run back to the kitchen and ask.  In other restaurants servers know the answers to basic question like this; I'm sure this is not the first time this question has been asked!* One of the ladies at the table suggested I try the chicken & sausage gumbo because it didn't have okra, this lady doesn't like okra either.   So I ordered a bowl of the chicken & sausage gumbo and my server responded with "We don't have any".  So I then asked why is it on the menu, she then responded with "we are changing our menus for the summer, so some things you see are not available".  To my surprise I have a lady to my right and to my left both eating chicken & sausage gumbo!  Now I'm annoyed so I ask the young lady why would she tell me that they didn't have any gumbo her response to me was "I thought you said turkey".....REALLY?!  Chicken and turkey do not sound anything alike....ugh!* Since I was told they didn't have any chicken and sausage gumbo I ordered the Caribbean chicken (white meat only).  My server responded with "its legs & thighs", really you don't know what white meat is? So I told her I only eat white meat, she had to ask if I could order my chicken this way.  OMG, you don't know if you can serve a chicken dish with certain parts?* Ok, now that I've ordered my food and can't wait to try it because everyone appears to be enjoying their food.  My meal came with a salad that had WAY too much dressing, it was discussing!  So time has passed and my food comes and to my surprise it's dark meat......OMG, Really?!* Now I ask for the manager.  Per my server "he can't come and speak with me because he's back in the kitchen cooking".....AWE, HELL!!!* Because I'm unhappy with my food of course they had to make my chicken over.  By the time I receive my correct dish order the way I specified it's now 9:30 pm!  Yes, 9:30 pm!  I've been in this restaurant for over 2 hours with nothing to eat!* My server never came back and asked me if I like another Arnold Palmer.  At this point I was so discussed I wanted to scream!Overall the service is Horrible, the food is just ok and it's a little over priced for the area!  Bottom line is don't waste your time!  I didn't want to give them any stars but Yelp made me give them at least one.

27.description: Normans Bistro is a gem in Bronzeville! I love the fact that I can go there by myself or with a group of of friends and still feel comfortable in each setting. The food is great! It is a place where you can get comfort food and it has a upscale twist on soul food classics. This is definitely a place to try out.

32.description: Only thing memorable to me was the gumbo, which although was good, as not worth the price tag that they have attached. Reason why this review is so low is that the burger that I got which was supposed to be duck.....was actually just ground up duck like a normal burger. Couldn't even tell if it was duck...maybe it wasn't.Second reason was the girl got the snapper and it had the biggest fishy smell and taste I have ever witnessed at a restaurant. Maybe I'm being harsh because Chicago doesn't have access to fresh seafood? Either way, won't be coming back.

54.description: Delicious variety of brunch items with great service. I would defintely venture out to try their other menu items. Great food, great place, great service!

48.description: The lobster and chicken gumbo was Excellent,  looking forward to trying other items on menu.

44.description: Realizing how restaurants tend to fill up quickly for evening dinner on the weekends, I decided to visit Norman's Bistro during the mid afternoon on a Saturday. There were quite a few diners in the main area, but still enough seats such that I didn't have to worry about people sitting on top of me.Homemade yeast rolls. Garden salad with raspberry vinaigrette. Seafood chili. Homemade corn muffins. Chicken, shrimp, and lobster gumbo. Salted caramel cake.I have no extensive review. The service was laid back and the food was damn good. I like the fact that the bread was homemade rather than brought in from a bakery. You can tell by the texture of fresh, baked bread. The seafood chili and gumbo were full of flavour. Having been to New Orleans, I am accustomed to any dishes with a roux base being spicy, but the full flavour of the dishes at Norman's Bistro made up for the lack of pepper in the chili and gumbo. The salted caramel cake, I do believe, may have come from a bakery. It reminded me of the dobo cake I've had at Julius Meinl.I shall have to return again to sample some other menu items. I have a feeling the restaurant can pack out after 5:00, so it will be another Saturday afternoon excursion. It will be worth it.

24.description: Really nice ambiance and good food... But the SLOWEST SERVICE EVER :(   It's enough to make me not come back to eat.  Only bar nights, and bring cash...

7.description: My friends and I are there most Wednesday to socialize, but other like us, go often enough to enjoy Norman's Bistro food and the bonding of old and new friends.  If you have any bad to say about the place, give it another chance.  I always said, buy Chinese food from Chinese people, buy Mexican food from Mexican people, buy chicken and ribs from Black establishments, steaks from a place that specialize in steaks.  Norman's is a Bistro and it depends on the cook that night.  Again come have a drink with us on Wednesday, from watching Empire together, or one of our Sports games over some fried shrimp, gumbo, salmon cakes, etc.!

49.description: We've been there several times.  It's a little dark and sometimes it looks like it's closed.  The food has been consistenly good.  We enjoyed the gumbo and red velvet cake was better than I've ever had.Service was slow at times, but we were never in a hurry and the staff is friendly.

40.description: There was a little confusion for me at first. I called to reserve a table for 5 and was told the wait was 30-60 mins. When I arrived the place was pretty much empty and we were seated right away. Our server was nice and attentive. I ordered sweet potato fries which were really tasty. I got the cajun catfish pate with red beans and rice. It wasn't outstanding but still good food. The grilled fish was better with a little lemon. The warm bread basket was great and fresh.  One side of this place is a restaurant and one side was like a club with dj so you hear two sets of music the whole meal. Jazz and mellow tunes in the restaurant competing with more upbeat music. Free street parking, not too much else is around the immediate area.

53.description: I had high hopes for this restaurant.   It is a beautiful building.   The wait staff is so kind and friendly.  However, I came here with my family on mother's day.  They had a mother's day buffet and it was billed to be amazing.   My family and I waited for over an hour and the buffet remained empty.  There was literally NO FOOD on the buffet.  ZERO FOOD.  The poor waitress kept saying the food was coming but it never came. Eventually we had to order from the menu.  In the future if you are having a holiday buffet perhaps you should not have a menu too.  That way you can keep up with the demand of the crowd.

30.description: Just had dinner here this evening.I'll relate the hits and the misses;  The hits; The food was fabulous, collard greens, sauteed spinach, mashed sweet potatoes, pizza, fried shrimp, wild rice, t bone steak, lamb chops, pork chops, ALL the food was excellent. The misses; service sucked and I do mean really really suckedThe waitress didn't know nothing about the food we asked about the entrees and her responses were not appropriate.  My fellow guests said they must have got her off a  McDonald's line to work for tonight and put her into a restaurant setting; some examples, we asked the waitress about the entrees;  is the lamb steaks or chops(the menu did NOT specify)  The waitress said is that with the bone in it? Because we have the one with the bone in it.  We asked her about the ribs she said she didn't know because she don't eat that, that really was her response.  She blamed everything in the kitchen, her response to where were the appetizer we ordered " I just put it in the kitchen I don't have nothing to do with the way it comes out,  I just put the orders in"  I swear that was her response.  When I complained about my steak being over cooked she did bring me another. We asked her about the dessert menu options her response was I don't know or I never have never eaten that.  This establishment has the potential to be so much better, we all would come back for the food but the service is seriously lacking.I would order take out.

46.description: we went on the night of the jazz pub crawl and the food and music was FANTASTIC!  2 of us shared the rib dinner with collards and a side of coleslaw and red beans and rice, and everything was delicious  (especially, that special treatment of the greens!).  service was prompt and the food arrived fast. will attend again when we can linger a while, order individual plates and then have leftovers to take home.  I wanted every dish I saw passing us by to other tables!

1.description: Honest review (not good) the food is very basic n over priced  picture if mcdonalds charged 17 bucks for a burger. The service was horrible she was so un attentive the reason conversing with coworkers. The worst part is we could see them so we literally had to wait for her for everything went like we were at the dmv its a good party spot for older people because in the back the party was poppin. The music was really hip really was good music. I would never come again n i wouldnt recommend this place to my worst enemies Chicken gumbo: it was surprisingly good u could really taste the holy trinity. There were big pieces of chicken. It needed salt though seems like they forgot to put salt. Adding hot sauce or heat would have made it taste better Yams: I thought it was gonna be with pecans and marshmallows and really good sadly its jus plain yams with sugar really a disappointment to plain to basic Corn pudding: this had no flavor at all its like they made a pudding n just added corn in it i was really disappointed thought it was gonna be like county bbq sadly mistakenCaribbean duck: this was really delicous the sauce was to die for really pared perfectly with the duck. The problem was the duck was overcooked so it was really tuff. Then the skin wasnt crispy come on really also could have benefited from a lil salt n heat Pot pie: isnt a pot pie more like biscuits n seafood gravy. The gravy was really cheezy but i didnt like this at all jus for the price was expecting to be wow n its so basic. This was a complete fail. The seafood was cooked good though. The biscuits old n hard

55.description: Really enjoyed the food. And I look forward to going back and supporting  this establishment the same as those in other parts of the city support their local restaurants. The Cajun Catfish was outstanding as well as very good drinks and dessert. There was an eclectric crowd which is a plus. Keep doing what you do Norman.

9.description: Norman's Bistro catered our wedding last September and did a wonderful job. They were very responsive to our priorities for vegetarian entrees and worked with us to meet our budget. We had jerk chicken, roast pork loin, and Chef Robert prepared a vegetarian jambalaya at my request that had delicious fried plantains in it. I really enjoyed the bourbon gravy sauce that he served with the pork loin. I especially recommend the creamed potatoes and yams as sides. The food was all tasty and served appropriately hot with great attention from the servers. Lovely presentation of the salads.

26.description: Such an amazing place! The food was delicious. If you go you must try the corn pudding. The Sangria will send you to your happy place. The Cranberry bread pudding is to die for!!  The back bar area is filled with  regulars who embraced us with open arms as we danced to great r & b dance music. Norman dragged me out to the dance floor and danced a few songs with me. Can't wait to go back!!

25.description: We went to Norman's Bistro after the restaurant was featured on Check Please. We was quite disappointed with the quality of the food. I ordered the flame roasted half roasted chicken and my friend ordered the chicken and lobster gumbo The prices are quite expensive for a neighborhood restaurant and the service was mediocre at best. Chicago offers many restaurants with more moderate prices and a better variety of menu items. I will not return to this restaurant.

12.description: WOW! The food here is amazing! I'm kind of bummed that I've only learned about it recently, but then again, it's better than late than never. I dined at Norman's this past weekend and I really enjoyed myself. The food was delicious (I had the Seafood Chili) and the drinks were strong and flavorful. I had two! At first, I was put off by the menu prices because I've gone to some restaurants and been completely underwhelmed by the seasonings and taste of the food, despite the expensive ingredients. I can truly say that Norman's menu is worth the prices. The food is filling, tasty, and prepared very well. The only issue our group experienced was the slow wait staff. Speed of service is definitely not an important factor at Norman's. Other than that, I honestly cannot complain. Norman even stopped by our table and invited us to come back for their holiday celebration. I plan to definitely be in attendance!

59.description: My first experience was here absolutely one for the books, and it will definitely not be my last. On top of the amazing customer service, the quality of the food I had during my visit was divine. I even had the pleasure of meeting the owner himself, and he made the experience all the more fantastic. With his kind, cheery, and playful demeanor, I didn't feel as though I was at a restaurant, I felt like I was at home with an old friend. The fact that there is little to no knowledge about such a fantastic establishment is what's truly appalling.

21.description: I've given this restaurant three chances to at least serve me mediocre food, but they failed each time. In addition to bad food,  customer service is not good. On my last visit my friend and I were ignored by all staff that walked past the hostess booth. I had to walk to the kitchen and ask if we could be seated,  and the place was almost empty, no customers and this was an afternoon on a Saturday. We moved pass this red flag and since I've been here twice before,  I had a difficult time ordering because I feared I would order something and it taste horrible due to the high prices. I finally ordered the Merlot pasta with chicken sausage, side of corn pudding, and the island sweet tea. Boy was I mad when I saw the pasta. It was loaded with store bought spaghetti sauce,  no chicken sausage and definitely no taste. So upset. As I ate two individuals walked in to the restaurant to be seated and was ignored as well by staff, so they left. I should have done the same thing, but I stayed and was out of over $50 on two meals and unsatisfied with food and service at this place. The quality has gone astray and it doesn't appear it will be coming back. Poor management and lack of training for the servers. Looks like I have to continue going outside of my community for quality good food and service.

17.description: I came for one reason only---the seafood gumbo. Some may consider it pricey but considering the big chunks of seafood, I think it's reasonable. Very well seasoned and has just enough kick of spice to get you going.

10.description: Only thing memorable to me was the gumbo, which although was good, as not worth the price tag that they have attached. Reason why this review is so low is that the burger that I got which was supposed to be duck.....was actually just ground up duck like a normal burger. Couldn't even tell if it was duck...maybe it wasn't.Second reason was the girl got the snapper and it had the biggest fishy smell and taste I have ever witnessed at a restaurant. Maybe I'm being harsh because Chicago doesn't have access to fresh seafood? Either way, won't be coming back.

5.description: The house gumbo was delicious. I visited on a Friday evening and they had a DJ and move tables to make a small dance floor. It was a busy night but our server did his best to serve us. They could've used one or two more servers for the crowd. Overall I would go back again I would like to try their brunch menu.

3.description: I was not impressed. The front was busy with a private party with a live band playing so we went to the back bar area. We had the seafood chili & it was good but none of their food came out hot! I didn't enjoy the rolls that came out for the table. A bit gummy. The prices was ridiculous for the food! How do you charge $20 for some gumbo? Needless to say I won't be back! Enough said!!

35.description: I don't ordinarily do this, but I had lunch with a dear friend yesterday at a truly divine hidden gem on the south side called Norman's Bistro on 43rd & Ellis. Friday in Lent so I had the Lobster Gumbo--yes you heard me correctly. Rita told me the Salmon was perfectly prepared, and the island stir fry bowl seemed delectable. Must try this spot folks--open for breakfast and Sunday Brunch. I can't wait until Easter -- Flame Grilled Lamb with Carrot Cake from Norman's for dessert!normansbistro.com

19.description: I don't ordinarily do this, but I had lunch with a dear friend yesterday at a truly divine hidden gem on the south side called Norman's Bistro on 43rd & Ellis. Friday in Lent so I had the Lobster Gumbo--yes you heard me correctly. Rita told me the Salmon was perfectly prepared, and the island stir fry bowl seemed delectable. Must try this spot folks--open for breakfast and Sunday Brunch. I can't wait until Easter -- Flame Grilled Lamb with Carrot Cake from Norman's for dessert!normansbistro.com

28.description: My service was great! However, the food lacked flavor and the dinner rolls were not good at all. I had the citrus tilapia and it was very bland and dry. I also tried the Caribbean yams and they were tasty. The cole slaw was very good also. Even though I only gave three stars I still think I will return and try something different off the menu.

45.description: After several years being open this place should have gotten their act together by now. The food continues of be hit or miss, small portions and escalating prices. Furthermore service is poor. I am all for having a nice place in the area to eat , but $14 for a turkey burger on 43rd is insane!! I will buy one around the corner will fries and a pop for $6 in the future.

33.description: Had the Salmon Cakes and they were HORRIBLE!!  No flavor, no taste, no nothing...very disappointed. However, the chicken gumbo was good but the pricing was not conducive to the portion provided. Nevertheless, I enjoyed it. I had 'duck dressing' and 'sautéed spinach' with my salmon cakes and the dressing was 'Meh'. The duck was its salvation because it simply was NOT well executed. The texture was a bit grainy and it was severely undercooked. The spinach was 'ok'. I also had the fried shrimp and Asian wings for an appetizer. The shrimp were decent but they were five 'Seapack' brand frozen shrimp you can find in your local grocer. I was offended that I was charged $8 for that. In addition, the wings were tasty but not worth it. Portions for the appetizers are simply TOO small. I expected more. But overall, it wasn't terrible - it was just not what I expected. I would probably go back for the chicken gumbo. I just will NEVER  EVER get the salmon cakes again!! They were disgusting. A tip to the chef, please add some fresh garlic, yellow and green onion, red and yellow bell pepper along with some well cooked rice to your salmon for your salmon cakes; also add a touch of dijon mustard or mustard seed with some cayenne pepper, black pepper and a pinch of sea salt; mix together thoroughly (until rice is not noticeable) w/a beaten egg and then make your patties to cook. Trust me, I make these w/a bread crumb and corneal coating but I've done them without the coating and they simple taste GREAT! You'll have people lining up to purchase your salmon cakes if you CHANGE THAT NASTY recipe. They will be light, fluffy and TASTY. Because what you have now is just salmon and onions mixed together and put into a patty and most people probably don't know any better but - It's TERRIBLE! The service was good. Not excellent but good. I may stop by again to try some new things and will be adding my findings to this review. But as for now, I can only give an average rating.

43.description: Ok you people with all of the stars must have been in a different restaurant than I was.  I will never go back to this restaurant.  Not because the service was slow and ineffective and it was.  Not because my food not only was not as it was described on the menu but totally salty and it was.  Not because we ordered mimosas which came ten minutes after our brunch entrée even  though we asked our server twice about them which did happen.  I will never go back here because the owner or manager not sure which came out to talk to two older ladies at the table next to us who had a complaint.  His response to this customer was that she obviously doesn't know good food and should eat somewhere else.  Upon hearing that I decided not to even complain because I know how my temper can be. we paid left and went to promontory for some good food and drinks and attentive service.  Its a shame but I left brunch hungry and thirsty.

2.description: But am I going to come back?Came in on a Saturday a little before 5. Live band playing for private party in the front. Had to sit in the back bar area. Seafood Chili - It was a great taste to me and this is coming from someone that don't like soup/stew kind of dishes. Food was warm but we had a few bites, when waiter came out and after my aunt complained about it the waiter sorry" was all we got instead of a warm dish. When you think of chili you think pepper and beans. Not in this dish. It wasn't a big problem for me as it was good just not what I thought I'll be getting. Shrimp , Chicken and Lobster Gumbo - After telling my waiter I would like to see some steam coming from my dish. It was delivered as promise. Being that this was the more expensive dish. I honestly liked my "warm" seafood chili more. I will say it was the right amount of protein as it was plenty to choose from. It was good quality food overallThe Great Duck Burger - Not my dish only had one bite...my thoughts "that's a good $16 gyro burger" ( topped with a Greek cucumber sauce.)I'm so struggling with this rating... the food 5 stars the decor 5 stars service 3.5 stars...yet I'm giving it 3 stars...Math wasn't my favorite subject in school.Reading the reviews based on price, is kinda of funny and interesting but these two quotes from Mary S. & Brianna A. sums up what I think of this place based on price alone."I don't think gumbo should be $26 though I don't even spend that much for steak lol," & "At first, I was put off by the menu prices,...I can truly say that Norman's menu is worth the prices"My gumbo was $27 (and on the website it currently says $25 ) but I don't feel like I'm dropping the review down 3 stars because of the price. It's just not a food experience I feel like I need to re-live over and over again. If I lived closer I would come hear, but don't want to go through the 45min drive to get hear. but I'm willing to drive 4 hours to St Louis for ribs because THAT was a five star experience to me.

18.description: We found this restaurant on Check Please! So we wanted to try it.  The location is a bit far out but the drive was not that bad and well worth it!!The food was phenomenal.  I had a roasted cajun catfish plate with sweet potato yam and braised collard greens.  It was totally out of this world.  I got to taste their chicken, shrimp and lobster gumbo as well and it was the best gumbo, totally worth $25 for the dish.We were so full and didn't have any room left for desserts.  May be next time.I give it 5 solid stars for the food and also for the service.  Oh also lemon drop martini and Manhattan were very good as well.

41.description: I went to Norman's today with my family for a birthday dinner. The restaurant is a nice,small intimate setting. When my party finally all arrived the waitress never introduced herself and she took her time serving everyone in our party. Apparently there is a brunch buffet that happens on Sunday and we has to investigate how much it was. The food that was out for the buffet looked like it wasbjust sitting there all day.I finally settled on the chicken shrimp and lobster gumbo which was so good. And my dish came with 2 corn muffins but I didn't get my corn muffins but my grandmother ordered the same dish and her muffins right away! Plus it took our waitress too long to give us our check because we was ready to go home. Food good service needs improvement

52.description: We went on a Friday night to celebrate a milestone with a friend. The seafood chili is incredibly flavorful. The duck burger was juicy and well-seasoned. There are two areas inside the restaurant; one is for dining and the other is more of a bar with high top tables for dining. There's also an outdoor dining area.  The DJ was really good that night and the servers/bartenders were very attentive.

50.description: I went during the week. Service was a little slow but there was a party going on so they get a pass on that I had the chicken,lobster, and shrimp gumbo . They get an extra star for that, it's really hard to find gumbo without pork sausage in it. It had just the right amount of kick and was seasoned well. It came without a sale and two pieces of corn bread. They give you a nice size bowl enough to take home. My waitress actually seemed shocked I didn't finish. Kudos to anyone who is finishing that dish in one sitting. I liked the vibe of the restaurant and I will return.

4.description: I went here for brunch with high hopes and was disappointed. I'm going to blame part of this on myself. My love of breakfast had me ordering the pancake platter. I was looking forward to having sweet potato pancakes for the first time, but it was nothing special. The potatoes that came on the side were bland, but tasted okay once doused in hot sauce and salt. Eggs were bland as well.My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy platter. It came with steak on top which she said was overcooked and her biscuits were dry. Now...this is classified as a Brazilian restaurant, so I probably should have ordered something else versus going the normal breakfast route. I plan on coming back in the near future to try more of there main entree items. Also note service was fast although when we first got there it wasn't that packed. No complaints about service though.

6.description: Prior to coming here, I'd read several reviews, watched food critic shows and had referrals from friends. I must say we were beyond disappointed in the service, space and food.We were half greeted by a young hostess that was clearly overwhelmed and did not smile or make us feel welcome.  They were obviously short staffed and we were underserved because the wait staff was being stretched beyond what they could handle.The Trolley Tour proved to be overwhelming to this establishment. The desserts ordered were Peach Cobbler and Salted Caramel Cake both of which were returned after 1 bite. The crust on the cobbler was moist and soft and lacked flavor, the cake tasted as if it had been frozen too long and had an old taste.Hopefully....in the near future, things will get better. Customer Service training is definitely a recommendation.

22.description: I've been experiencing some great burgers across a few states and have to say the blue burger was amazing, and is a contender for one of the best.

15.description: I was excited to try this restaurant after seeing it on Check Please! Went for a late lunch on Sunday with 3 others and sadly, we were all very disappointed in the food and the space. Most of the dishes lacked flavor (Gumbo, Cajun Catfish) or had flavors that did not work well together (Cranberry Salmon). The yams were good but corn muffins were dry and flavorless, coleslaw was watery and overly sweet, and most of the brunch buffet looked unappetizing. Definitely overpriced given the lackluster food and less than classy ambience.

57.description: I just finished my praline pecan patties that I bought during a visit to Normans. I promise you, as a person from New Orleans, there are those that say they can make praline pecan patties, but nobody has ever come this close to my grandma. Those things were wonderful and to think he sold them to me after I practically begged him to give them to me from the Sunday buffet. I also had shrimp lobster gumbo. It was fantastic. Thanks Norman. I have not tasted food like this since I last went to New Orleans some time ago.

20.description: Review in Haiku ExtraordinarilyGood cuisine and great serviceTopped with free smiles

36.description: Three stars for service, our waiter Robert who was non existence.   We had to ask another waiter for our corn muffins that came with the seafood gumbo.  He was not attentive nor did he ask if we needed anything.  The gumbo was delicious and served hot.  However, Sunday evening they were out of the catfish, braised greens, duck.  The group at the next table were highly upset that none of the items they wanted were available.   Three stars for the service, but four stars for the gumbo.  Will come back for the gumbo and try another item from the menu.

14.description: I've been experiencing some great burgers across a few states and have to say the blue burger was amazing, and is a contender for one of the best.

1.description: I went to this store with my daughter on Memorial Day to find a new pair of gym shoes.   She found the pair she wanted, and we informed the clerk. As he brought out the shoes, he flung the box to the floor about 20 feet behind the bench on which we were seated.  He also began a spiel about special insoles for the shoe to "preserve the shoe" and increase the comfort of the shoe " b/c these shoes really need it".  As my daughter tried on the shoes, we realized they weren't the style we originally asked for, although the patterned colors were similar.  He eventually brought out the requested pair, put the same insoles in the shoes while talking incessantly about the quality of the insole.  We decided to purchase the shoes, and when we checked out, the final dollar amount was far greater than I anticipated.  When I questioned why the total was so high, he told me the insoles cost $25 (1/3rd the price of the shoes). I told him that he never explained the price of the insoles and that he had really alluded to the insoles being free of charge, and part of the shoe.Needless to say, the service was crappy, the sneakiness of trying to sell me an insole without explaining the price was improper, and the general disarray of the store (multiple marks were on the benches, inventory trays/shelves were littered about the store, plastic debris was everywhere) are factors that reduce the chance that I'll be venturing back into that branch of foot locker.

2.description: My husband wanted to look at a few things and we decided to check out this location. Immediately we noticed the spacious store, new styles, fully stocked and very well organized store. He found a nice pair of shorts on sale for a great price! It wasn't what we came in for, but a great buy.

0.description: Today is the last day of business for this footlocker after today store will be closed just let you everyone know happy shoe hunting

12.description: I've been here three times in the last month. At first I wasn't going to come back because it took so long to get my order. However; it was totally worth the wait. It was the freshest  and most flavorful Harold's I've ever had!!!! It's my new favorite!!!!

3.description: I have loved Harold's chicken for years! Every time I get back to my hometown I look forward to some. This was my first time at this location and the wait was terrible. There were only two customers in there before me so I have no idea why it would take 30 minutes to get 5 legs and fries. It was the special of the day!
