Unfortunately it was not worth the wait...the chicken had no seasoning and the mild sauce tasted bad, which is bizarre because I love Harold's mild sauce. The only saving grace was that everything was served hot. I cant believe I'm saying this but I will actually think twice about getting Harold's next time. Smh...

1.description: I wish this place would love me as much as I love it, but the customer service is so hit-and-miss that it detracts from the food. The one saving grace is that it's one of the very few Harold's that offers delivery.

2.description: I believe this location does not understand the meaning of customer service.  Besides the shabby appearance of the woman who claims to be the owner her level of professionalism was by far one of the worse I've seen. I will no longer patronize this location.  Instead of stooping to the level of ignorance I was shown today, I will simply just not spend my money there.

9.description: This is not authentic Harold's chicken.  I'm not sure if they lost the recipe, or if they ever had it, but the food here was awful.

10.description: You all really have to open up the half star or 0 stars because that's what this place deserves. By far one of the rudest experiences I've had at any Harold's in all of Chicago. The sign says they close at 10, the voicemail says 11, and when you call the rude light skinned girl Crystal says they take their last order at 9:15. Which is what she told me the night after my next story as I was asking what were the business hours. She just completely cut me off. The other night at 9:10 we were outside the door knocking trying to get in. We were calling as well and no one would answer. Crystal looks at us and looks away and continues to prepare food for the people waiting inside. After she gives them the food and walks them to the door she unlocks it lets them out and as my wife had her hand on the door she yanked it away from her and locked it as if we weren't waiting there  and continued to close up. All the while the sign on the door says 10pm. Please take your money and business to 53rd and Woodlawn if you are in the neighborhood.

4.description: This is the best location as far as the quality and taste of their meals, HOWEVER the level of unprofessionalism  is just ridiculous. The staff is in need of organizational skills training along with appropriate business practices, if your door states you open at 10-am then its unacceptable to open at 1-pm! Further-more if I place an order via phone 10-20 minuets before arriving and you give my order to someone else by "mistake" then you owe me A. an apology and B. a comped meal for the inconvenience. Customer service is KEY to a successful business, we are the reason you are open.

6.description: Great food however if you're thinking about ordering ahead forget about it. They never answer their phone which is a huge problem!

0.description: I do not know what it is about the sauce on chicken but it is the truth! I absolutely loved the food! Small dining area and that was fine by me. The cooks and cashier made me feel like I was at a relative's home! I am a fan!

5.description: Imagine your younger sister running her own Harolds.  If you can get them to answer the phone, good luck.  Some days they might be open.  Do not rely on the door signs.  The food is good most of the time. If you want food from this Harold's have a back up option just in case.

13.description: The chicken here is flavorful and it may take a while to get your order because it is always cooked fresh to order. However, a crash course in customer service is so necessary at this location. Also, I think they make their own hours daily because you never know when this place is going to be open.

11.description: Im asian and I love asian foods, but this place is very good, looks clean and friendly, fast too. Bought a five pieces and took over to next door at taday nails and eat my chickens while get my spa-day done. Loving life...

8.description: I ordered here last night. (2) 5 wings one with mild sauce the other without. The one with mild sauce the chicken was not cooked long enough. And all the chicken tasted like GARLIC! I've never been to a Harold's that had crinkle cut fries either. And the place was as cold as the outside.

14.description: all the chicken doesnt taste the same at every harolds. this one is pretty good! it was closed for some time & it opened back up so i was excited cuz its around the corner from my girls crib. chicken & mild sauce is my weakness! i could eat that for days!! i also like their gizzards with mild sauce. pretty much anythin with mild sauce would make my day! this place doesnt have tables for u 2 sit down & eat your food so its more a to-go place. but they do have a bar type table along the glass window so u can stand & eat your food if u wanted to.

7.description: The wings and fries are the freshest you will ever get from a Harold's. However I called in at 6:17 and they told me 15 mins. Then when I came in 20 mins later I didn't leave out until 6:58 but it's worth the wait. I walked out pissed but when I tore that smoky meat off the bone I was back happy

1.description: This place is great, especially if you are one of the people living in Regents Park where the market is. I can get delivery up to my room or just take a quick walk downstairs to get most of my grocery needs. Sure, it's a tad pricey but for the convenience it's totally worth it. And it has almost everything you would be looking for, so long as it's not some really random specialty item. And they have a pretty large selection of wine and liquor. Their produce can be inconsistent, but the couple of times I went ahead and bought something that looked a bit questionable, like a most-likely-bad avocado, he didn't even charge me for it. But most of the time the produce is fine. And they have lots of indian food, even frozen, which is fun. The guy who runs the market is super nice and I like supporting his  business. At the end of the day, it's not a supermarket, it's a convenience store, but a pretty good one, especially if it's just downstairs of where you live!

2.description: Great little store! I have worked in this area for 10 years now and this store has been a little lifesaver.  Its located right by LSD.  For such a tiny store, it holds quite a variety of products.  They have everything you need! They have a cornered section located in the back dedicated to Indian food.  They have a variety of spirits including refrigerated wine. Many customers go here to buy their lottery tickets. I hold this store close to my heart because the store clerk ALWAYS has my back.  He's my homeboy! I get my Yan Yan and Pandas FIX over here.  They originally only had the strawberry Yan Yans which I depleted the store of.   The next time I came back, the clerk (HAPPY AS EVER!) told me they got more Yan Yans in.  I walk over to the aisle and HOLD AND BEHOLD there were my Strawberry Yan Yans as well as Chocolate and Vanilla!  Could you ask for better customer service?!?!  They lose one star because they closed the deli.  They used to make the yummiest and freshest sandwiches that I would eat for lunch everyday.  I am now reduced to eating greasy Hyde Park food. *sigh*

0.description: Really convenient if you live in Regents, can feel a bit dirty at times (it has been shut down for health concerns, though I've never been sick from anything here). It has a remarkable diversity of food - imports from India, even a few from Japan (you can buy curry roux). Wine, beer, liquor, groceries, snacks, etc, toiletries, even sunglasses.Downsides are you can't use a card if you don't buy above $5. Some of the frozen food seems like it might be old, I bought Pizza Rolls once and they were all frosted over inside. Sometimes it smells intensely like incense to the point of choking. The prices are all higher than anywhere else in Chicago, probably because of the uh convenience.

4.description: This place almost doesn't deserve mention on the interweb, save for one crucial detail. If you live in Hyde Park and require various spices and ingredients for cooking Indian food, you might be able to find them here. They have a decent selection of dal (in bulk bags) and spices (also in bulk bags). The bags do look as if they've been sitting around for a few months, but it sure beats taking the CTA up to Devon Ave. every time I need to renew my supply of garam masala and dal.

3.description: John and Joe are wonderful stylist.  I've been to the salon several times and each time left impressed.  John has a unique way of styling mt hair with a dryer and brush. Joe is just as gifted with his styling tools.  My hair responses well to their awesome product line. I've referred friends and family, all were completely satisfied.

1.description: These men are AWESOME!! Great customer service, very friendly, Down to earth and most of all I leave out with my hair looking healthy and fabulous. Joe talked me out of perming my hair and I'm glad I listened.  Looking for a great hair salon, this is the place to go!!!! Both owners Joe and John are great!!

2.description: Joe did an AMAZING job with my ombrè!! I was nervous to try something different but I was very satisfied with the end result!! Perfection is how I would describe Joes eye for color! From vegas to Chicago the compliments on my cut and ombrè are all thanks to Joe and Egyptian Style :)

5.description: Just what I like. Clean, classy and reasonably price. I will continue to go here and have John (taller one) do my hair.

6.description: When I made my first review I was impressed however when it was time for me to wash my hair myself I noticed my natural hair pattern was completely ruined and I could not get the stench of bumpers out of my hair! I washed it THREE times and it still smelled like burned metal flat irons/bumpers. I decided I would go back a second time but to a different person. He did much better and did not use too much heat (which also means the style didn't last longer than a few days). He also gave me a trim "hack" not impressed but whatever. I'm over it. Screwed me twice. I won't return. Good news? They're very friendly, salon is clean/neat but if you're natural it's probably best to find a salon that specializes in natural hair care.

0.description: FYI:  Joe & John are the proprietorsI ended up at ESBS by chance and won't go into the circumstances.But, this salon is more of what I'm use to, CLASSY!* to be continued....the cursor keeps jumping around :/ *

4.description: I have to say the atmosphere is nice, the stylist are great, John and Joe. I have gone there about 4 times and my hair looked great. When I washed my own hair the natural wave and hair pattern was gone. I tried to get the smell of the hot irons out but it wouldn't leave. The extreme heat is too much for my fine hair. I won't be going back. Perhaps if you have course hair it may work for you.

3.description: This place barely deserves one star. Slow, rude and horrible service is guaranteed when you go here. The gay Latino is an a$$hole. If you like eye rolling and sarcastic and rude comments this is the place for you.

1.description: Ugh. The worst. They are adequately staffed but employees don't seem to pay much attention or care so even when it's a non-peak time your order takes forever and you have to repeat it. Been there a few times when washing laundry next door but after last night I will never returnWalked out of there so disgusted.  Guy was on his headset talking to a friend and I repeated my order four times and he still wasn't getting it since he couldn't be bothered to stop talking to his buddy. I was the only person in line. How about more doing your darn job and less talkin on the phone. It's rude. Obviously he had better things to do and I hate to keep him from his important socializing so I kept my money and left. The only reason why this one has any revenue at all is its proximity to Spin Cycle.

2.description: This Dunkin Donuts is the pitts! This is the second time that I have given this place a chance. The staff is always in the back talking and playing the black guy with the dreadlocks is always playing and not paying attention. I had to repeat my order several times and he still didn't get it right. I told them I would be calling in on them and I will. the staff is so slow, discourteous,  and have no idea of professionalism whatsoever. Does Dunkin Donuts is in a prime location and doesn't need to be closed however, management should revamp the layout and hire new staffing. Perhaps the people working there now need a wake up call. I will never go there again! if I'm passing by and noticed a whole new crew, only then will I ever patron this Dunkin Donuts again. The coffee is always weaker than the coffee I've gotten at other Dunkin Donuts I've patronized.

5.description: Slow,  slow, slow. Lukewarm coffee,  and incorrect orders. The coffee is very weak compared to other locations. Keep it moving, you will risk being late for work waiting for a small coffee!

0.description: Always quick & courteous! I've been coming here since they've opened and never had issues.

4.description: I've tried several times to give this DD a chance. During the morning rush hour, they only have 3, MAYBE 4, people working. When your rushing to work and dropping your child off to school, you need them to move and they don't. They are slow and many times, my coffee order is wrong. Once, there was a spider crawling on the Great America discount ticket offer by the register that I had to bring to the attention of the guy taking orders. Downtown, I'm in and out...even on 53...I'm in and out. Don't be in a rush here!!!!  They really need to learn how to speed it up and make coffee right the first time. It's simple....not rocket science. The coffee is already made....just put the correct syrup in it!

3.description: i always call them food for less by mistake like in my treasure island review i was talking about save a lot. i fuks with save a lot yes it is no frills, yes the corner where it is located is a little sketchy but like they say dont start none wont be none. its kinda like an aldi but way better. i get all my basics from here, milk, eggs, butter, oj, bread. they have a nice selection of canned goods and a large variety of pastas including many whole wheat varieties. the only "meat" i buy from them are turkey necks the selection of meat is severely limited so i jus keep it moving pass them. they have a decent frozen section. you need a quarter for the shopping carts which is returned when you put it back, and i usually recycle my nice treasure island bags because they dont give you bags bring your own or pay and you bag your own food. like their little song says that will surely be stuck in your head my dollar goes far at save a lot

1.description: This is a scary experience just for groceries ...I'll pass on crackheads in the parking lot weirding me out just to get some bread.

2.description: This store has very bad customer service . Never enough registers open. But store is clean have to give them that.

0.description: "Save-A-Lot" is a nationwide chain of discount grocery stores. It appears that there are 7 locations in the city of Chicago, mostly on the south and west sides. You can get an absurd amount of food for very cheap prices at Save-A-Lot. The total is probably going to be about half what you would pay for equivalent items at most grocery stores. They do not have a wide selection of brands, the reason being that many items are their own generics. However, if the only difference between two products is the box, and one costs only half as much, it's arguably foolish to pay twice as much for the same thing.   Regarding the previous reviewers theory that more people don't shop there because they are "freaked out by the neighborhood", that is basically a more polite way of saying "because they are afraid of black people".  I was asked, twice, if I am the manager of the store by customers who approached me. First time I said, "No, I don't work here...", next time I smiled and said "You're the second person to ask me that". The guy said, "Well, because you're the only white man in the store!", as if the logic is obvious. So, there is indeed a kind of racial sub-text to that situation: assumption that a well-dressed white man is probably "The Man".There is no such thing as a "black neighborhood" or a "white neighborhood", we are all Americans and everyone has an equal right to appear in any public place. There is also no reason not to shop at Save-A-Lot. It's big, clean, bright, extremely well-organized, and you can "save a lot" by getting something of the same or better quality for a lower price.

3.description: Tired of the restaurant chains?Tired of the restaurant elevator music? Tired of the restaurant cookie-cutter layout?Then try Cafe on the Grove...literally.  Located at 4317 South Cottage Grove in the Bronzeville neighborhood, it engages you to enjoy a meal before the days of wi-fi, as the owner and chef will greet you, and get this, actually have a conversation with you.  The lighting is something that your eyes do not have to work hard to adjust to and the music is an eclectic collection of Latin, jazz, and blues.  This grown-up environment will not disappoint as it makes for a great space for a first date, date night, or time out with just yourself.

1.description: It was such a wonderful place to be. The staff is warm and friendly. For me to clean my plate, takes a lot and I cleaned my plate...not a crumb left. The food was excellent. They told me an outdoor area was coming soon..so looking forward to that. This place will be my number one spot for breakfast and lunch, for meetings or a date. Thumbs up!!!!

2.description: Very nice cafe food and deserts are very tasty, Lisa and the entire staff are pleasant. Do visit there are no disappointments.

0.description: Perfect place to stop in for a cup of coffee, brunch, or a quick desert (the German Chocolate Cake and Strawberry Cake are 10 out of 10!) cozy space with beautiful art, very friendly staff, and great food!

4.description: Very casual, artsy, friendly café, You'll, feel like home. Atmosphere is cozy .  The service was quick and freshly made entrees to satisfy anyone's tastes palate. I was greeted with a warm smile, and hospitality.  I met the cook, she was very friendly and will cook whatever you like. The salad, I had was a Chicken/ spinach it was big and so delicious,  I returned a week later, to try their cake and brownies with coffee. Now I think I'm addicted. Thank you for making me happy.

58.description: I waited 90 minutes for my pizza,had I read Yelp first I would have known that this was the norm.I ordered a medium,half cheese half ground beef since my neighbor always raves about the cheeseburger pizza(as he calls it).It did not taste like a cheeseburger but the pizza was pretty good.I dont usually like thin crust pizza,matter of fact NEVER met a thin crust that I liked because I dont understand crunchy pizza,but this crust was soft and delish.I LOVED the pizza sauce-nice with a sweet spicy thing going on.The ground beef on top was not that good and I enjoyed the plain cheese side better...I was Mad that there was some ground beef on the cheese side because that was more for my Vegetarian son and he wont touch anything that was remotely close to any meat....So Pizza=GREAT..NOW,customer service...BLAH,No NAPKINS..boo!!!..nO cREDIT CARDS..u suck!...oVERPRICED..wE ALSO ORDERED THE baked Mostaccioli..YUCK!!!!..Double yuck.This is why I gave one less star.The only thing good about it was the layer of cheese on top.It was not flavorfull and I felt like adding some Italian seasoning to it.It came with BURNT garlic bread and NO fork..yea,I'm gonna have to take away another star.So,stick to the pizza and you will be fine but dont expect to get a huge serving because the pizzas seem kinda small to me.

56.description: How does this place not have more reviews with a backing statement like this? "Italian Fiesta goes to Washington, DC to bake President-Elect Obama's favorite pizza!"Sunday night, True Blood Party, someone suggested we order Italian Fiesta Pizza. I've never tried it before, but I love pizza, so why not. And, it's B O'B's favorite? Yeah, I need to try it. It's SUPER thin pizza (I imagine NY style) greasy pizza. The pepperoni is pretty amazing and has an extra kick that most doesn't have. I like spicy so this makes my stomach smile! The cheese has something more then just mozzarella but I can't quite put my finger on it... It's really good though. I liked Italian Fiesta and if I was in the neighborhood, I'd go for it again.

29.description: The food is mediocre and the service is utterly unacceptable.  TWO HOURS for a pizza to be delivered?  There is no excuse.  Fortunately Hyde Park offers a handful of other pizzerias that deliver within a reasonable time frame.

42.description: I would've given 5 stars, but the atmosphere completely throws you off, so it would totally not be accurate.  Its soooooo many things wrong with the atmosphere, but the pizza is freaking amazing.  the crispy, buttery, cracker-like crust.  OMG!  i can't get enough of it.  I've been enjoying Italian fiesta since I was a kid.  if i was ONLY rating the pizza quality, i'd give 5 stars.  if were were rating service and atmosphere, i'd give -1.  i wish they franchised these locations, because i'd totally be interested ... BUT, with the service done the right way.

23.description: Ist time going there and one word TERRIBLE! Pizza was $23 and worth $5. Ordered a large and counted 10 sausage and no onions after I was charged. Cashiers and cooks ridiculous, they were having a conversation about hoes and niggas in front of customers. Who own this spot cause that what it is...Smh....

47.description: OK,  the delivery is very slow, and the pizza is kinda greasy . But it sure TASTE GOOD !   They're open late and the thin crust is oh so GOOD !!!

8.description: It's right down the block from me and I love it.If you've been on the south side for more than 60 seconds, you know about Italian Fiesta.  It's one of those real good, sodium-infused pizza joints.  Best to have some of this pizza on a night where you have been drinking a lot, but I digress.....The location is cash-only so don't bring your debit or credit card.  The pizza (sausage and cheese) was excellent.  One person can finish off a small pizza on their own if they are really hungry (I've done it).  The food was fresh and hot.  Oh did I mention that it was real good?Haven't tried their delivery yet, but I've heard from other Yelpers that it can be a bit slow on busy weekends.

31.description: From my understanding this Italian Fiesta is among the best and I've seen my damn share; location, employees,and pizza all on par.

34.description: The pizza is greasy, but isn't horrible as much as boring. The problem with I.F. is the complete lack of courtesy or customer service. It's like they hire anyone from the juvenile detention center willing to spread some sauce. You are liable to encounter everything from gang signs to profanity laced tirades at I.F. They should call it THUG PIZZA. I ordered a pizza for delivery, and was told that it would be there in and hour to an hour and a half. I called back at the hour and 45min mark and was told that there was no order for my phone number or address. The person who answered  the phone acted as if she could care less and basically hung up on me. I will never spend another dime at IF. The level of disrespect from their employees, far outweigh any cheap satisfaction that I may get from their greasy, boring pizza. The only reason I ignored past episodes of disrespect was the fact that they deliver late. NEVER AGAIN.......EVER.

16.description: Best thin crust pizza in Chicago!!!! Hands down!  Location looks a little shady but really not. I like that this location has pizza by the slice until 4pm.

13.description: Horrible customer service, pick up service needs to be upgraded or the place expanded great pizza tho 5 star pizza

11.description: This place is (rather was) my pizza indulgence. Sure, there are a lot of high-quality pizza places in Chicago but very few options in Hyde Park. By default we have ordered from IFP several times.The thing??? The thing is, DO NOT EVEN think of ordering from them (especially for delivery) during ANY time that could be considered peak time. Peak time for them seems to be any time that normal people eat food. Their delivery service is SO BAD that they should not even offer it as a service. I had learned the hard way to ONLY order from IFP during non-peak times and then SPECIFICALLY ask how busy they are at that time. After recent experiences though, I will NEVER order from IFP again.As others have said, 3-hour wait times are the norm and not the exception. And don't think for one second that they wait until they can squeeze you in for delivery to make your pizza. They don't. They will make it whenever and get it to you whenever and in whatever shape it is in is ON YOU. The customer service people on the phones are rude, short, and don't give a damn about you or your order. They don't care for one second that you just spent $35 on a cold soggy pizza.When ordering they will tell you an 1- to 1.5 hour delivery time. When you call in 2 hours, they will say it is on its way. When you call back in 2 hours and 20 minutes, they will tell you it is on its way. When you call back in 2 hours and 40 minutes, they will put you on hold and ignore you. I don't mind patronizing a busy place that is honest with me. I do mind giving my money to a bunch of liars that treat me like shit.Never again.

39.description: i love italian fiesta i have been eating here for years and I will continue to, sausage& mushrooms sometimes baby shrimp. tried and proven great pizza!

37.description: Good pizza HORRIBLE customer service! Need to hire better employees that are respectful & courteous!

0.description: I have been patronizing this location for over 10 years.  The pizza is delicious.  I prefer to pick it up as delivery can take too long for me and my impatient family.  They always get my order correct (I have very specific orders).  They could improve the customer experience with more caring and polite staff, but I just want the good food.  I recommend the pizza and the lasagna.  For those who complain about the price increase, everything is higher and they use quality ingredients.  If you want cheap, get a frozen pizza from the grocery store!

38.description: Good pizza but awful service. I placed an order for delivery on Thursday night, and didn't receive my order within 2 hours. I called them back and gave them my info, and after being placed on hold for 15 minutes, they told me that they didn't even have my order in their system.

51.description: Been loving their pizza for years.  Good thin crust pizza. Order takers suck though.

27.description: This has to be the absolute worst Italian Fiesta I've ever patronized! The food was great! The employees on the other hand are extremely disrespectful and obviously have no idea what good customer service is... I have never left a review (positive or negative) about any business because that's usually not my thing, But this has to be heard! Long story short: I waited 2 hrs for my meal which arrived around 11 PM, which i wasn't angry about because i am very familiar with the wait times. I ordered a small pizza and an Italian beef sandwich... i received a small pizza and chicken wings. I was told my REdelivery would be another hr and i had to return the chicken wings! Really?  I declined and requested a refund. I was told I had to come into the store for my refund... I went in the next day with the chicken, and both the ticket and the receipt. I was bombarded with senseless questions that made me feel as if i was being accused of trying to scam them out of 5$... Then the women ( term used loosely) employee and manager began to behave like immature children when i became angry with their ignorance and one had the audacity to say " People are lucky we're behind this glass.." In front of her so called manager... I will never in my life spend another dime in this establishment.... and i don't encourage anyone else to do so either. Your patronage will NOT be appreciated... and obviously customer retention is not a priority........ I am a barber and I am required to deliver optimum customer service to the worst assholes at all times or else I don't work, so there is no excuse for this madness! I would love to speak to the owner about this, and I will be on top of that first thing tomorrow when they open.

32.description: I would give this 0 stars if possible. Although the pizza is good, the customer service is horrid. I ordered a pizza (through their centralized order number) and when I arrived to pick it up, I was informed (rudely) that it was sent to the wrong store. I was told that they would make the pizza at the Kenwood location and that it would be done in 15-20 min. After waiting nearly 30 mins, I was called to the bulletproof window and asked about my order. I stated my name again and was told that it was "in the oven" with no estimated time for it to be done. No apology, not even a slight bit a remorse for the mixup - just plain nasty attitude.  While I was there, another person had a similiar experience. I don't spend money at places that treat their customers like garbage. There are plenty of other pizza places in Hyde Park - this one isn't worth it.  The previous reviews are right on the money about the poor customer service at this location.

54.description: Liza B. hit it on the head...1) the service is terrible2) the pizza taste is hit or miss - depends when, where, who & what time its made3) the waiting time is the WORST! - tonight I waited for 2hrs & 15min for delivery.  I called repeatedly and was told everytime (for the past hour & a half, that it was on the way.  When it finally arrived, it was cold & gooey!)

48.description: Things I love about Italian Fiesta:They are near my home. They deliver to my home. Their thin pizza is pretty tasty.Things I hate about Italian Fiesta:It's cash only. The people who answer the phone are a little cranky. It's kind of greasy.I am torn between 3-1/2 stars and 4 but there's no half star and they deserve higher than 3 stars.

44.description: Just amazing, cheesy and just - amazing

24.description: Greatest pizza ever and reigning pizza champion.Nobody can touch Italian Fiesta,but nobody is perfect.They delivery and customer service r FUCKED UP.OH WELL THATS LIFE,u either get bold pizza somewhere else with great service or get the best pizza with ghetto service.Dont get me wrong im ghetto,we all r,but u dont mix ghetto and business,LOL

7.description: The best thin crust pizza in Chicago, maybe the world. lol. For Chicagoans its our birth right...Be clear, you may catch tude when picking up or ordering your Pizza. Don't expect caring and polite customer service. I got a tip to order double sausage, say what! It was off the chain. Eat here on cheat day! Eat here regularly and you'll clog your arteries...lol...no for real! lol

49.description: Oh Italian Fiesta, I just love your kooky charms.  The whole angry order taking thing, the cash-only situation.  The ghetto ambiance of putting your money in bullet-proof plexiglass in exchange for food.  The shady characters lurking outside the neighboring GameStop and Spin Cycle.All is forgiven once I get you in my mouth.  You are salty, you are greasy and you are oh-so-delicious.  Damn if this isn't the second best pizza I have ever eaten in my 44 years on this planet (the best was out of a mobile pizza oven truck in southern France, but I digress)...  Don't go changing, Italian Fiesta.  I love you just the way you are.

40.description: The interior is pretty sparse, just some folding chairs where you can wait for your take-out (only) pizza while it's being prepped behind the bulletproof glass through which you place your order. When I visited, the glass was spidered from a small-caliber bullet. Interestingly, the shot seems to have been fired from inside the kitchen. Anyhow, some of the best pizza I have ever had in Chicago, or anywhere else. Not Chicago style, or New York style, but Midwestern style: Thin, lightly-dusted, crisp flaky crust, cut in squares, with slightly sweet sauce.  This is said to be Obama's favorite pizza, and they don't let you forget it, either.

53.description: This place was horrible!!! My friend and I ordered one pizza for the Bears/Packers game, after being on hold for 11 mins we got through to order the pizza, they said it was going to be an hour and a half wait. The game finished in 2 hours and still no pizza, so we called and they said the pizza had just left the shop. We called back after 15 mins, and a different employee said our pizza never left the shop! Obviously we told them to forget, the game was over by now and then at 7 oclock at night (5 hours later!!) The pizza guy calls and says to come outside and get my pizza... yeah right. I don't care what the pizza tastes like the service is a joke!!!

30.description: I absolutely miss Italian Fiesta pizza. It was my favorite pizza in Hyde Park. My order was always thin mushroom & ground beef. Been thinking about their pizza alot lately, there really are no awesome pizza joints in Cali and wish I could buy Italian Fiesta pizza from the grocery freezer, I would be one happy camper. But till then I'll have to wait until my next visit to Chicago to fill up my pizza crave.

46.description: I've been to this location several times! The pizza is always  hot, fresh and delicious but the staff is not professional at all! ...Also, they only take cash and expect a long wait.

1.description: This pizza used to be 5 stars great.  It has gone way down and the prices way UP.   On more than one occasion I've ordered a pizza and it wasn't ready when I got there.  Or it was sloppy and I wasn't gonna wait 30 min for them to make me another. One time I ordered and requested to pick up from one location and they'd made it at another!  In fairness the lady gave me a couple single slices that had my topping as a consolation. I think they need to slow down and stop hastily throwing together pizzas; stop running their mouths and pay attention.   They should also take credit cards and online ordering.

55.description: This place cracks me up. Italians don't have fiestas! And plus, this would not be the place to have one -- it's a Maxwell Street hole in the wall in a southern Kenwood strip mall. No seating whatsoever, inside or out. And don't take the Obama patronage TOO seriously; people always love to support local biz in the neighborhoods where they cut their teeth. I'm going to talk about the Italian beef. I'm sure the pizza is fine and dandy, but there's a million places to get pizza in Chicago, even in Kenwood/Hyde Park. But this Italian beef is a monster. They offer great au jus options, and if you order it with cheese they will armor the whole thing with an impenetrable layer of mozzarella. The peppers are hot, and there are probably two pounds of beef in this thing. It is A LOT to handle for like 6-7$. Beware that they do nickel-and-dime you for cheese, peppers, etc., so have some extra money on hand after you look at the initial menu price.They do deliver, although it will take a while (they tell you that, though).

9.description: The reason why it is not possible to provide a five star rating is because of the order takers- absolutely the worst customer service known to man. I am usually great with getting people to soften there tone, but nothing helped this order taker. I have a humble suggestion if someone says hello how are you...you reply -- well and yourself. If someone says thank you..the universal reply is-- you are welcome or most recently, no problem. Have a goodnight is usually  ..you also, thanks, thank you and not click. .lolItalian Fiesta has continued to be good pizza over the years an the ingredients work. I understand that businesses are trying to cut expenses, but investing in the order takers will be a worthwhile investment because I almost canceled the pizza and I am certain there are other customers who have felt the same way.

26.description: Went back to this location shortly after my last reviewand got my regular ground beef pizza.  When I got home and proceeded to eat a slice the meat tatsed funny. Upon further inspection, I noticed the meat was not cooked well and some pieces weren't just pink, but "bloody" red!  called them immediately and the girl that picked up said, and I quote " What do you want us to do?" I wanted to say "Kill yourself for that bad a$$ attitude" but I didn't.  I hung up on her rude tail and drove back up there with my undercooked bio-hazard pizza and the same chick that answered the phone is up there and she tells me while fluttering her fake lashes, "Do you want another pizza" and I wanted to tell her I want her to play in traffic, but I did not.  I got my refund and haven't been back to this place.  I now go to their other location on 71st street and no longer have these kinds of issues.

25.description: Bad. It was once pretty good but now they overcharge for a pizza with hardly any toppings.

12.description: I really like the pizza from here. I've heard people ordering everything on their pizza from steak to shrimp toppings but I always get the cheese and always enjoy it.

59.description: Well, Mr. Barack Obama.  You seem to really inspire people with your grass roots stories of being a community leader on the South Side of Chicago.  In fact, your 'Change We Can Believe In' Campaign and 'Yes We Can' speeches had more people crying than you see at the average funeral or Hugh Grant Flick.  You're a good basketball player, but you'd be even better if you didn't smoke so many GD cigarettes.  You seem to be a fairly common man, so in the spirit of that, I had to try your favorite pizza joint before I left Chicago.  Barack, between us, I'm glad I did.  You know a damn good pizza.  Italian Fiesta Pizzeria is not far from Mr. Obama's Hyde Park Home, it's stuck in a strip mall over on 47th.  You cannot eat there, it's strictly to go (or maybe they deliver).  And the place is a dump, I was wondering what I was getting myself into when I ordered and waited 35 minutes for my pizza.  It's dirty, there are questionable people coming in and out, but it's worth the wait for the pizza.  The pizza is excellent, really excellent in my opinion.  I got a 10 inch (or close to) sausage pizza, and the sausage was spicy, the sauce was tangy, and it was very tasty.  It was a truly wonderful pizza, and being Barack's local pizza joint, I could see how he could build an addiction to these pizzas (and then I imagine he puked them back up since he's all of 6-3, 114 pounds or something it seems?).  Anyways, I kept mine down and I'm happy I did.  The one drawback is it's not too cheap.  I think my personal pizza cost me about 9 bucks.  If I'm ever in the area again, which is a bit of a longshot (unless Barack and Michelle invite me over for cocktails after they leave Washington), I'd visit Italian Fiesta Pizzeria.  If you choose your next cabinet like you choose your pizza, Mr. Obama, I see 4 more years in your future.

21.description: It's right down the block from me and I love it.If you've been on the south side for more than 60 seconds, you know about Italian Fiesta.  It's one of those real good, sodium-infused pizza joints.  Best to have some of this pizza on a night where you have been drinking a lot, but I digress.....The location is cash-only so don't bring your debit or credit card.  The pizza (sausage and cheese) was excellent.  One person can finish off a small pizza on their own if they are really hungry (I've done it).  The food was fresh and hot.  Oh did I mention that it was real good?Haven't tried their delivery yet, but I've heard from other Yelpers that it can be a bit slow on busy weekends.

17.description: I live 5 mins from the Hyde Park location and I've had Italian Fiesta from at least four of the locations and although the pizza it good, customer service is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE at the Hyde Park location.  The last two times that I ordered a pizza for delivery, they told me it would take "up to 2 hours".  The first time it was 3 and a half hours later and for the second time, it took 2 hours 45 mins.  It's just not worth it to get it delivered.  I was pissed and really really hungry by the time I got it and the manager says nothing but "they should be ringing the bell any minute m'aam" which makes you even more angry.

10.description: Pizza was OK but not worth the hour and 15 minute wait in the restaurant. Forget about delivery, it will take at least an hour and 30 minutes and your pizza will be cold when you get it. I called the restaurant three times to get and update on the 45 minutes they told me it would take because I live less than a mile from the Hyde Park location. They won't get my business again.

5.description: Even though the order taker is rude and delivery is slow, that hot and ugly mess of a pizza is delicious! You will eat the whole darn thing, even when you're no longer hungry, it's that freaking good. Do yourself a favor and get one of their pizzas, you'll thank yourself.

3.description: Define crapshoot and you'll see a picture of Italian Fiesta.  Much like the other location on 71st, its the same here.  It's where great pizza meets poor service.   So my recommendation for anyone ordering from here the 1st time is to order on a weekday where the wait times aren't nearly as long.  I recently ordered on a Wednesday and my pizza was ready in 30 mins.  Previous to that I ordered on a Friday and was told an hour.   And I pretty much advise everyone to forget delivery or you'll be waiting forever.  Large pizza is pretty much $20 with one topping but when it's hot, it's well worth it.  Just hope you're lucky with decent service.  CASH ONLY!

35.description: If I judge on JUST the pizza, it is the best pizza period. I grew up on it and compare it to every pizza I eat. I miss it because I don't live in Chicago anymore. If I was judging on decor and service then it would be a three-star, maybe. But the pizza is damn good to me and I would eat it everyday (in my fat kid voice).

19.description: The pizza is good , but the customer service and delivery is HORRIBLE!!! Talked to Luisa , the manger who is trying to justify why it takes 3hours for a pizza to be delivered within a 6 block radius. REALLY??? The driver claimed he could not find the location ( the Police Dept). I think he was lazy and just didn't try ...smh

28.description: I agree with GR that this is more like a strong 3.5 star place. The pizza - overall - is one of the closest things you can get to a NY slice in a city that otherwise is confused about what pizza actually is. Don't ask for delivery if you can help it, as it might take forever and a day or will get to you room temperature. But, if you can stop in to pick up a pie yourself, it's definitely worth the pretty affordable prices. I used to especially love going here when doing a laundry marathon at the Spin Cycle next door.

45.description: The "grease-eria" on 80th and Halsted is disgusting. And I am questioning their health inspection rating and overall ability to make delicious pizza. For a company that boasts such great history and patrons, I can not believe what is being served at this location. Is this a franchise, with independent franchise owners? If so, I can tell because it is not operated at all like the other locations. Someone has dropped the ball, severely. The food is extremely greasy, and sure, I like a good slice but the amount of grease in one square, thin crust slice should be illegal. What is happening here? Will I choose this location, or recommend it to friends..which is the best marketing (word of mouth)? As my rating says, "Eek! Methinks not."

33.description: ordered a pepperoni pizza here a few weeks ago while my girl & i were doing laundry next door at spin cycle. it was good thin crust pizza.its not a big place where u can sit down & eat there. good pizza around this area so would come back if im around here again.

43.description: IFP, I love you, you are the crack of pizza.  I drive from the south loop to pick you up and start eating right out of the box on the way home.  This pizza is amazingly delicious, a thin, non cracker like crust, spicy sauce and loads of cheese.  The pizza is so delicious that I am willing to put up with mumble mouth order takers when I call, cash only, rude cashiers and a pizza that was possibly cut by a blind man with scissors.

2.description: Use to be pretty good tried the 47th location and was very disappointed about the taste and price guess I'll go back to the 81st and halted location

18.description: The pizza is delicious, but really expensive. The service is awful.

41.description: Like most people said already - the pizza is very good.  I especially like when you get a bite without cheese or toppings around the edge so that you can taste how good the sauce is.  My only gripe is the cost.  A large 2 topping will run you about $20 which seems ridiculous considering it is a thin crust.Since not too many people mention anything other than the pizza, I thought I'd I say something about the spicy wings, which are also pretty good.  They are fried and are the smaller drummy size.  They've got good flavor and a nice subtle heat.  Get them with the blue cheese - it's the best!Overall, I like Italian Fiesta.  The food is good, price a little high, and service is average to poor... but I'll go back.Lastly I wanted to mention the stupid frequent customer promotion they have:  Buy 16 pizzas (yes, I said 16), clip off the little promo circles on the box, and redeem for $5 off.  That's a lot of pizzas for just $5 off.

52.description: Great Pizza.....better than Giordano's, Beggars, Uno's, and California Kitchen. However a very close race with Home Run Inn.

50.description: The pizza, as others have said, is either great or iffy. It's truly a matter of probability, but more often than not it leans towards being pretty darn good.It's thin crust and the ingredients are flavorful. No, it won't ever trounce NYC pizza... even if you were completely drunk, but it's the best pizza you can get south of the loop that delivers to Hyde Park. I've never been to the actual location so I don't know how sketch it is, but it's worked for me.The people answering the phone are direct. By NY standards this is normal. People in the midwest expect more courtesy over the phone... this is more than understandable. It also takes a long time to arrive. But hey, just order 90 minutes in advance of when you usually would order.

4.description: There was a time circa 2006 where I was always in Hyde Park and my friend would almost always order Italian Fiesta Pizza. I always enjoyed it, but it was usually a bit greasy for my taste.Fast forward to last night, I was hanging with this same friend in Hyde Park and the word Italian Fiesta came up while we were drinking. We decided to order a large sausage pepperoni and mushroom. We called and they told us it would take an hour and a half for delivery. We were hungry and those terms were unacceptable so I decided to go pick up. They told us pick up would be 30 minutes so not sure where the additional hour came from in the delivery time as we were only a 5-7 minute drive away. I've actually never been inside of the place as I have always gotten delivery. Nothing special about it as you are separated from the staff and the kitchen by big ass glass. They slide the pizza through an opening at the bottom of the glass as well as the $ exchange. When you walk in the door you will see the hand written sign that says CASH ONLY! FYI!!!Once we made it back to my friend's place we noticed the pepperoni was not added but that was cool as sausage and mushroom was fine. This is still the greasiest pizza around but its still pretty good as well.

6.description: TERRIBLE SERVICE called at 530 was told an hour. Called after an hour was told it was out for delivery 15 to 20 min tops. 2 hrs later and an ice cold pizza comes and its been turned upside down. Called manager and was given excuses about lateness. DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE IF YOU HUNGRY.

22.description: We order from this location quite often. We've never had a bad pizza. We also get their chicken dinners and hot wings. Food has always been fresh. I grew up on 71 and we use to go to the one on 71 all the time. I still say 71 is the best, but this location is gd too. Only down fall is if it's a busy night and you order deliver, it will take a while. They need to upgrade from cash only!

15.description: Saucy, greasy, nice thin crust. Always cut funny but that's okay. Makes eating it fun. Cash only but they deliver!

57.description: It used to be good...until:a) the service got badb) the pizza got badc) the waiting time got badAnswer? ALL OF THE ABOVE. Who wants to order a pizza from a woman (whether in-store or over the phone) with a stank attitude. Sorry honey, but you're not taking my order with that tone.Who wants to wait an hour and a half for a pizza to be delivered (that sometimes arrives cold btw)? The pizza doesn't even taste as good as it used to.New places, like Gianna's Pizza and Beggars Pizza are on the south side. They are better and taking the spotlight. People are starting to notice. They just aren't good.

20.description: The prices are high, and the customer service is terrible. But it is hands down the best pizza I've ever had. I only get it once in awhile as a treat to myself when I feel like spending the money,  and it is amazing. Be prepared to pay $$ and deal with bad attitudes.  It'll be worth it in the end!

36.description: More like a strong 31/2 but not enough over the half to go fours stars. Some of the reviews here are on target, a good solid thin crust pizza, with just enough of a grease factor and a nice crisp crust, no layer of dough under the sauce. Mushrooms were fresh and the sausage had good texture and the required amount of fennel. We wanted to try something new, didn't want to go to Lina's, or Lou's both I still like, but enough already. Not in the mood to drive to my two favorites Marie's or Golden Crust.Parking is easy they're in the lot on the south side of 47th. and Lake Park, just off the drive. Which leads me to my first thought when I pulled up, I thought, "oh no strip mall pizza, I could have just gone to Little Cesar's and it would have been closer." I pulled up in a front parking spot and was able to read all their signage, cash only, no credit or debit cards, some other mumbo jumbo about being patient because your order may take awhile, and another sign about having to return uneaten portions to get credit for a replacement order. Lots of negativity. Yes, you do put your cash in a little metal tray installed in the bullet proof glass, reminds me of Harold's Chicken or Lem's. I know it's the south side, but really now do we have to get all our take out from behind bullet proof glass? I know they say this is where Obama gets his pizza from, my guess is it's because there are not that many places to choose from around here, I will concede that the north side has an abundance of pizza choices. Who knows, maybe we'll open up a place, they say find a need, well there is room for a few pizza joints anywhere from 26th. to 47th. east of Michigan Ave.We're swearing off pizza for a while, to get back on our healthy eating track, so as far as going back, no need to decide on that now.

14.description: We order from this location quite often. We've never had a bad pizza. We also get their chicken dinners and hot wings. Food has always been fresh. I grew up on 71 and we use to go to the one on 71 all the time. I still say 71 is the best, but this location is gd too. Only down fall is if it's a busy night and you order deliver, it will take a while. They need to upgrade from cash only!

1.description: one stop can be very scary for some people, the building is old and not the cleanest grocery store & you can buy bootleg movies and cds and loose cigarettes outside but the prices make the trip worthwhile. I go there mainly for canned goods and frozen items. they also have pretty good deals on quality meats. just be careful

2.description: I am not a big fan of grocery shopping but I try to find good deals whenever i can. I must say, One Stop Food & Liqours is worth the trip. They sell items by the case or individually but the prices are less than anywhere else for a lot of items.   A half gallon of milk for 89 cents or 79 cents for a dozen of large eggs is perfect for someone shopping on a budget or just looking to save a few dollars a month.  I found huge cans of ravioli for $1.29 or smaller ones for 2 for 89 cents.  For your next bar-b-cue, purchase 40 lbs of meat for $35! It includes ribs, polish sausage, chicken wings and more.  Take a chance and go to One Stop Food & Liquour.  You won't regret it!

0.description: My go to place to buy Peach Vess!!!!!If you know somebody from St Louis, please tell them that this is the place to go in case they need a fix.

29.description: I liked this place. I ordered a Szechuan eggplant that was good, but very, very greasy. The sushi was pretty good as well. I can definitely say that I had enough food to last me for 4 days. Not expensive, and quick delivery.

42.description: This is an amazing Chinese place.  By far this is the best in the neighborhood.  The delivery was right on time and was made by a very cheerful gentleman even on the coldest night of this winter.  I was very impressed with all the high quality fresh vegetables and meats used in the dishes we ordered.  Well done, De Rice.JD

23.description: Absolutely love the food here, and to think I couldn't fine good Chinese food in Hyde Park.I've always ordered food never ate at the place itself but the service is so fast and efficient. They are always kind enough to bring change, and of course the delivery person is so well mannered, and nice, that it makes me feel like this restaurant definitely goes out of it's way for their customer service satisfaction. I ordered the following items: crab ragoon, spicy salmon maki, vegetable fried rice, crispy egg noodles with chicken and veggies, general two chicken, and beef in black bean sauce. All in small sizes, and this portions were huge!! Also they provide such lovely containers for the food, which are reusable. Crab ragoon was good and extremely well filled, however a little too much cream cheese and less of the crab. But crispy! Spicy salmon maki was a bit disappointing, didn't seem fresh and it didn't look to appetizing. However, it tasted fine but not spicy at all. Vegetable fried rice was excellent. Well cooked and not too much soy sauce like some places but the perfect amount. Something I would order again. Crispy egg noodles with chicken and veggies was great as well. Tasted really good and included lots of veggies and chicken. The general tai chicken was delicious! My only complaint is that I wish it was a bit crispier that's all. But I would definitely recommend this. And my absolute favourite and highly recommended dish is the beef in black bean sauce. This is just excellent; great flavours and great tasting. Beef slices are cooked well, the veggies are good, and the black bean sauce is just exquisite. I recommend people try this place! Especially if you're living in Hyde Park, since we are very limited to good food especially in the Chinese cuisine.

8.description: Food is mediocre. Nothing to get too excited about. I ordered the orange chicken and it had a distinct fryer oil aftertaste- it makes me think that they leave the oil in their deep fryer longer than they should. Their boba drinks are delicious.

31.description: Ordered a vegetarian dish for delivery, and it came with meat in it.

34.description: The food is definitely better than your standard chinese food  (especially in hyde park). but man. they are the nicest people in the area. they are always willing to give recommendations (that are good and in line of what you're generally looking for). that delivery guy. he's the nicest guy in the world. loves to have a conversation. he also always smiles and always says "i hope you have a nice dinner".  really the nicest delivery guy in the world.

16.description: Best Chinese food in hyde park by far, and they deliver!! Loved my Mongolian beef! Shrimp rice, Cantonese egg rolls all delicious!

13.description: De Rice is the best (cheap) Chinese food outside of Chinatown in Chicago. I've been to the physical store on 47th, although with delivery only $3.00, I've more often bought massive quantities of food to sustain me over the week. Every time I order from them, I get the Jumbo Chicken Fried Rice, which is a steal--that alone is two meals'' worth of food (the Pineapple Chicken fried rice uses the pineapple, as opposed to soy sauce, to provide flavor, which isn't very effective). The scallion pancake is best in my opinion without meat, and I've begun calling the nameless sauce it's served with Crack. I've had some misses here, the Singapore noodles among them (even though my boyfriend loved it, so your mileage may vary), but I've always been incredibly satisfied with my meal. Other recommendations: Broccoli in Garlic Sauce, Eggplant in Szechuan Sauce, Crab Rangoon (if you don't have to move in the next 12 hours), and Peking Duck. The black mushrooms with baby cabbage was one of my least favorite dishes, but it was probably just because I wasn't familiar with the taste of that particular (gamey) mushroom.

11.description: Crab Rangoon was delicious but everything is was blah. If I order again I would only get the crab Ragoon.

39.description: Pretty good food for a local place.  If you are in the area and craving Chinese food check it out.  I have yet to really explore the menu.  I have only tried the Chinese.  I will check out the Japanese food and re-review, but for now it's only a 2-star...

37.description: I will give this place four stars for two reasons (1) its probably the best Chinese food you're going to get in Hyde Park and (2) their delivery driver is the nicest person ever. They're also super fast.The food itself is alright. Their crab rangoon is pretty freaking delicious. Their eggrolls have the strangest texture to them (like cat food), so I would steer clear of that. Out of everything I ordered, their fried rice has been my favorite... but I will say, its not super consistent. When I ordered the BBQ pork fried rice it was pretty much what you'd expect, but when I ordered the Hawaiian fried rice, I'm not sure it was even fried... it was more like plain white rice with stuff in it (it still tasted great, and even better when I fried it myself the next day with some soy sauce). Everything else I've ordered has been good. Not amazing, but edible, which if you see my review for Wok N Roll, that's not always a given in Hyde Park. Needless to say, as long as I live in Hyde Park, this will be my go-to spot.

0.description: Their sweet and sour chicken is absolutely delicious. They have a great lunch combo but no type of dinner combo, so I took a star away. Other than that, great food for take out.

38.description: Below average chinese food. It is edible but not super satisfying or delicious.  The employees are very nice, and the portions were very large.  The fried rice was soaked in soy sauce.

27.description: Great Hyde Park Delivery!Just wanted to give a quick review of De Rice. It's good, solid delivery for Hyde Park.  The food is prepared fresh (at least everything that I've had). The quality is consistent, delivery is quick and reasonably priced. Personally, I love the MooShu Chicken, the green beans and the hot and sour soup, but other menu items have been good. I've order their maki rolls and have been happy with them - not high end, but fresh and good and the spring rolls are great. The only think I don't like is their fried tofu dishes as the tofu is more chewy than crispy.   Anyway, if you are in the mood for carry out - it's the place to order from.  Also, as most reviewers noted - the delivery guy is super nice.So, do it - order from them!

32.description: Super friendly staff and decent grub. We only ordered delivery but the delivery man and the woman I spoke to on the phone were incredibly kind and helpful. Now, normally if we want Chinese food we go to Chinatown, but sometimes we are lazy.  Or tired. Or we are depressed because it's gloomy and -20 outside with the windchill. In such cases there's no way in hell that we're getting off the couch to go anywhere to eat dinner... and that's where De Rice delivery comes in.

44.description: Not sure why this place has not been Yelped more, but I will add my two cents. Good food. Fast. Friendly delivery guys and the person on the phone that takes the order is actually patient and friendly (hate to say it, but that is RARE with Chinese takeout restaurants in Chicago).Good variety of options and they serve large portions, though you may want to ask for more rice as they give you an itty bitty teeny carton of rice unless you ask for more.Beef and Brocoli is awesome and the Fried Rice with Chicken has HUGE pieces of chicken breast.

24.description: Food is amazing, only restaurant in the Bronzeville-Hyde Park-Bridgeport area that dares deliver to my area without crackhead delivery fees. Portions are fairly large for price. Crab Rangoon is absolutely AMAZING, and so is fried chicken (best in the area, IMO). Also, best won ton soup. Customer service is A+++. They may not be the fastest but they always make sure to explain to you and comp you accordingly, should any issues arise. Delivery guy is the nicest guy ever. Overall, sweet spot.

7.description: Mediocre and disappointing. The sauces were glue-like and generic. The hot and sour soup was inedible. Service was lackluster - we were the only customers and still had a hard time getting water. On the plus side, portion sizes of lunch specials were large.

40.description: Love the Hawaiian fried rice. I tried and love the light texture of the rice and believe it or not. This taste great with pineapple.

30.description: Really good food and very nice people. Worth the money for sure.

1.description: I only really eat here because there isn't any decent Asian cuisine delivery in Hyde park. The foods decent I've had their pot stickers( too much pastry to meat ratio with average dipping sauces), Pad Thai (not bad but not great), and the orange chicken is really orangey.

9.description: Absolutely love the food here, and to think I couldn't fine good Chinese food in Hyde Park.I've always ordered food never ate at the place itself but the service is so fast and efficient. They are always kind enough to bring change, and of course the delivery person is so well mannered, and nice, that it makes me feel like this restaurant definitely goes out of it's way for their customer service satisfaction. I ordered the following items: crab ragoon, spicy salmon maki, vegetable fried rice, crispy egg noodles with chicken and veggies, general two chicken, and beef in black bean sauce. All in small sizes, and this portions were huge!! Also they provide such lovely containers for the food, which are reusable. Crab ragoon was good and extremely well filled, however a little too much cream cheese and less of the crab. But crispy! Spicy salmon maki was a bit disappointing, didn't seem fresh and it didn't look to appetizing. However, it tasted fine but not spicy at all. Vegetable fried rice was excellent. Well cooked and not too much soy sauce like some places but the perfect amount. Something I would order again. Crispy egg noodles with chicken and veggies was great as well. Tasted really good and included lots of veggies and chicken. The general tai chicken was delicious! My only complaint is that I wish it was a bit crispier that's all. But I would definitely recommend this. And my absolute favourite and highly recommended dish is the beef in black bean sauce. This is just excellent; great flavours and great tasting. Beef slices are cooked well, the veggies are good, and the black bean sauce is just exquisite. I recommend people try this place! Especially if you're living in Hyde Park, since we are very limited to good food especially in the Chinese cuisine.

26.description: De Rice catered a lunchtime fundraiser at our university, and it was phenomenal! The food sold out within an hour, and people loved it. They provided Orange Chicken, Chicken Fried Rice, Vegetable Egg Rolls, and Crab Rangoon. The Orange Chicken was incredible -- cooked just right, perfect texture. The orange sauce with chilis was a great mix of sweet and spicy. I'd definitely have it again.I didn't get to try the Chicken Fried Rice, but it looked great. Big chunks of chicken, good amount of vegetables. Looking forward to trying this in the future.The Egg Rolls were awesome, very tasty and substantial. Looked and tasted homemade -- I highly recommend them.The owners were extremely helpful and wonderful to work with. They had the food ready precisely when they said they would, right on time. I wouldn't hesitate to go there again, whether for a large catering event or dinner with my wife.

25.description: lychee shrimp is yummy! I try something different everytime- have yet to be disappointed

12.description: First time trying De Rice and I got delivery. The driver was very nice, and on time exactly. Had a nice short conversation while filling out the receipt and warranted a nice tip. I ordered the Potstickers, Crab Rangoon, and Chicken fried rice. Crab Rangoon was cooked nicely, and a very good helping of filling to boot. Only thing is these were slightly on the sweeter side so I couldn't really eat them all myself. Potstickers were good as well, not too oily but could use a bit more meat inside them. Rice was great! Minimal oil used and flavor was good. Included some good veggies that helped add to the flavor. Will definitely order again!!

21.description: WARNING: this review is sushi biased!!!!I mean... I was really disappointed in myself for eating the rice because Im PALEO and all. However it was worth the sugar headache. It was good AF. Please excuse my F.

17.description: Just ate here tonight for the first time and the food was fresh, delicious and reasonably priced! $22 filled up 2 adults and 2 kids. They also made my son a special gluten free dish that he really enjoyed. Great service and great food.

10.description: Should have written this A long time ago. Back when I was pregnant I couldn't eat a darn thing. I had hyperemesis gravidarium and could keep nothing down. Not even water. Well I had a craving for Chinese food... and well, chinese food at other places wouldn't stay down.But Derice?? LOVED it. The only food my pregnant self could keep down. Their Hawaiian fried rice and crab rangoon kept me and my baby alive! now my son is 3.. and I still come back. Love it! FAV chinese food place in Hyde Park!

5.description: I honestly can't say enough good things about this place. I love the food, they always deliver on time, and their driver is one of the friendliest guys. Their crab Rangoon is a bit sweet (which I love) and there is a large amount of stuffing. Their orange chicken is real and amazing, and so is their Szechuan chicken. I think a lot of their dishes might be a bit sweeter and Americanized, but I love them. The only thing I wasn't too keen on was the Hunan beef, but I only got it once so I might need to try it again. I order from De Rice like once a week. It's addicting.

35.description: So I am obsessed with fried rice ... OBSESSED .... seriously.De Rice has the best fried rice in Hyde Park. That's the bottom line. The combination "De Rice Fried Rice" is delicious and has tons of all the different meats. But my go-to is the Shrimp Fried Rice which is equally delicious, generous on shrimp, and slightly cheaper than the combination.Hubby also loves the Chicken and Broccoli stir fry. For a buck extra I also get some crispy noodles to munch on all day/night. Crab Rangoon and egg-rolls are both perfectly acceptable and the Fried Chicken Wings are large and quite good. Best part is that they are consistent. Everything tastes like it should, every time you order.The delivery guys are great - friendly and super-quick.A note on the competition: Nicky's has it's moments, but is WAY overzealous on the soy sauce most times. Not worth the risk.Wok 'n Roll is fine for a cheap lunch special, but you have to eat everything while it's hot because, much like McDonald's fries, after 15 minutes or so, it turns into packing peanuts.

19.description: lychee shrimp is yummy! I try something different everytime- have yet to be disappointed

28.description: Portions: large.Prices: low.Service: great.Ambiance: not what I go there for.Neighborhood: Kenwood not HPThis is a great delivery & take-away place, but not somewhere you would want to go for a romantic date.  There are other places for that.  Where you'll pay an arm & a leg, I might add.The food is prepared to order.  There is at least one misspelling on their take-away menu: a sure-fire sign that the food is legit in my book.For simple, fresh, well-prepared asian cuisine, this is de spot.

3.description: I'm really trying to find decent non greasy yet flavorful Chinese food in Hyde Park. I'm afraid I have to keep looking. Really quick, the veggie fried rice is really good according to my boyfriend. It had a variety of vegetables and the rice wasn't greasy at all. The problem? No flavor!!! My jumbo shrimp fried rice had peas, carrots and no bean sprouts!!! I really don't think peas and carrots belong in fried rice but what do I know. I may go back and try something else but this place isn't on my fav list.

33.description: Decent food, inexpensive, and what you expect for inexpensive chinese food. We are from Oregon and had a craving for americanized chinese food. Egg fu young in Oregon, is green potato like patties with weird yellow cream gravy (seriously, you won't find the real thing in Oregon). However, at De Rice, the Egg Fu Young was great and the gravy was spot on ~ nice to have an old east coast favorite! Tasty, salty, not too spicy and not too greasy either. Food reheats well and we are impressed given all the negative reviews of chinese food in Hyde Park. I think this may be the hidden chinese gem in Hyde Park. Veggies were fresh too. Not amazing, but solidly good, clean, fresh. Thank you.

43.description: De Rice should put Nicky's and Wok N Roll out of business. It's quite good, in relative terms - i.e., given its location, Hyde Park, and thus its meager competition.Each crab rangoon was over-stuffed with cheese-crab filling - a problem I wish I had more often.The General Tao's chicken was hot and crisp, with fresh red and green peppers, and sauce with character (unlike the mystery goop at Nicky's). To repeat, all of my praise is to be understood in relative terms.The Singapore Vermicelli was amazing, but I don't have anything with which to compare it, which is a shame because it was even better than the Gen Tao's. On the other hand, if you've ever experimented with a noodle stir fry and curry powder, the dish will ring familiar, which makes it disappointing to some.The delivery was super fast.After several orders, it is worth noting that the dishes are hit and miss. The mango beef is very good, as is the black pepper beef. My roommates love the dumplings. The watermelon smoothie is delicious.Yet, the garlic lovers dish is mediocre (despite fresh ingredients and real garlic, which I usually love), and most of what comes in the 2-person combo special is hard to eat. The eggrolls have a strange chalky taste, and, despite tasting okay, the spare ribs have a funny smell which indicates that they have been frozen for too long. The strawberry chicken is a failure. Hyde Park finally has decent Chinese take-out (it always did, i just didn't realize it). Compared to the competition, De Rice is a Hyde Park standout, my criticisms notwithstanding.

2.description: Everytime I order from here, I get exactly what I want. Best crab ragoon!!!!! It's not fried hard with a teaspoon of filling. It's made right. For those who say it's too much filling, hey I'd rather have too much and get what I paid for. The beef was tender and not chewy in the fried rice. The fried rice was not greasy and I like that they can make any dish spicy. My egg roll, again made right, not greasy and enough filling where you can actually taste the veggies. I love their shrimp fried rice. They are well mannered, as this is one of the only asian establishments in this neighborhood that has employees who don't have attitudes, yell at you when you make a substitute request or roll their eyes when you ask for extra utensils or napkins. Delivery is fast and my food was hot when it arrived.  This place is great!

18.description: Really good food & fine prices. Coming from the east coast, I've had the hardest time finding really good, Americanized Chinese food... and these guys put my east coast favorites to shame. Their crab rangoon is awesome! I have pretty much only stuck with the sweet & sour chicken, but recently tried the chive pancakes. They were excellent & the sauce it came with was incredible. Delivery time is good & the folks on the phone & in the store are very nice.

41.description: Lots of food for the price. Not the best food, but not bad. It's pretty good the next day, so good leftovers place.

4.description: First off, i'm chinese and i'm very picky about my "chinese" fast food. De Rice just delivered my order and i couldn't be happier! Portions are HUGE and the way my pepper beef was cooked reminds me of home. Good work, De Rice!

6.description: first of all ,the food was AMAZING - the beef was succulent, noodles Tasty- it was all good!also the service was excellent- nothing was found wanting !!! would always order here when we come to Chicago!

22.description: These guys are amazing! Really quick, not the hands down greatest good but really does the job when you're hungry and don't feel like cooking. Prices are very reasonable and they have the nicest delivery guys on the planet. They remember you too! Special shout out to the crab Rangoon!

15.description: I was pretty disappointed in the food from de rice, especially after all the awesome reviews! I ordered delivery and they arrived way before expected, which was great. I ordered crab rangoons, sweet and sour chicken, hot and sour soup with fried noodles, an egg roll, and shrimp fried rice. The crab rangoons were not as crispy (could've been due to the delivery, though), and they were way too full of a creamy substance. I intentionally say creamy substance because it was unlike any cream cheese I've ever seen (very slimy and barely any crab). The sweet and sour chicken was very dry and looked/tasted like it was old. The soup was pretty good, some of the fried noodles were stale, though. The egg roll was perfectly fried, but the inside was filled with some unidentifiable substance...definitely wasn't chicken and/or vegetables (although, I did detect some cabbage). The shrimp fried rice was probably the best thing I ordered, I actually finished all of it and they gave me a pretty large amount even though it was part of the lunch special. I like that they give shrimp fried rice with the lunch special instead of white rice or plain fried rice. I wouldn't recommend this place and I'm not much of a picky eater when it comes to Chinese food.

20.description: Really tasty, seemingly good quality chinese. We were happy with our experience, the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it took TWO HOURS for the delivery to reach my home, less than a mile away. Kind of ridiculous... no? Besides that, we were quite satisfied and will order again.

36.description: Great tasting food, nice people and fast delivery--what else can you ask for?  After years of settling for all of the other Asian delivery options in Hyde Park, we only are ordering from De Rice.

14.description: WARNING: this review is sushi biased!!!!I mean... I was really disappointed in myself for eating the rice because Im PALEO and all. However it was worth the sugar headache. It was good AF. Please excuse my F.

28.description: BEST Turkey Burger I've had in MY LIFE! I am not a huge fan of turkey burgers. I have to have a taste for something different to want one. I received one of their flyers in the mail for the Butter Crusted Turkey Burger, fries and a fountain drink for $5.99. I believe this is also a special they have during the week for lunch. Anyway, I needed to use the coupon before it expired. So, hungover and hungry, I went today to order. I had been previously and had ordered the deep fried turkey wing and that was just okay. I was too overwhelmed by the seasoning on the wing. I took my food home and was told by my neighbor, who was passing down the stairs, that my food smelled incredibly good. At this point, I was excited because I was thinking if she could smell it, it had to be good. I unwrapped my burger, which was neatly prepared with the perfect amount of condiments and veggies, to see that this patty was thick. I usually get nervous with thick patties because the meat is too much for me but I took a bite of this burger and my entire schema of life was changed! The toppings stayed on top of the patty. This WHEAT bun was amazingly delicious. This turkey patty was seasoned by the gods. I felt a tear well in my eye when I got down to the last two bites. I took one bite and finished off the fries, which they give you plenty, and stared at that final bite. I didn't want to see it go but alas, I indulged in that last bit of turkey burger greatness. I sit here 5 minutes after dreaming about my next trip.

1.description: "Riddle me this Batman" Who eats an Italian Beef (Turkey in this case) without peppers???In an effort to try and make a little bit better of a healthier choice, I patronize Just Turkey.  I order an Italian Turkey for myself and a Small Turkey Tip for the extra hungry son.  So I pay for my food and get my receipt only to find out they charged me for the peppers!!!  WHAT FOOD JOINT CHARGES YOU FOR PEPPERS ON AN ITALIAN (WHATEVER) SANDWICH???  The peppers are part of that sandwich.  WHO EATS THIS TYPE OF SANDWICH WITHOUT THE DAMN PEPPERS???  So I inquired about this charge and the cook says to me snide like, "yeah, we charge $.30 cents for them".  I'm like WOW!  So, I curbed my reply and just laughed.  I know better than to mess with those who prepare your food.  Another thing that got me heated is there weren't that many fries with either of the orders.What a rip off!!!  They dont just "F*uck you in the drive thru anymore, they get cha right at the counter now"  They won't get anymore of my money.I feel like "Tha Turkey".  Just chop me up, throw me on the grill, and ration me out...smdh

39.description: The burger is huge! Could use some more spices in the actual burger meat, however if you request bbq sauce in addition to everything on your burger it is really good. Without bbq sauce it's just ok. As for the turkey tips, I enjoyed them, but the smokey flavor is just not my thing, however, it is tolerable since I can't eat pork or beef tips. Good alternative for the turkey eaters.
