9.description: wanted to try something new.. so instead of going for bbq pork.. i went with bbq turkey just to see how different it is! hahai ordered the turkey tips/ link combo and the fried turkey ribs. it is something different and need time to get used to haha.. but i am not a fan at all for their bbq sauce..it doesnt have that kick to it like most places.. it was sweetish..sourish? the meat on the turkey ribs falls right off the bone and is tender.. some of the turkey tips are very chewy..  the links was very salty.. also it came with fries but was eh.. i didnt like their bbq sauce and all my food was drenched in it so that really killed it for me.. maybe ill come back and try their turkey burger or something..

29.description: havent been here in a while but i still love this place! ordered the turkey tips & nachos. everythin was delicious as i was hopin 4!  even though ive tried other things on the menu my tips are my fave so im glad they didnt fail me! wooooo hoooo!

42.description: As I stated, it's all about learning about places in my neighborhood.  After a hard bike ride, I was definitely looking for some food.  I landed upon Just Turkey by mistake.  I was totally shocked because I had ventured to another place in the neighborhood that CLAIMED they had great turkey burgers to be let down.Just Turkey is located right in Bronzeville and East Hyde Park.  There is ample seating to bring a small group of friends and offers free Wifi.  now I will say that it's hard to choose between Harolds and Just Turkey because they're essentially located next door to one another.  But the Turkey won out.  I am glad I went.The service was great and the staff was patient and helpful.  I had the Turkey Tips and another person ordered the turkey burger.  Both were very fresh and tasty.  Hey, they even served the turkey burger on a Wheat Bun.  The turkey burger was thick and juicy.  The turkey tips were pretty good as well.  One thing I like is that they didn't drown my tips in tons of bbq sauce.  Overall, the experience was great and I will certainly be heading back again for more.

23.description: Turkey Tips are cool. Not really a fan of the sauce though.

5.description: DO NOT GO HERE, TOTALLY UNPROFESSIONAL SERVICE... This particular Just Turkey is in a small strip with a nail salon (Taday Nail Spa) and a couple of other establishments. I go to the nail spa every two weeks, but on this occasion I had gotten to the shop extremely early and hadn't eaten. It was a long wait so I decided to get some food from just turkey. I call first and no one answers so I decide to walk one shop over to the actual restaurant. The sign on the door says they open at 11. It was 11:13. The door was locked, so I looked in the window and made eye contact with an employee that was sitting and eating. I waved and he just sat there staring at me, smiling in an obviously condescending way. So I went back to the shop. About twenty minutes go by and at this point if I leave the shop again I would lose my spot in line. So I call again and finally a woman answers. I ask if they would bring it over, she says yes. In an attempt to save money I only order fries and a drink. She asks if I want anything on my fries, I say mild sauce. Time passes and the delivery is made. Not only is the delivery man the sane employee I saw through the window earlier, but my bill is over $9: they charged me for the mild sauce (which was actually barbecue sauce) and I was never told I would be, and they charged me $4 delivery charge for this man to walk one shop over. Not even four yards of a distance. Unprofessional behavior and they took advantage.

31.description: Reading everyone elses positive reviews maybe I got the wrong thing. I ordered 2 Turkey Tacos. They had good flavor but they were extremely salty. The turkey spaghetti was aiight. Next time I will order a turkey burger so stay tuned!

25.description: Have had food from various locations & it's been good every time. The best turkey lasagna I've ever had, although it's a little greasy at times, it's well seasoned & flavorful. I get a pan for parties & everyone loves it.  The turkey polish is very good, & a nice size. The turkey tips just aren't for me, have tried them a few times. I love ribs & the turkey version just ain't working for me. Now if they'd put one on the northwest side, I'd be happy!

12.description: So I'm excited because I've always wanted to try "Italian beef" but I don't eat beef or pork...case closed! It was awesome perfect and "dipped" like all my chicago friends referred to ;-)

37.description: I visited Just Turkey and I was simply amazed by the flavor of the jerk burger and the delicious turkey tips. I wasn't so impressed by the turkey lasagna due to the salty taste but overall I enjoy this spot and definitely will return.

21.description: We'll I've been here many,many times. I usually get the turkey tips but occasionally I get the turkey burger. Today was one of those occasions. I can honestly say it has shrank, still good but it is noticeably smaller. This is one small Chicago franchise that I wish would keep their consistency. Staff are always nice and friendly.

16.description: I'm trying to consume less beef and pork. In enters Just Turkey. I ordered the Turkey Burger with everything and grilled onions. This was my 1st experience with a turkey burger so Just Turkey was essentially responsible for my sentiment towards turkey burgers for the rest of my life. So yeah...there's that. Although it tastes nothing like a beef burger, I was pleasantly surprised. The turkey was flavored well and was very tasty. I was a little afraid of it being too salty because that's been my experience with other turkey products like turkey bacon for example. Fortunately that was not the case. The bun also had a nice light buttery taste.I am disappointed that no fries were included with the burger for almost $6. I will return as I am interested in trying new items.

17.description: I had their Turkey Burger special tonight. That just blessed my life!! Delight to my tastebuds.

10.description: The turkey tips are delicious. I love the sauce that comes on it. You can sit inside and eat but it's sometimes a little annoying when the movie guy is just sitting there watching you eat. If you don't eat pork and want another alternative to beef tips, go here. The jerk tips are great as well.

11.description: I wish I could give this place Zero stars!! This is the worst customer service I have evert experienced in my life. I placed an order for 2 turkey hot links, my husband picked them up. I bite into the link and it was so hard, as if it had been sitting out and microwaved to make hot or it was overcooked. I could not even chew it because it was so tough. I immediately called and spoke with the young lady, she relayed the message to her manager and he stated, they would not be giving us another turkey link because the links had been cooked today and that if we wanted I could come back tomorrow and get a turkey tip. I don't eat turkey tips, I like turkey links. I asked the young lady could I speak with the manager and she said NO! I'm relaying the message. Very Rude! I then stated I would bring the food back to get my money and she said ok! (Rude)  1 minute later I get a phone call and it's her saying " my manager want to know if you bringing the food back!" I will not be sad or surprised when this place closes down!! 90% of restaurants don't make it, you all have BAD FOOD and BAD SERVICE which is not a winning combo.If you want old warmed up food, with a side of nasty attitude, then this is your place! Also please read the Grub Hub reviews!

26.description: I'm trying to consume less beef and pork. In enters Just Turkey. I ordered the Turkey Burger with everything and grilled onions. This was my 1st experience with a turkey burger so Just Turkey was essentially responsible for my sentiment towards turkey burgers for the rest of my life. So yeah...there's that. Although it tastes nothing like a beef burger, I was pleasantly surprised. The turkey was flavored well and was very tasty. I was a little afraid of it being too salty because that's been my experience with other turkey products like turkey bacon for example. Fortunately that was not the case. The bun also had a nice light buttery taste.I am disappointed that no fries were included with the burger for almost $6. I will return as I am interested in trying new items.

27.description: They have some good food. Everything is turkey which is more healthier than then the popeys and McDonalds in the area. It is a good local business and would suggest anyone there to try the turkey tips and the turkey lasagna. I was really impressed with the quality of the food. The staff is cool and its located in a decent area.

35.description: I frequent the Lansing restaurant on a regular basis. The food is excellent and their sauce is great. Their portions are enormous that my daughter and I shared a large turkey tip and we were full. If you don't eat pork or beef like me, then this is a place to visit.

8.description: Good price, good food, good turkey!There are a few tables and a TV but it's not really a cozy, sit down spot. It's a call ahead / pick up place... think Harold's but for turkey! It was convenient to sit and watch some of the game while I was waiting on my order though.I love spicy food so I asked Greg (I think) for his recommendation between the jerk and jalapeno burger. Jerk was the winner and it did not disappoint. I wish I had tasted it before I left because by the time I got home and devoured it, I wanted another one! That's just greedy I know! The flavors were on point and I had no complaints. I ordered corn on the cob instead of fries... eh, bad choice. One bite was enough for me to realize I didn't care for it at all. :-( I can't wait to try other options on the menu though. They have turkey tips, spaghetti, tacos, Italian turkey... you name it! I will be back for sure.

0.description: Turkey chili Turkey tips Turkey burger *Please open one up north, preferabbly Uptown

38.description: When we heard about just turkey, we drove out that weekend from the burbs to check them out.  After ordering our food, we waited a loooong time in a smokey dining area.  2 out of 3 of our meals were cold once we did receive our order.  My turkey burger was COLD and just alright.  My husband's tips were hot and delicious. We havent been back since.

20.description: Not much to say, just that I love the place & food!I've been coming to this location since they opened and I always order the Turkey Polish...forget Maxwell!  Yeah, they charge for the sauce, which they didn't use to - but that's my ONLY complaint....and a tip jar.  Really?  It's a fast food establishment, and the tip is for???  I can't imagine walking into McDonald's and seeing a tip jar at every register!  lolAs a matter of fact...I'm on my way there now.  Better call in, because sometimes the way can be a bit longer than what you expect for carryout (no tip for waiting too long).

19.description: Not much to say, just that I love the place & food!I've been coming to this location since they opened and I always order the Turkey Polish...forget Maxwell!  Yeah, they charge for the sauce, which they didn't use to - but that's my ONLY complaint....and a tip jar.  Really?  It's a fast food establishment, and the tip is for???  I can't imagine walking into McDonald's and seeing a tip jar at every register!  lolAs a matter of fact...I'm on my way there now.  Better call in, because sometimes the way can be a bit longer than what you expect for carryout (no tip for waiting too long).

33.description: CANT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT JUST TURKEYCANT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT JUST TURKEYCANT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT JUST TURKEY...I think you get it... the food is amazing you have to keep asking "is this really turkey"???  amazing flavors in the meat, sauce, breads, the entire package.  just finished eating dinner and debating going back tomorrow for round 2!  Definitely a new favorite!!

2.description: First time here and last time! 50 minutes for aburger while the employees play, chat, and give you attitude. Not my idea of a good time or a nice way to spend my hard earned cash on a Saturday. I was too deep into waiting to give up so I did receive the long over due burger and fry. Yes it was delicious, finally!!!

34.description: I drove 19 miles for a turkey burger. Have I lost my d@mn mind? Nope! If you were wise, you would be in your car -- right now -- headed to 43rd and Cottage Grove and getting a serious turkey burger on. This may have been one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had.First off, the drive to JT is lovely. For me, I hop on LSD South and cruise on by the lake until I get to Oakwood. It's a simple drive, but it's really beautiful. Lake Shore Opens up south of I-55 and traffic (usually) eases up. On a clear day, you feel like it's just you, the road and the water. It's a bootleg version of the PCH. Once you get off LSD (heh), take a look around. Yes, these big houses, parks and boulevards you see are not an optical illusion. Kenwood is the real deal. I think some famous guy who lives in DC calls it home. Or, something. Head south and you're at your destination.Don't expect valets, earpieces or sports coats. Park your car (in the lot!), walk your happy self in and look around. When I was there, the dining room was pretty empty. It's just a few tables, big windows and a mounted tv that was airing "The Game" (sister, siiistah). I'm telling you all of this, so a.) you get a feel for the experience and b.) you know to focus on the food.I rarely eat beef. Thanks to that, I miss ham/cheeseburgers. You don't know what you've got til it's gone. Truly. I've had turkey/veggie/etc. burgers, but they aren't the same. But here, realizing the entire menu is turkey products, I started to hope that this may be different. It was. I ordered a double turkey burger with cheese, fried onions, tomato, lettuce, and pickle on a butter bun. Before you judge me, realize that, at times, I eat once every 20 hours or so. I needed this. Oh, and fries covered in MILD sauce. That's right: the best part of Harold's (mild sauce) was about to be all mine -- but with a burger. It took a while for my food to be ready and, initially, I caught an attitude about it. I reigned it in when I realized a.) made to order (no mayo) and b.) this was the real deal. When my to-go order was ready, I thought I was smuggling a baby hippo. This bag was HEAVY. Good sign. I raced home, tore out the fries, did a couple of curls with my burger, cracked open a beer and dug in..........................That was a moment of silence. This. THIS! This was a burger! With every bite, I was reminded of what eating red meat tasted and felt like. It was heavenly. The cheese was melted around all of the protein, the bun was thick and crispy. The veggies were fresh and the condiments added to the flavor, rather than hiding it. My fries were stained burgundy for all the mild sauce slathered in their bag. Every bite was potato + vinegar bbq sauce = Ka-POW!. I was getting dead sexier by the bite. But, it was worth it. I wouldn't be able to be naked in front of anyone for months. BUT IT WAS WORTH IT! I don't remember finishing my food. I was in a stupor of meat, potato and hops. I forgot how to speak English. My clothes didn't fit well and my skin smelled of grill. And.it.was.all.worth.it.Why are you still sitting there?

32.description: I purchased a Groupon Now voucher (one day deal) for this restaurant.  I bought turkey legs for my two teens.   It came with fries and sauce.   I tried to ask them how the legs were.  They couldn't answer because they were too busy chomping down.  They loved them.   My daughter cut the left over meat off and made a sub type sandwich for her lunch the next day which she also enjoyed.   Two thumbs, I mean turkey legs UP!

18.description: We'll I've been here many,many times. I usually get the turkey tips but occasionally I get the turkey burger. Today was one of those occasions. I can honestly say it has shrank, still good but it is noticeably smaller. This is one small Chicago franchise that I wish would keep their consistency. Staff are always nice and friendly.

41.description: I stopped here after hearing rave reviews from a friend of mine. I got the turkey tips and they were YUMMY! I didn't feel as guilty about eating them either! The service was great and the atmosphere was comfortable and inviting. My only issue is that they don't give you a lot of food for their prices. For $8.50 for a SMALL tip order I was expecting a lot more than what I got! I definitely want to try the other things on the menu! Great addition to the community!

13.description: I love this place when I visit the area. Turkey tips and yummy smothered fries with the sauce, mmm so delicious! I don't get the point of the piece of bread... I always leave it be... Gotta remember to tell them to leave it out. I've always had great service, some days ppl aren't on point so cut some slack... It's clean but bare in furniture they could make it appear more welcoming but it serves it's purpose. Grab and go, the one in Evanston for some odd reason beacons you to sit and eat. But they don't smoke their food giving it a different flavor... I'll continue to return.

4.description: When I first started coming here the service was terrible so I can relate to the reviews below, but the food was ALWAYS on point. However, they must have new staff b/c I've been here twice in the last week and the service was amazing both times! Lady's was polite that took my order and each time it was a different girl. It's about time you all got rid of those bad apples!

24.description: Great food! It's a dive, I'm not sure why. it's still really good. We got really good service when we went. Try the Tips!

6.description: The worst customer service EVER!! Why can't you greet your customers & acknowledge the fact they want to place an order. Then after the snobbish attitude you over charge my debit card by adding something I didn't order! The food wasn't even worth it! Never going back!

22.description: Omg! They have the BEST Italian turkey beef ever! If you are feening for an Italian beef, but without all the fat, come to this place to get a much healthier version. You'll Love it!! (Don't forget to ask for sauce on your fries!! You will thank me later :) )

15.description: Oh my effin goodness. Where has this place been all my life? Jerk Turkey Salad, Turkey Wrap, Turkey Nachos, Turkey Ribs, Turkey Tips, Turkey Spaghetti, TURKEY, TURKEY, TURKEY.Now as a gal that is one of the forgotten when it comes to meat, this place did not disappoint. I split a small order of turkey tips and fries with a friend and an order of turkey nachos (ground turkey). You might as well have carried us out! Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic. The lady asked if it was our first time and let me try the turkey tips. WINNING! Now what makes all of this even more fantastic - the BBQ sauce. We tried to buy some but it won't be available until June I think.So the next time I go, I'm going to ask if I can build my own nachos or at least ask for some BBQ on the side. My nachos would look as such: Chips, Cheese, BBQ, Turkey Tips, and all the other goodness of toppings. I know I could make this just as easy, but if this is all I want.. why waste, lol.Can't wait to go back! They also have daily specials during the week (i.e. Buy a regular and get a small for free!)

40.description: I love the Turkey Polish. Clean. Friendly. I love neighborhood joints.

7.description: The worse ass customer service ever, I'm leaving now and I will never return. I don't give a damn if the food is good, I will not patronize this ghetto ass establishment. The cook yelling cursing as if I'm not at the front counter, just terrible.

36.description: Love the idea of only turkey products. I've been going to the Vegetarian Soul for years so I gave Just Turkey a try. I order the Turkey Chops. They were pretty good but the barbecue sauce tasted "straight from the bottle." Like Open Pit Style. I'm not a fan of just pouring sauce on it. What happened to seasoning and flavoring??

30.description: Oh my effin goodness. Where has this place been all my life? Jerk Turkey Salad, Turkey Wrap, Turkey Nachos, Turkey Ribs, Turkey Tips, Turkey Spaghetti, TURKEY, TURKEY, TURKEY.Now as a gal that is one of the forgotten when it comes to meat, this place did not disappoint. I split a small order of turkey tips and fries with a friend and an order of turkey nachos (ground turkey). You might as well have carried us out! Everything was delicious and the service was fantastic. The lady asked if it was our first time and let me try the turkey tips. WINNING! Now what makes all of this even more fantastic - the BBQ sauce. We tried to buy some but it won't be available until June I think.So the next time I go, I'm going to ask if I can build my own nachos or at least ask for some BBQ on the side. My nachos would look as such: Chips, Cheese, BBQ, Turkey Tips, and all the other goodness of toppings. I know I could make this just as easy, but if this is all I want.. why waste, lol.Can't wait to go back! They also have daily specials during the week (i.e. Buy a regular and get a small for free!)

3.description: I had the turkey sub (Italian beef like)- it was okay. I don't ever have to order it again. Nothing spectacular. A great alternative for those that don't eat beef.

14.description: Bad customer service. I came in 2/26/15 I stood at the register for 5 minutes without being acknowledged. 2 female employees were standing in the back and one then yelled for me place my order while I was never greeted and she was still standing in the back expecting me to yell out my order. By the time my order was ready she gave me the food without saying have a nice day, thanks, bye or nothing besides a bad attitude. This is the reason so many African American business suffer from bad customer service. I try to support my own people and get treated like crap. I won't buy here anymore.

1.description: This place is magic.  The art galleries are free and changed frequently.  I haven't tried too much in the cafe, but the vanilla late and various chocolate/cheese cake/scone offerings are good.The really fabulous thing is the ceramics class I'm taking.  It *is* a little pricey, but on par with other studios in the city.  The instructor Harvy is great, patient, knowledgable.  A little cohort of regulars are there on any given afternoon and usually will happily help newbies.  And you have open access to the studio whenever the art center is open, which isn't universal.

9.description: I was pretty psyched to attend "Cocktails and Clay" with a couple lady friends but was disappointed by a few things.  We did arrive shortly after it started and left by 10, so maybe it gets going later?  Anyway, the concept is awesome but needs some fine-tuning.  For one thing, the clay project we did was a little confusing and they split up the room into teams so no one spoke to anyone besides the people they came with.  Our team made our own fun, but it could have been more mingle-friendly.  Also, I wasn't drinking and my only option for a bevo was a room-temperature RC.       I hope this event works out the kinks because it does seem like a great idea.  It may have some identity issues though - maybe they should decide whether to be an after-work activity or a late-night spot.

23.description: Just caught an opening here the other day and I have to say I'm very impressed. Big galleries, media-installation ready, and tons of classrooms for teaching and studios for artists. It is truly a community gathering spot and should be the envy of neighborhoods all over Chicago. Next time you go, if you have a few extra dollars, make a donation. Art and Community are two causes everyone should support, no matter where they live.

25.description: The new building for the recently relocated Hyde Park Art Center was designed by local architect Douglas Garofalo. Its east wall along Cornell features the largest exterior digital facade, so experimental artists like Inigo Manglano-Ovalle can get a crack at doing their artistic thing with the building, which used to be a printing plant. HPAC recently hosted a 36-hour "Creative Move", a free grand opening festival which introduced visitors to works by local artists along with a variety of dances, presentations, and lectures.

12.description: day 61 in chicagowhere else can you go to look at art, play with clay, and drink alcohol?static.px.yelp.com/bphot…I made this. don't ask me what it is. it was supposed to be the two towers...

21.description: day 61 in chicagowhere else can you go to look at art, play with clay, and drink alcohol?static.px.yelp.com/bphot…I made this. don't ask me what it is. it was supposed to be the two towers...

16.description: Ok, so my husband and I went on a date here "Cocktails & Clay" which is every 2nd Friday from 8pm til 12am.  We parked in their lot as street parking is difficult in Hyde Park.  There is a suggested donation but I suggest paying whatever you can afford, the receptionist is totally ok with it!  We participated in a "Sip & Sculpt 45-minute sessions with others and it was led by a teacher.  Unfortunately we had to recycle our materials.  In the main lobby there was a DJ spinning records and an area to dance if you felt so inclined.  We also had a chance to explore the exhibitions and galleries. I was really impressed with the cash bar which at first glance looked like just a table with a few beers bottles but actually offered other drinks as well.  We had a great time on a budget, in our neighborhood and for that I give it 5 plus stars!

17.description: HPAC is amazing, interesting, and innovative space. As an art teacher in the city, I am thrilled to have access to a space that is always inviting and well designed. I find it completely comparable to other contemporary museums and art spots in the city, and if you haven't been already, you should go visit it!

10.description: Since 1939 HPAC has been supporting artist, curating memorable exhibitions and bringing the love of art to the community.  Numerous contemporary art exhibitions including those of the "Hairy Who?" and Chicago Imagists (artists of the late 1960s and early 1970s who chose to stay in Chicago to create art.)In April of 2006, this esteemed arts organization moved into a newly transformed 2-story brick warehouse.   The facility incorporates the mission to "stimulate and sustain visual art in Chicago" into the new building.  Every surface can be used for gallery space; there are community classrooms and other rooms for artists to gather.  The most notable feature of the building is a video wall outside that artists use as a sort of high-tech canvas that can be seen by folks passing by.   A sight I often take in when going through Hyde Park.  The art shown there tends to be very cerebral, probably due to the University of Chicago academics and students who live in the neighborhood.  Regardless, the shows always make me see the world in a different way, which is the point of art.

5.description: This place is a wonderful community center and should definitely be on your list of things to do if you are in the neighborhood. Some of the exhibits aren't always the most interesting, but since it's free, you really can't complain.

11.description: The new building for the recently relocated Hyde Park Art Center was designed by local architect Douglas Garofalo. Its east wall along Cornell features the largest exterior digital facade, so experimental artists like Inigo Manglano-Ovalle can get a crack at doing their artistic thing with the building, which used to be a printing plant. HPAC recently hosted a 36-hour "Creative Move", a free grand opening festival which introduced visitors to works by local artists along with a variety of dances, presentations, and lectures.

22.description: Alcohol and sculpting? Obviously the two go hand-in-hand! I can't believe I'd never thought of this brilliant combination before. Hyde Park Art Center hosts "Cocktails and Clay" every 2nd Friday of the month -- what a fantastic idea! We went for Girls' Night recently, and had a grand time. Drinks are cheap and strong, everyone is friendly, and the clay classes are really fun -- even if you don't think you're artistic at all. (One thing to keep in mind is that you don't actually get to fire & keep your piece, although they are thinking of instituting this in the future.) For $15 cover and $4 drinks, it makes for an awesome Friday night. And the atmosphere is perfect for meeting people and making new friends. I'll definitely be back for Cocktails & Clay, or to take one of their many superb sounding classes!Edited 2/5/08: I am now taking a ceramics class here with my boyfriend and I LOVE IT. Love the teacher, love everything about it. The 5-star review remains!

0.description: I specifically chose to stay in the Hyde Park district while in Chicago because of this Arts Center. I stumbled across it by chance a few years ago by staying at the nearby Ramada because I worked at a Milwaukee Ramada and got a great deal. It turned out to be one of the smartest decisions I have ever made.It is free, which is an amazing thing for Chicago. There is a decent amount of exhibits and gallery spaces and the art that was being shown is amazing. It also serves as a co-op, which is a great feature. There is a plant recycle and seed share program on the upper level as well. I know that they do classes as well, which is great for the local community.

20.description: The Hyde Park Arts Center, which moved to its fabulous space 3 years ago, is probably my favorite thing about Hyde Park. Their programs are exciting and diverse. Their collections feature installations, mixed media, Outsider art, political art, local artists, giant sculptures, prints. When they moved into 5020 South Cornell, they had a 36-hour festival that had everything from puppets to yoga to print-making workshops. Since that first "Creative Move," they have celebrated annual FREE 24-hour birthday parties. At last year's, I watched trapeize artists and fire jugglers, silk-screened a t-shirt, ate cake, drank wine, and saw tons of art. I was so sad that I couldn't make it to this year's celebration. While there are lots of hands-on opportunities for children and families, HPAC doesn't leave adults out in the cold. The monthly cocktails and clay is so much fun! DJ, drinks, sculpting...they also host lecture series and have great openings that rival anything you would find on the Pilsen or River North Fridays. HPAC just keeps getting better and better, and it's the gem of this community.

19.description: discovered the place because my friend had her photography show there, was surprised find such a gem in chicagochecked out their exhibits and studio space here, the work is interesting and inspiringi'll definitely check out the cocktails and clay some time!

2.description: And the Beast is being dismantled this weekend.  The finale was terrific--especially the music and musicians. Thank you HPAC and I look forward to the next installation, wherever it may be.  I've gotten over the demise of the Red Flag Salon, so I guess I can handle the demise of the Beast.  As long as John Preus keeps making stuff, which I think is inevitable, in a good way.

18.description: Cocktails and Clay is a great event.

13.description: Been taking classes here for over a year and a half. Love this place. If you want to take a beginning class in ceramics, I suggest Hardy. Hardy is very focused on technique and precision. He will teach you how to throw and do it well. He does not do demonstrations, but works with beginners and offers advice to more advanced students (as they desire it). David Trost is a GREAT person to take a class with, once you start wanting inspiration. This guy is totally genius and inspiring as hell. You will get more excited about pottery then you have ever been about anything else. Another amazing teacher is Mary. Mary is a fantastic potter and sometimes teaches tile making. TAKE HER! She's great as a teacher and person!

4.description: A few weeks ago, at the first peek of nice weather, a pal convinced me it would be an excellent idea to ride from my house all the way to HPAC.  Replace excellent with completely retarded and she was right.  Completely winded and sweating like a pig, I was relieved to spend an hour or so wandering through the cool, quiet spaces looking at the art.  Some of it we loved, some, not so much.  My favorite was the work tucked in the stairwell like a little secret.  I've always loved little hidden treasures.  Sweet Secrets and Keypers, anyone?  Ok, maybe I'm alone with my weird 80's toys.  I look forward to coming back, but maybe on a less windy day or after I've been back on the bike for a while.  The ride home was way worse.  By the time I got in my door my ass hurt too bad to sit down.  The things former art students do to feel like they're making use of their degrees....

24.description: It's hard NOT to support this place. The beautiful new building (still on its way to being finished) functions as a FREE gallery that holds exciting exhibitions from both local and international artists and also houses low-cost art classes open to the community. You can take anything from pottery to photography to silkscreen to crochet and beyond. And along with your (quite meager) tuition payment you get access to the facilities there (darkroom, kiln, etc) to do your homework or log in some extra hours perfecting your craft. If you live up north, it's definitely worth catching the #6 and heading down south for this place.

6.description: This place is definitely unexpected- it's in a residential neighborhood, a bit off the beaten path. I've not been to any of the organized events yet- I wandered in a while ago while taking a little walk through the neighborhood on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. They had a couple of really interesting exhibits up and the place was pretty empty, but it still felt really lively because of the openness and light in the building. Admission is free, but they do have donation boxes (and come on, $5 is a small price to pay to support local art!)They have a number of really interesting classes for reasonable prices and I know they do a "Cocktails and Clay" event which I'd like to check out sooner than later. Overall, it's definitely worth ducking into if you're in the neighborhood- support this worthy cause!(Also of note: Istria Cafe has a location here, and that gelato is killer. Perfect way to cap off the afternoon).

15.description: There are some very nice pieces in the "Ground Floor" show of work by recent Chicago MFAs. Not necessarily a destination show, but definitely glad I stopped by given how close by I live. Looking forward to checking out "Cocktails & Clay" some time.

7.description: I didn't know this place existed until my fiancé mentioned it and it was part of a volunteer thank you for one of her groups. But I was very excited when I learned it was in Hyde Park.It didn't take too long to get there from the Northside and parking was a breeze. We walked in and they had a special area for us before the actual festivities began. Then we went to the back room to do the clay business.That was more than too much fun! We were paired within our own group, but then we got to hang out with others. We were handed an assignment, a glob of clay each, and we went to work. Everyone was really friendly, the staff was really attentive and not overbearing.Overall, it was a GREAT experience. After the clay fun, we explored the very eclectic two floors of exhibition space, which included installations from children and local artists. Definitely want to go again.

8.description: Every time I've been here, I've been glad because I learned a lot and had fun.  Definitely give it your time, and you will get out of it what you put into it.  Thumbs up for being community and visitor-oriented.

3.description: I really like the idea of this place and their mission, and the staff I've encountered all seem very nice. This review is for the last class that I took there, which left me underwhelmed. Though the teacher was friendly, there was pretty much no structure and no instruction. I felt like he did little (if any) preparation for the class, and spent most his time during class plugging his own artwork and exhibitions. If I wanted any critique from him about my work I had to walk over to him and ask him for his opinion on improvements. You would think there would be more attention to the student given the small class size. Not surprisingly, attendance rate was spotty. In short, I was paying for the price of a class, but getting use of a studio with background noise from a gay hipster. I really hope this was just an isolated incident, but experience reflected poorly on the art center in my mind as I felt they should have screened their staff more carefully.

14.description: Alcohol and sculpting? Obviously the two go hand-in-hand! I can't believe I'd never thought of this brilliant combination before. Hyde Park Art Center hosts "Cocktails and Clay" every 2nd Friday of the month -- what a fantastic idea! We went for Girls' Night recently, and had a grand time. Drinks are cheap and strong, everyone is friendly, and the clay classes are really fun -- even if you don't think you're artistic at all. (One thing to keep in mind is that you don't actually get to fire & keep your piece, although they are thinking of instituting this in the future.) For $15 cover and $4 drinks, it makes for an awesome Friday night. And the atmosphere is perfect for meeting people and making new friends. I'll definitely be back for Cocktails & Clay, or to take one of their many superb sounding classes!Edited 2/5/08: I am now taking a ceramics class here with my boyfriend and I LOVE IT. Love the teacher, love everything about it. The 5-star review remains!

12.description: Really great team in the pharmacy! Very helpful and pleasant!

7.description: This has got to be the most unprofessional Walgreens I ever been in.  I can count on one hand the number of staff members that actually believes in the policy that customers are first. The only reason I continue to go here because it's right across the street. I think from this point I will walk to the one on 55th. This is not my first complaint and I am sure it will not be my last. I have call corporate a few times on the manager Eddie

20.description: This is not the closest location to my apartment, but if you check the reviews for the Walgreen's on 55th street you will understand why I'd got to 47th street instead. This Walgreen's is a blessing. With a drive through pharmacy, I call in prescriptions and drive over to pick them up at the time that I indicated and every single time the prescription is ready waiting for me. The whole drive through process takes literally five minutes at most, the pharmacy staff is polite, quick, and efficient. I cannot thank them enough for doing their job well. service on the inside of this establishment is just as good as their drive-thru service. I would recommend everyone in the Hyde Park/Kenwood Area to take their business here.

19.description: I must agree with the other reviews! This Walgreens is awesome! I came in there to get a few things and had trouble getting an item that was on the very top shelf. Charlette(I think that was her name) helped me and was very helpful from the beginning when I asked her where an item was, until the end when she rang me up. She was hilarious and made sure to answer the questions that I had. My bag was heavy so she double bagged it and even made a handle using another bag so I could carry it with ease. This is the only Walgreens that I go to in this area and it's all because of their customer service and availability of the items that I need.

1.description: After switching my medication back to this Walgreen's pharmacy from CVS in Hyde Park,  I have a breeze with picking up my medication and not having to stand in amusement park style lines like most pharmacies in the area. Pharmacy staff are nice,  friendly, and efficient. My medication is always ready before the scheduled time. I have utilized the drive up window for pharmacy and I would not recommend it. The wait is so long you will feel like you're being ignored. Just get out the car and walk in if you want your service to be quick. Besides the pharmacy,  the general store staff try to avoid customers at all costs.  They can be in the same isle and see you struggling to locate a product and will totally ignore you. The lines to check out are ridiculous and there ALWAYS seem to be a line no matter what time of day you visit the store. My four stars are for the pharmacy department. I would've given five stars for the pharmacy but the drive up is very slow and at any given time the pharmacy can be closed because a pharmacist was not able to work that day (this has happened twice within the past two months).

2.description: Super convenient. Very well kept. Items always in stock. Good staff. Recommend.

9.description: Ive been to quite a few walgreens and this one needs to amp up thier sales and clearance items. I mean regular price is regular price but store sales and clearance is what keeps me coming back.

6.description: This Walgreen's is within walking distance.... Less than a mile away. I travel to the location on 55th passing this one on my way. The service here is just terrible. The absolute worse. I came to purchase an antacid and noticed it was BOGO free. Great. I don't use them often but hey why not. Get to the register and it doesn't ring that way. No biggie, I tell her take it off. I know know the sign said it but it wasn't that important. She asks if I want to get a price check, the gentleman is right there, sure. 10-15 minutes later, the employee confirms what I saw. She then has me stand in the manager's line for him to ring and process the adjustment. Why am I standing in line again??? I get to the manager who then tells me he has to check for himself. I JUST WAITED 15 MINUTES! I explain that they just checked, the cashier and person who checked confirm this, he walks off anyway. He comes back and tells me "this is why I had to check". The offer had to expired. And " obviously " I knew this. I didn't and neither did the employee who checked before me. His rebuttal, oh he's new. Listen it's not that darn serious. He gave it to me as if he was doing me a favor. I will never patronize this Walgreen's again. Furthermore, they've opened a Walmart in the area with significantly lower prices.

18.description: Pretty much your standard Walgreens it is an ok  the staff here is very friendly and helpful. But watch out  if you you the drive thru pharmacy though a friend of mine once used it and they gave her the wrong presciption and could not her prescription. That is just very unsafe.

10.description: I was sitting at home in my PJ's and as it just dawned on me that I forgot to buy my cta pass for the next day! Not having the exact change I grabbed my keys and went to the nearest Walgreens. Well guess what, this location does not carry dollar amount of the cta cards! Boo!! How does Walgreens not carry something?! The two star rating is only for Walgreens having all but the cta card I needed.

13.description: This has GOT to be the worse Walgreens in the city.  I gave it one star due to location in the case of emergency meds required.  No matter when I get there, I'm told it will be 20-30 minute wait for my prescription.  If I call ahead, I still wait.  I tried to have a medicine transferred from another location and that process took two days and three visits.  They are rude, unprofessional and couldn't move slower.  They couldn't figure out how to enter my new insurance in the system so I had to pay regular price because I'd run out of time and patience and I had more sympathy for those waiting in line behind me than the employees did.  Forget an apology or even an explanation.  Steer clear if you can.

16.description: Cashiers take their time and chat with each other as if there weren't a line getting longer right in front of their eyes

17.description: Why oh why don't Americans respect the line? This store has three registers in the front. Courtesy and basic - basic what! - should tell you that you have to wait your turn, but I've discovered that in Kenwood people leave off a stop sign when they feel like it, and they go to an open register at the Walgreen's when they feel like it. As if NO ONE else is around. Bad design, apathy on the part of the clerks, and a general sense of "oh well" contribute to the bad experience.

15.description: This is not the closest location to my apartment, but if you check the reviews for the Walgreen's on 55th street you will understand why I'd got to 47th street instead. This Walgreen's is a blessing. With a drive through pharmacy, I call in prescriptions and drive over to pick them up at the time that I indicated and every single time the prescription is ready waiting for me. The whole drive through process takes literally five minutes at most, the pharmacy staff is polite, quick, and efficient. I cannot thank them enough for doing their job well. service on the inside of this establishment is just as good as their drive-thru service. I would recommend everyone in the Hyde Park/Kenwood Area to take their business here.

0.description: Pharmacy staff is super nice and courteous! There was a mishap with my prescription and they didn't hesitate to work on it.

5.description: I've gone to this location since it's been built and it has come a long way. All of the staff are SUPER friendly and helpful. My only two gripes are the overall design of the store (can't help it, I have a thing for architectural design) and the lack of inventory compared to the location on 55th and Lake Park.  They can stand to update their deli section...Update: the store closes at 11PM now! AND they have a deli section!

11.description: This is based on the pharmacy.......honestly I've never experienced slower service in my LIFE for filling a prescription.  Luckily I wasn't in pain but if I request the rx online 29 hours in advance I expect the order to be ready when I arrive.........especially after waiting in the drive up window for 20 minutes!

8.description: This walgreens location is just awful.  It's always messy and crowded and the staff here is extremely rude and the pharmacy is a joke! I was here a few days ago to pick up a prescription,  I rang the bell and a woman told me she'd be right with me. I waited 30 minutes in that drive thru (I timed it). So finally I went into the store and Faye (the associate) refused to make eye contact with me and began to answer phones and pretend to be busy. I was at the counter another 10 minutes before I was just handed my prescription with not one word spoken.  I got my medication and transferred my prescription to CVS.  It's not worth the hassle.

3.description: All the staff super friendly and helpful. Especially the pharmacy! They've changed their staff over a year ago and their service has improved so much since!

14.description: I really like the people in the pharmacy but the management (corporate) has opted to keep the staffing at a minimum.  !5 minutes on the phone to find out if my Rx was ready, gave up and went to the store to find out if my Rx was ready, then was told that it would take 20 - 30 minutes to slap a label on an antibiotic box.  I did not feel well enough to wait and now won't have my pills tonight.  They invested millions in the Happy & Healthy campaign, cleaned up the store, but did NOTHING to improve the number of employees.  Tonight I am at the corner of sick and angry.  Shame on Walgreens - is this what we have to look forward to when 36 million more Americans are getting health care?  Yes Walgreens, part of the deal with the ACA is that you will have to take care of MANY new customers.  How are you going to do that when you can't take care of the ones you already have?

4.description: 2 words : always lines. No matter what time of day or night or what day of the week. Somehow there are always lines .

1.description: This is exactly what you can expect from a subway. Fast, efficient & fresh. The workers here are always nice and courteous.

2.description: my latest addiction are these raspberry cheesecake cookies that subway has. im not really into there sandwiches, not enough meat and i dont really like there toppings but those cookies are the bomb!

0.description: This location does it right. Fast and friendly. They genuinely appreciate your business. Also very well-maintained and always super clean. A real asset to the neighborhood.

Fort Smith is a Clothing and Jewelery boutique on 43rd street that specializes in hand made, one of a kind jewelery. The owner is kind and helpful. Although the store is a bit off the beaten path it is a trip well worth taking.

56.description: Great addition to the area.This nail salon has been open approximately 3 weeks according to the staff. It's located adjacent to Harold's and Just Turkey in the same building that once housed a dry cleaning business. Upon entry I was greeted by a friendly gentleman who told me to sign in & take a seat. I waited about 10 minutes to receive a manicure & pedicure.The location is newly constructed so the interior is modern & comfortable. There's are a decent amount  of nail polish colors & brands to choose from including OPI. I'd estimate that there are about 8-10 pedicure stations & maybe twice as many manicure tables. I went on a Thursday afternoon & there were 4-5 employees serving a steady stream of customers.My only complaint would be that my manicurist wasn't all that friendly. I suppose it isn't her job to be friendly but she seemed kinda standoffish which was a bit of a turn off. That isn't to say that she didn't do a good job with my mani/pedi though because she did. I'm satisfied with the end result so I'd go back. The mani/pedi was $27. Effective June 1st though there will be a $1 fee if you use a credit card.

29.description: This was my first time at this salon and I must say it was nice. I came in at 7:45 I was unaware that they stop accepting customers at 7:30 but they still let me get serviced. I waited no more than 5 minutes and was serviced by Sam. She was really nice. But she was a little to social which caused her to get distracted and be a little rough on my nail beds. I flinched a few times. She did do a great job on my nails though! I really hard when the acrylic is built up on the nail so high making it look swollen and she didn't do that. She didn't pile on the acrylic which made my short stiletto nails look much better. She also did my pedicure and I almost fell asleep it was so nice. She even popped my toes!!!! I love when salons do that it relaxes you more. I brought in my own nail color because I didn't know if that had a good selection but I glanced at the wall and they had so many amazing colors. The owner twan is very popular you can tell by the conversations he was having. And they have a $2 discount per service if you use cash. I paid $41 cash for full set and pedicure. I will definitely be back here.

42.description: Attentive, sweet, and accommodating! Byob, wifi and fun music before you get specialized love to your nails!

23.description: I been going here for 2 years and every time I leave I'm satisfied with my nails and feet. Great price and a chill atmosphere. I recommend Twun & Kenny

47.description: I have to agree with Ariel, this was not a good experience for me.  The manager is not very professional.  I'd spoken to him about renting the space for a mani/pedi party.  He agreed, told me the cost (discounted 15% for the group) and asked for one week notice.  I told him the date on the same day, came back several days later to confirm and work out the details.  He then claimed he didn't remember, couldn't offer the discount, would be busy on that day because he was running specials etc., etc.  This was a mess since I'd spent the last several days, getting 20 women excited about the idea and collecting deposits!  Who does that?  Turn down the opportunity to service 20 new customers who pay upfront?  Really?  No worries, this young manager absolutely does not have to worry about me ever coming back.  I went to another shop, explained my dilemma and they were very happy to  accommodated our group - and for the same discounted price!  Will write a review on that salon after the event.  But Taday will not stay in business long if they continue to disregard customer service and take customer satisfaction for granted.

8.description: I stopped by the salon at 6pm to see what time the salon closed, which it states 8pm! I came back at 7:45pm to get my nails done, soon as I open the door the guy at the first booth yells without looking we are closed. I asked him what did he say he yelled again without looking up and says we are closed. I replied the signs says 8pm, he replied we take our last client at 7:30pm! I replied I'll take my dollars elsewhere, he replied that's fine!This is totally unacceptable if you take your last client at 7:30pm, then your signage should state 7:30pm, not 8pm! I'll take my business elsewhere, a lack of customer service and consideration. I drove 25mins to come to this salon because I am moving to the neighborhood and was told they had a great variety of colors but will absolutely not patronize a company that hs a lack of care for their clients!

31.description: Awesome works, came for my pedicures and gelish (non chip polish) manicure......was very satisfied with her works, her name is makeyla . Five stars for her. Five stars for the salon as well, nice and clean, lots polish to pick....was my first time here but will be back with some friends.

34.description: Been going here for almost a year now on a regular basis and I'm always satisfied. Still clean...very professional...and the nail techs are great. Recently, a lot of new nail techs have come in and it hasn't changed the quality of service. I even have my mother coming here and she has to pass dozens of nail shops to get here. Glad there some place in my neighborhood. I'm still happy with my nails, toes & brows.

16.description: Found "my" nail shop!!  And it's in my neighborhood!  Great nail techs and affordable prices!

13.description: This was my first time at this salon and I must say it was nice. I came in at 7:45 I was unaware that they stop accepting customers at 7:30 but they still let me get serviced. I waited no more than 5 minutes and was serviced by Sam. She was really nice. But she was a little to social which caused her to get distracted and be a little rough on my nail beds. I flinched a few times. She did do a great job on my nails though! I really hard when the acrylic is built up on the nail so high making it look swollen and she didn't do that. She didn't pile on the acrylic which made my short stiletto nails look much better. She also did my pedicure and I almost fell asleep it was so nice. She even popped my toes!!!! I love when salons do that it relaxes you more. I brought in my own nail color because I didn't know if that had a good selection but I glanced at the wall and they had so many amazing colors. The owner twan is very popular you can tell by the conversations he was having. And they have a $2 discount per service if you use cash. I paid $41 cash for full set and pedicure. I will definitely be back here.

11.description: Not impressed at all with quality of service. I ended up getting a no chip which I didn't want because they thought they could do that better than a colored liquid gel that I had gotten done previously.They couldn't explain articulately what service was being done. Needless to say I won't return though it is 2 minutes from my house.

39.description: No longer the place i fell in love with last year. Business has really picked up for them since everyone in the area. I still don't think I should have waited an hour to get my eyebrows waxed and I ended up going some other place. Not sure if they take appointments anymore but be ready to play the waiting game here.

37.description: real cool peoples, came for my pedicure and my GF getting her nails done. was very thrill with what they can do here, took a few pictures I saw on these ladies next to me. I will be back!

0.description: This is my second time here. And today I was in a panic because all the nail shops were crowded. They were too but they have enough ppl so that the wait isn't long. I came right and was seated. Which I love because I'm on a tight schedule. The girl who did my pedi was super nice which I noticed about most of the staff. The guy at the front is super professional and efficient. I'll def be back. Keep up the good work. =}

38.description: Would give it a 4 but for the longer than expected 'wait' for my services. My cousin turned me on to this place and I'm a fan now. Folks were really nice and both my pedi and no chip were done with precision and still almost two weeks later - look damn good. Prices are also reasonable - will go back if I'm in the area.

51.description: great place around the corner from my girls crib! the owner is really nice & his mom is even nicer! great job with pedis and the new pink & white nails! very clean and roomy establishment. will be coming back!

27.description: Great place. Very efficient and clean. I did not had to wait to get my nails done as soon as I came in they did my nails. Price are decent not too expensive and the people are friendly.

32.description: Great customer service. I happened to come in without an appointment and was taken care of right away. No chip mani and pedi looks perfect!

54.description: Let me just say: I am so happy this place is open! Because there aren't too many places like Taday in this part of Bronzeville, I had previously been braving the parking horrors in Hyde Park, the South Loop or even up north to get my nails done. Since this place is 5 blocks from my house, I no longer have to!The Bronzeville area is going through a vigorous revitalization. New businesses, buildings, condos and beautiful park areas are popping up everywhere. While I was in the salon, I had a great conversation with a gentleman about Bronzeville being the new up and coming area and how amazing it is to see all the change happening around the neighborhood. Taday Nails is definitely a testament to this continued change.First, the salon looks completely new inside, and the decor is really cute and spacious. There are 9 pedi stations and 9 mani stations, which is great because there are lots of spaces for everyone in the salon. I walked in about 15 minutes after opening and stated that I needed a pedicure. I was told to go pick a color and immediately seated at a pedicure station (they have an abundance of great nail colors, by the way). And let me tell you: the lady who did my pedi went to WORK. It had been about 3 weeks since I had a pedi, and as I'm sure you know, with walking around all summer in sandals, your feet can get rough. She got my nails, heels and the bottom of my feet baby smooth. The polish application was flawless. My feet look great!Finally, the prices here are awesome. $20 for a pedi, $30 for a mani/pedi and $12 for a mani. However, if you pay cash, they knock $2 off the price, so I ended up paying only $18 for my pedi. I posted a pic of their price menu so others can see what else they offer and what the cost is. Of course, they also do gel and acrylic, etc. I can't wait to come back for a mani and pedi and eventually a no-chip manicure.If you live in Bronzeville or the surrounding area and are looking for a great place to get your nails done, this place is it. Great addition to the neighborhood!UPDATE 6/5/15: Just so you guys know, they no longer do a cash discount on services; instead, if you pay cash, they will give you raffle tickets...I guess if you come here enough that would be something nice, but basically I can now just skip the trip to the ATM.

48.description: This place is nice the Employees are nice.Twan the owner is so professional.I was going to 49th cottage no more since I found this nail spa.I am a regular now .I have had my nails and feet done multiple times.When I come to a salon I want quiet.I wish they had a sign that saids no kids.And tell clients texting only.I was there when a crying child reeked havoc in the salon.Also I don't want to hear other clients phone conversation while I am trying to relax.Also during the week like Tuesday or Wednesday are quieter times.If I go on Sat or fri I  sit in my car till they open at 10am.So at least I will be number 2 or 3 .Yes other people are also waiting to get serviced.

44.description: I was looking for a place that can become my regular salon since I've moved and hadn't found one. But my search is done and I'm super excited about this place!  Sangh( if I'm spelling it right but that's the sound LOL) DID MY OVERLAY PERFECTLY. I'm very particular and that's why 3 years after moving I hadn't found a place. So I'm not just saying this but it was really neat and clean polish. I will definitely go back!

24.description: I enjoy Taday's nail the shop is clean, the prices are compettive and they do a great job. When it's not crowding you can get in and out.

7.description: I've been getting service here for over a year, and Tuan is the best hands down. There's no other salon with such a friendly staff, clean environment, and fresh popping colors to choose from. His technique is up to date and in keeping with the latest look, and he makes sure each client feels special. I can't say enough about the customer service as well as the professional job that I receive every time I visit. Do yourself a favor...treat yourself to a mani/pedi at Taday Nail Salon...you won't regret it.

49.description: Great decor, very clean, and friendly staff.  My rating would've been higher except that I had to wait and hour for a gel fill-in because they were short staffed.  I would however return again but with an appointment.  They also offer a cash discount which is fantastic!

40.description: I'm so disappointed!  I try my best to support "my community".  But just because it's in the hood doesn't mean the services shouldn't be professional!!  OMG!!  Twon/the owner who sits at the front desk was very rude to me!  I asked him what other technician I could see who is as skilled as he was.  He said just have a seat and we will take care of you when a space opens up. I said, you didn't answer my question, he says they are all good or I wouldn't have hired them.  I said, that's not true because I had a bad experience and I don't want to waste my money.  He said well if you don't want them to do your nails you can leave then, thank you very much.  I said really, that's how you are going to talk to me.  I told him I have a right to inquire the skill set of the person I'm going to give my money to.  I work hard for my money and I just don't frivolously throw it away.  He wasn't accommodating or professional and I swear I will never go back in there and I would advise anyone not to spend their money ANY WHERE if they aren't treated with respect and given excellent customer service.  taday nails you won't get my money or the other 15 women I know who I referred there.  In addition ladies the best way to show a business we don't care for the disrespectful way we are treated when we spend our hard earn money is to not give them our money.  nail shops are on every corner.  Go to a business who appreciate you and your money.  taday salon doesn't deserve to wash my feet.

53.description: best pedicure massage chairs i've ever been in, clean and bright space, lots of OPI and Essie colors, friendly people, free parking, reasonably priced! there's a big sign that says they no longer charge $1 for credit card use, and they even have a $2 cash discount. not the best mani/pedi i've ever had (a little polish on cuticles of a couple toenails, minor shaping issues), but still pretty good for the convenience and price. in addition to the just turkey and harold's, the plaza now has a small produce store, so in one trip you can get pampering and veggies to mitigate your harold's guilt.

30.description: Was in Chicago on a business trip and was in dire for a pedicure and found this place on yelp. So glad I did. Walked in was immediately welcomed and seated in a massage chair for my pedicure. Lynn did a fantastic job on my no-chip pedi and took great care of me. She was quick ....!! I will be back on my next visit to Chicago for sure...!

46.description: I had great customer service. I was a little nervous going here at first because it's hard to find a place that does a great job. Most nail technician ends up cutting my skin when cutting the cuticle. The nail tech did not cut me. I had quick service (mani&pedi) on a Saturday, I was surprise. I will be going back. You can make an appointment M-Th. They don't accept appointments F-Sun. Plus, there is a discount if you pay in cash. Nice and clean establishment.

1.description: They are really cute- my only issue was that I got my feet done first and they ran out of polish so I couldn't get the same polish on my nails.

55.description: Everything you could ask for in a nail salon: clean, friendly, professional, & very affordable--has to be the cheapest no-chip mani in the city--plus, they do a great job, been here 3 times so far and have gotten a ton of compliments!  Can't say enough good things about this place, Blessed to have it right around the corner from my house!

9.description: I have been on a quest for "my nail spot" since moving to Hyde Park last Labor Day and I think I've found it. Sandy did my no-chip mani and normal pedi. I went as a walk-in around 6:15 p.m. It was busy and there were about two other ladies waiting. But I did not have to wait too long. I liked the facility, the staff, and the overall experience. Now I just have to see how long the no-chip will last. But, I think I've finally found my "glass shoe."

26.description: I love this place, I've been going here for awhile now and get my brows and nails done!

25.description: Had an AWESOME experience at Taday! Danny did an IMPECCABLE job on my acrylic layover and pedi. Sweetheart was, well, a sweetheart and had me cracking up from the moment I walked in the door. Customer service in these kinds of nail salons always tend to take a backseat but Sweetheart and Danny were ON IT! No wait. No push to get other services for more money. No speaking in Vietnamese, making the client feel uncomfortable. It was a great experience all around and I WILL be returning. My only suggestion is that they get someone in there to do mini massages (30 minutes) and facials. I DEFINITELY be up for that!

12.description: I never go anywhere else to get my nails done.  My no-chip lasts 3 weeks or more sometimes.  This place consistently gives great service and I've never had a bad experience in over 3 years.  It's a complete waste of time to go anywhere else other than Taday in Chicago.

21.description: Extremely useless and terrible service. First time I came here I was bypassed by one person. Today, I was asked to go sit in the eyebrow room, and again two people were served before me. They respond to you like they can't be bothered to serve you. I just walked out enraged. Will never come back and will not recommend anyone here.

17.description: No chip manicures are $27 credit card / $25 cashPedicures are $22 CC (I think) / $20 cashUnderarm wax $15It's located in a small shopping center so parking is a non-issue. The nail salon is quite large and there were a ton of technicians working. On the flip side, there were also a ton of patrons waiting to be served. I was greeted immediately when I walked in by a guy at the front station. He seemed cool, friendly, asked if it was my first visit and gave me the lay of the land. They keep a notebook on the counter to keep track of the customer order. He also pointed out that they keep the customer list with services provided because they guaranty 1 week on the no-chip, for example. I retorted with the fact that my no-chips typically last at least 2 weeks and my current set had been on for 3! I got him to smile but that was it... LOL. They had a good selection of no-chip colors which was great because sometimes I feel cheated or forced to pick xyz shade because that's all they had. The negative, which I will explain in more detail later, is that I had never, ever, ever heard of any of the "brands" of polish. I raised an eyebrow at that but was nevertheless willing to try out the experience.So I narrowed it down 2 shades and walked to the back to match them with a regular polish for my pedicure. That's when I met Lan. Lan was soooooo sweet. She checked out my selection and was on a mission to find my match! She was on it! Back and forth she went. I just stood there like, word? This is great service. After a few minutes she found the exact shade to match one of the colors. I was sold. They had even labeled the color # from the no-chip polish with the match on the regular polish colors for this very purpose. Then... she noticed that I already had no chip polish on my nails so she started prepping me with the acetone on foil wrap. Excellent. Then... someone came back for an eyebrow wax and I learned that Lan was the "wax lady" too! She was my homey by that point, so I opted to kill time by getting an underarm wax. She used a chocolate wax and did a good job. Mind you my nails were wrapped in foil at this point, so she was really helpful in getting my shirt out of my arm and back without making a mess. LOL. We bonded! I noticed that not only does she do waxing and help customers here and there, she was basically did any other ad hoc work that's needed around the salon.No clue how much time had passed at this point... a lot... but it wasn't bad because I was moving and shaking with Ms. Lan. When I emerged from the wax room, it was my turn at the pedi station! Yesssss! Lewis/Louis (who knows how he spells it LOL) was my technician for my nails. He did a good job in terms of service. He was friendly, although he did make one sideways comment and I wanted to check him at the time but I brushed it off. His station also had the UV light built into his desk. How cool is that? I had never seen that before.The no-name polishes could never allow it to be a 5, but the great service from the guy at the front, Lan and Lewis, and the prices COULD have made it a 4. However, I now have an informed decision about my nails since I waited 1.5 weeks to write my review. Love the color. Hate the quality of the polish - for both the no-chip and regular. I have a small chip on 2 different nails and the surface of the nails look so distressed. A male friend even noticed the difference between my last set (that again, lasted 3 weeks from a spot in Atlanta (yes I reviewed them too!)). He was like... your last polish looked better (not the color, the polish... this coming from a dude who knows nothing about nails!). I didn't even ask for the feedback... homeboy just volunteered it like umm, did you go to the same place? UGH! Not cool. And my pedicure polish has faded and is chipped even more. My regular pedis usually last 2-3 weeks easy! Sheesh. I thought I found a hidden gem and really wanted to like this place more but unless I'm bringing my own OPI or Essie polish for them to use why bother? 4-star for service and price, 2-star for results and quality. I've certainly had better and the fact that I need to get both hands and feet re-done after just 1.5 weeks is unacceptable. I wanted to round up my 2.5 to a 3 but I can't, I just can't.

10.description: This is a decent spot. I think I make it easy on them since I only request a very simple pedi whenever I go. I like Mai (I believe is her name). She had to put a little extra work in on my feet and she did it gracefully :)Just your average shop, it gets very busy, even on weekdays at certain times. I don't make appointments, just walk in and I typically don't wait too long before being seen (max was an hour, right before easter).

5.description: Sooooo....this is what happened. You tell me if this is good work I asked for elegance and they gave me sloppy! And then charged me $52.This is some bull shit. I'm getting married Friday....I asked them dose this look like wedding nails.... The person that did it wants to put it back on the customer. The colors are pretty but it's your skills that are tacky and unprofessional

3.description: Very bad customer service. They are not nice at all. they do dont quality work. They are packed but dont treat there patrons as they should. I wouldn't recommend this shop to anyone. they guy at the front is rude as hell.

35.description: I live nearby but this was the first time I stopped by. The place is clean and the service quick and very meticulous... And I'm super picky about those things. All of the staff were really friendly and they even gave me a mask because the fumes were bothering me. My gel nails are perfectly sculpted and the gentleman that helped me really inspected the shape, length, and eventually polish of each nail. The pedicure was also more than I expected for the price, my feet are suuuper  soft. I'm getting lashes also and after seeing the lady in front of me I expect they will be equally impressive! I will definitely be back!

19.description: Sigh! I don't know why I continue to come here. They are constantly late?! Which is odd because they know that people arrive early because they are so busy. I decided to try and get a pedi on a Friday morning. Woke up early to try and beat the crowds or at least be one of the first few to serviced. I arrive at 9:55am. Line is around the corner as if they were giving away free Mani/Pedi's. 10am rolls around and the owner finally arrives. Doesn't give a "Hey guys, sorry about the wait" but strolls in as if he's on time . I ended up leaving because of the wait time. They're  super cheap and the location is convenient but I can't come here anymore. If you have nothing but free time this is the place for you!

28.description: Went in on a Sat afternoon and it wasn't extremely busy, which I appreciated. Very prompt service, they give discounts when using cash with many stations for service. I would go back and I recommend the place.

45.description: *Update*I've been back a few more times and some more thoughts:- very thoughtful customer service.  Diana remembered my name after only working on my nails once.  Tuan also points out new colors that I might interested in (e.g. color changing gel manicures)- great selection of colors/products- looooong wait times.  I went at 4-5 pm on Friday and waited 40 minutes.  I left then because there was no end in sight for the line. I returned at 11:30 am Saturday morning and the wait was over 1 hour.  I love that they are doing so well but maybe they can institute an online booking system?- I have had my eyebrows done multiple times and they do a great job.  I usually get the older lady (Tuan's mother, maybe?).  I broke out once or twice so now I ask them not to use the razors.  They thread in combination with waxing and tweezing which is perfect.

33.description: I LOVE this place. It's very clean, well organized. They serve u fast but neatly done(on a good day) I always come here. Well worth it. And they are very respectful and nice.  Best non ghetto nail shop in the hood

43.description: No chip manicures are $27 credit card / $25 cashPedicures are $22 CC (I think) / $20 cashUnderarm wax $15It's located in a small shopping center so parking is a non-issue. The nail salon is quite large and there were a ton of technicians working. On the flip side, there were also a ton of patrons waiting to be served. I was greeted immediately when I walked in by a guy at the front station. He seemed cool, friendly, asked if it was my first visit and gave me the lay of the land. They keep a notebook on the counter to keep track of the customer order. He also pointed out that they keep the customer list with services provided because they guaranty 1 week on the no-chip, for example. I retorted with the fact that my no-chips typically last at least 2 weeks and my current set had been on for 3! I got him to smile but that was it... LOL. They had a good selection of no-chip colors which was great because sometimes I feel cheated or forced to pick xyz shade because that's all they had. The negative, which I will explain in more detail later, is that I had never, ever, ever heard of any of the "brands" of polish. I raised an eyebrow at that but was nevertheless willing to try out the experience.So I narrowed it down 2 shades and walked to the back to match them with a regular polish for my pedicure. That's when I met Lan. Lan was soooooo sweet. She checked out my selection and was on a mission to find my match! She was on it! Back and forth she went. I just stood there like, word? This is great service. After a few minutes she found the exact shade to match one of the colors. I was sold. They had even labeled the color # from the no-chip polish with the match on the regular polish colors for this very purpose. Then... she noticed that I already had no chip polish on my nails so she started prepping me with the acetone on foil wrap. Excellent. Then... someone came back for an eyebrow wax and I learned that Lan was the "wax lady" too! She was my homey by that point, so I opted to kill time by getting an underarm wax. She used a chocolate wax and did a good job. Mind you my nails were wrapped in foil at this point, so she was really helpful in getting my shirt out of my arm and back without making a mess. LOL. We bonded! I noticed that not only does she do waxing and help customers here and there, she was basically did any other ad hoc work that's needed around the salon.No clue how much time had passed at this point... a lot... but it wasn't bad because I was moving and shaking with Ms. Lan. When I emerged from the wax room, it was my turn at the pedi station! Yesssss! Lewis/Louis (who knows how he spells it LOL) was my technician for my nails. He did a good job in terms of service. He was friendly, although he did make one sideways comment and I wanted to check him at the time but I brushed it off. His station also had the UV light built into his desk. How cool is that? I had never seen that before.The no-name polishes could never allow it to be a 5, but the great service from the guy at the front, Lan and Lewis, and the prices COULD have made it a 4. However, I now have an informed decision about my nails since I waited 1.5 weeks to write my review. Love the color. Hate the quality of the polish - for both the no-chip and regular. I have a small chip on 2 different nails and the surface of the nails look so distressed. A male friend even noticed the difference between my last set (that again, lasted 3 weeks from a spot in Atlanta (yes I reviewed them too!)). He was like... your last polish looked better (not the color, the polish... this coming from a dude who knows nothing about nails!). I didn't even ask for the feedback... homeboy just volunteered it like umm, did you go to the same place? UGH! Not cool. And my pedicure polish has faded and is chipped even more. My regular pedis usually last 2-3 weeks easy! Sheesh.
