I thought I found a hidden gem and really wanted to like this place more but unless I'm bringing my own OPI or Essie polish for them to use why bother? 4-star for service and price, 2-star for results and quality. I've certainly had better and the fact that I need to get both hands and feet re-done after just 1.5 weeks is unacceptable. I wanted to round up my 2.5 to a 3 but I can't, I just can't.

2.description: I've been here several times to get my eyebrows done, and each visit ends in worse and worse eyebrows. I have thick eyebrows that I like to get shaped and waxed, and EVERY time I  come here my brows are waxed way too thin. At this point I'm just done and will find a way to master waxing my eyebrows at home.

18.description: My daughter and I had a great experience here on Saturday. It was our first time visiting the nail salon and we were not disappointed. We each had a pedicure, no chip manicure and eye brow arch. Our favorite part of the visit were the nail technicians. Both John and "Sweetheart" were engaging and very professional. We will certainly be returning every two weeks.

41.description: The guy in the front has this system in his head where he organizes who gets served next... As he should. HOWEVER his "system" is entirely flawed... Just go in and be real flamboyant/extra/ loud then you'll always get to keep your place in line. If you depend on them to take your name being next on the sign in sheet seriously then I'm sorry to tell you, you will be skipped. Especially if your not a very obnoxious person.  So just make sure you come in here with a gang of cousins/ girl-friends or just be really obnoxious and I'm sure you'll have a great visit. Honestly their work ethic could be deemed completely "normal" if all other nail salons operated at any level of professionalism... But since most nail salons are 2nd world luxury, then that makes Taday nail spa the best of the worst in comparison, but that's not saying much. Just typical. They are mean. If your basic, you'll love it, I promise.

52.description: Twan is thee best! Great at a conservative nail or a ratchet design. Very versatile.  Clean shop. Nice crowd. Good customer service. Good news!!! There's no longer a 1$ charge for using a card.

50.description: I randomly called Taday to see if I could get my eyebrows waxed. The gentleman who answered the phone had a friendly demeanor which provoked me to go. The salon is nice; a lot of color selections as it appears most of their business comes from nails. I usually get my eyebrows threaded so getting them waxed made me a bit nervous. The wax was a perfect temperature (temperature of the wax was the reason I stopped getting waxed in the first place.) The woman doing the waxing used pencil to draw the shape before applying the wax which impressed me. Too often I see wax smeared on an eyebrow freehand and prayers are sent in the atmosphere- hope for the best! Not this place. She knew exactly where that wax was going! She took her time, arched them perfectly and cleaned up the little stray hairs. The cost is reasonable and the location is convenient (especially having a small parking lot). I will definitely be returning for my eyebrows and probably to get my nails done too, some of the designs they can do are amazing!

4.description: Today was my first time at Taday I got a no chip & gel overlay manicure and a regular pedicure I absolutely love my nails, prices were reasonable compared to other salons & for the quality of the work, he did exactly what I asked of him on my nails & the young woman did great on my feet.my only complaint is the SUPER long wait time, (I was there for over 2 hours) but now that i know better I will call ahead and schedule a appt. you can also request who you would like to service you! cool ambiance & all the clients seemed to love everything and they have lots of regulars. I will be back!

6.description: Came here for a no chip since its close to work and open until 7:30. Tall young skinny guy with glasses did my no chip and did a great job. They were swamped and always are. THIS MEANS THEY DO GOOD WORK. Always busy translates to returning customers. Prices are cheaper than what I pay by my house. I came back a week later to get a pedicure and again totally swamped with customers. I don't mind waiting because I know they will take their time on me. Jennifer did my pedicure and did a great job, even at 6:45pm which is the tail end of her day. If you have the time to wait, come here. Call a day ahead and make an appointment. They won't disappoint.

22.description: DON'T TAKE THE RISK! HORRIBLE!I've come to this shop for 2 years. After this review, I will never support this business ever in life, nor should you. First, my nails are damaged. The technicians which I'm comfortable with weren't there, I went to another technician. This was a bad choice. After requesting my services, agreeing on a fee, paying the fee, and getting my nails completed I was very dissatisfied. While letting my hands and feet dry, I called other nail shops to take care of me. I'd waisted my money, I didn't bother complaining, I took a gamble going to a tech I didn't know and the turn out was, gummy polish and a mess on my hands. Just Horrible. This is NOT what lead to this review. What happened next is why I'll never refer, recommend,or review this shop highly. After booking an appointment at a streeterville nail shop, which was costly, but did better more professional work, I'd  gracefully gathered my belongings and preceded to leave. The owner from his front seat location, whom had waited for my nails to dry, didn't inquire about my services, bolted out, "you owe $5 dollars", I was leaving with a another customer I'd meet there, and wasn't sure he was speaking to me, being, I'd paid my money. They'd taken the card and completed the horrible services. I then replied, with a smile and calmly, "no, I paid in full" After what was already a horrible experience, and still needing to get to another shop for nails, plus eye brows, I ended up wasting my time recapping my visit and being falsely accused of owing $5!! I felt humiliated, my entire day was disturbed. These 2 men and a women went back and fourth with me over $5. Then agreed to do my nails over seeing it was mess, I'd declined. 2hrs in the shop, to come out with mess, no thank you. I'd waisted enough time and money. I've seen and heard Twan speak poorly to clients, but I've noticed he chooses whom he'll address properly and not based upon maybe looks. I don't know, but the way I was treated I'm still very hurt and upset. I didn't pay the $5, after I said, well I don't like being called a liar, I don't owe you anything. I already took a loss and wasn't going to complain at all, I refuse to do anymore. I said well what now. While holding my Alexander Wang  duffle bag, and zipping my Mackage jacket, nothing about me is broke. The principles and respect were the issue. They said they'd call the police, I said ok. And prepared to wait. They didn't attempt to call anyone, Twan, accused me of being a liar-, said he'd pay it, and I THEN got upset. Worse experience in my entire life!Twan doesn't respect his clients. Honestly, I don't leave reviews when upset, I just don't return to the place. After this I'm not only NOT returning, I'll tell everyone to not support them. I read other reviews, and I tell you, yes they are clean, but the craftsmanship is mediocre. There are other shops, I support local business, but this one will never get a dime from me or anyone I know. Side Note, I told my husband, he told me they'd just about sawed his foot off last visit I begged him to go with me, and my accountant said her nails just popped off! Didn't know this until I'd vented and everyone then shared their horrible experiences.

15.description: Best nail shop ever Best Pedis ever! Not that great at polishing! But good nails and pedis

20.description: Took a chance on a Saturday evening with my roommate. The wait was a tad long but that just goes to show how popular this buisness is. Every person that we encountered was super friendly and the salon had a great vibe. I got a pedi and a color change for my no chip and my roomie got a no chip mani. The orginal color I wanted was out but my manicurist picked out a similar color for me and I love it! Both of us are super satifisfied with both the service and the price. We have tried other places in the Hyde Park area and have not found a gem like this one. We will be back!

36.description: This place is amaaaaazing! I have been looking for a shop that does modern styles - shapes and nail art. I have found it and have been a loyal client since! The owner knows how to run his business --he only hires the best. They offer a lot of services compared to salons --powder, no chips, nail art, eyebrows and lashes. Prices are competitive and they offer a discount if you pay with cash.

14.description: I live nearby but this was the first time I stopped by. The place is clean and the service quick and very meticulous... And I'm super picky about those things. All of the staff were really friendly and they even gave me a mask because the fumes were bothering me. My gel nails are perfectly sculpted and the gentleman that helped me really inspected the shape, length, and eventually polish of each nail. The pedicure was also more than I expected for the price, my feet are suuuper  soft. I'm getting lashes also and after seeing the lady in front of me I expect they will be equally impressive! I will definitely be back!

1.description: I will never be lazy and go to this shop again. First they didn't greet me than I sat in the pedicure chair for 20 mins while they walk and talk. Than the tech cut my foot. She wasn't gentle she kept grabbing and pulling. This was by far the worst experience. The only positives was the product she use to soften my feet

9.description: I will never come here again. I got an infection on my finger because the tech was rushing, cut my cuticle when she was pushing way too hard, and apparently was using dirty tools. Within 24 hours my finger was red, swollen and painful, and I had to go to urgent care to get it drained and get antibiotics. DO NOT COME HERE!

23.description: I debated on writing a review, but had to chime in. I preface my comment with the fact that I 1) got a mani-pedi , 2) went on a Saturday (no appts on Fri and Sat), and 3) had a 1-month old daughter at home albeit being watched by her grandfather. First, the mani-pedi prices are reasonable and competitive; however, the salon definitely prefers servicing fill-ins because they were seen relatively quickly after walking in. I say "relatively" because  I was in that salon for 3.5 hours from the time I walked in until the time I walked out (and I spent less than 5 minutes at the drying station). I thought this place offered convenience because it is my neighborhood, but I will definitely continue to explore other places. My word of advice is to avoid going on Fridays and Saturdays, if you can.

5.description: Right off the bat I can tell this place is cleaner than Fairy Nails. But, of course, there are two men up front doing acrylics and running the place while 11 women are scurrying around handling all the ladies here today. Refer to my Fairy Nails review about the NYT article.My name was fifth on the waiting list but they called me by the time I picked my color. Unexplainably, the bulk of the colors are kept behind the men up front and check-out counter out of reach to get a good look at the color. Maybe people steal polish and this is their solution.I asked them to clean the pedi bowl before putting water in for me. They said they clean after every pedi so I'm waiting to see if that's the case when the next pedi finishes. One plantar's wart was enough. OK, I see a gal cleaning...still playing it safe and not putting my feet down except my heel.I asked the technician to clean the tools before starting. She said she already did but I asked her to do it again. They don't have their tools in disinfectant solution but, rather, just spray the tools with alcohol and wipe them. Ugh.As I look around, this place really is much nicer than Fairy Nails. It's much roomier, there's nice paint on the walls, some spa-like art work and a couple of nice tvs and the smell isn't overwhelming. And, again, it seems to be much, much cleaner. However, the waiting area is very small.The foot/leg massages in places like this are usually short, but my gal did a nice job. Also, they give new toe separaters to reach client. They reuse at Fairy Nails. Gross.This nail place is definitely the lesser of two evils for those wanting mani/pedis in Hyde Park.

25.description: Love love love this place. I have acrylic nails and this place is nothing but consistent and amazing. They are so nice, the place is always clean, and the prices are right. The color selection is fairly small but everything else makes up for it.

12.description: I thought they did a really nice job. They weren't pushy about up selling, which I hate. The only con was that we had to wait a little. It was clear they had no idea that I made an appt, but we weren't in a rush. The massage chairs were good too!

21.description: I really enjoyed my experience at HPNS.  The service was friendly, the place is clean and good looking (huge flatscreen, top of the line massage chairs).  They DISINFECT their tools--a deal breaker for me, and sadly not always the case at some other local spots.  I even let Loi talk me into getting a no chip and I am so glad that I did.  My nails look great and they are totally dry when she finishes the manicure.  I mean totally, like I-could-dig-a-ditch-with-them dry..  The prices are reasonable.  Unlike another reviewer, I saw a wide selection of nail colors.  They even had exactly the color I like, which sometimes is hard to find.

16.description: Just moved to Hyde Park so glad I found this great place for my eyebrow wax! Quick and neat... Was in an out in a jiffy and completely satisfied!

17.description: Tried this place because its close to my home. It's clean and I was very satisfied with my service! I recommend this place. I get gel overlays and I never have any compliants. The lady that does my nails is very friendly. Her name is Lori.  Check her out!

10.description: I said to myself "Hey try them out again." Why and the hell did I do that?? I came in and was told that it would be a 20 minute wait!! I looked around and saw at least three nail techs reading magazines!! They could have been on break! If that was the case they should have been in the back. Workers just chilling shouldn't be seen especially if there is a lot of people waiting to be serviced!!!!!!!!!!! I waited the twenty minutes and got frustrated and left!!! Two times is a charm for me!! Neverrr again!!!!

11.description: This place was awesome for a French mani-pedi.  I made an appointment the day prior, just a day before our engagement photos were scheduled to be shot, and it was one of the most clean-lined mani-pedi's I've ever enjoyed.The place does bustle, though (I assume word has spread!), so I do recommend calling ahead to make an appointment so that you're not disappointed at the door if they ask you to wait.

26.description: The service was great. I was seen right away. I just love this place.

27.description: i was so happy to see a new nail shop in the laundry mat strip mall. i generally get mani/pedis from who ever is offering a $20 daily deal so i have been to a lot of places. there pedicure chair and big and comfy and have nice massage settings, arm  rest and a little desk, they also have free wifi. the manicure chairs are office style and also comfortable i jus dont llike how the kinda roll all over the place. they have a large selection of the latest colors from essie and opi and my polish lasts for at least a week. a mani/ pedi is $30 polish change for hands and feet is $13. welcome addition to the neighborhood

0.description: I like this place.  I come here regularly for a mani/pedi.  The no chip actually lasts for 2 weeks if not more (which isn't true for other salons in the area).  The staff are friendly and always take care of me. I rarely have to wait. Although I come in during the week.  The scrub and hot towels are a nice touch.  I gave this place 4 stars and not 5 because while it's not a lavish Spa it provides a reliable service for a great price.

20.description: Ok, I was skeptical because the first time i walked in, there was a 2 hour wait because they only had one person doing acrylic nails.  I waited another week to go back because i didn't have time and when I did I only had to wait about 15 minutes.  The shop looked clean and they put on the acrylics in a snap.  I was pleased with the shape and the color (although the lady seemed a little annoyed that i didn't pick my color right before sitting down lol - but i hadn't had my nails done in so long i forgot that was the protocol).  At any rate, I'm going back again but I suggest getting there as early as possible because it is a walk-in shop.  I LOVED the price as well!! Overall, good place to get your nails done, but they do need more staff that can do fill-ins/acrylics/gel nails.

19.description: I really enjoyed my experience at HPNS.  The service was friendly, the place is clean and good looking (huge flatscreen, top of the line massage chairs).  They DISINFECT their tools--a deal breaker for me, and sadly not always the case at some other local spots.  I even let Loi talk me into getting a no chip and I am so glad that I did.  My nails look great and they are totally dry when she finishes the manicure.  I mean totally, like I-could-dig-a-ditch-with-them dry..  The prices are reasonable.  Unlike another reviewer, I saw a wide selection of nail colors.  They even had exactly the color I like, which sometimes is hard to find.

2.description: Not great, not especially good either, but if you have nowhere else to go, this will technically do.

18.description: Just left and had a great experience. Very thorough mani / pedi for a reasonable $30. My feet feel the smoothest they've felt in quite some time. I even messed up one of my nails being a busy body while wrapping up. The woman doing my nails re-painted my mistake with no issue. Overall, pleasant experience and I'd return.

13.description: This place is terrible. I've gotten my nails done twice here. The first time I hated the service, I was one of the last people and since they were ready to go they rushed me out with out my nail NOR my feet were dry. They all were smudged. I decided to give them a second chance. The second time the old man was VERY rude and he RUSHED doing my nails. He dug into my nails way too deep with the drill. Not only did I get my nails done about a week ago THREE nails came off. Within a week?!?! I think NOT!! Their service of HORRIFYING!! You would because we are in Hyde park it would b better but no. Try again. They do very nice pedicures tho

4.description: Great first experience, especially after trying Fairy Nail. 10-20 min wait, not bad, and decent customer service. I will be returning. Only con is the dried up acrylic and nail polish left on my fingers (See picture)

24.description: Tried this place because its close to my home. It's clean and I was very satisfied with my service! I recommend this place. I get gel overlays and I never have any compliants. The lady that does my nails is very friendly. Her name is Lori.  Check her out!

6.description: The workers come in late. Water for pedicure gets cold too easily. Their polish is old and dried out. The overall customer service and quality of work is lacking.

22.description: I stumbled upon this place several months ago because it was close to my weekend chores. The first time I went here, I thought the decor was nice, pedicure chairs lovely and friendly staff. However, I didn't like the quality of the gel fill-in I received. The man was a sweet heart, but he laid the gel extremely thick on my nails and didn't file them down correctly. Last week, while in a bind I decided to go back. The service was drastically different. The man gave me an even sloppier fill-in and didn't want to fix his mistakes while polishing my nails. He also rushed me which was weird considering there was no one behind me. Also, the lady servicing a client next me was even more rude that my person. Although I like the convenience of Hyde Park, I'd rather not patron this place again.

15.description: Look. I've been avoiding creating a yelp page for years, but if that's my only way to get the word out, then it shall be done. I have been to this salon 4 times now, including this one. I have only had my nails done 2/4 of those times. This is because the wait is always incredibly long no matter what time of day.First, I was never greeted when I walked into the establishment. I'm willing to let that slide as long as I receive proper service afterwards. Okay, I understand that during regular nail hours, everyone is here & the wait is long. Fine. But I showed up at 10am (opening) to get my nails done. There is one man here. What does this mean? That even though I showed up early, I'm still waiting 45 freaking minutes to even have someone look at my nails.To add insult to injury, the establishment does not give the appearance if a prestigious and clean nail salon. The window sills are dusty. The paint is chipped and faded. I turned my head and there's a thick black spider crawling by the front desk. I nearly died.I have all of this to say, and I haven't even gotten to the actual nail experience yet. After waiting 30 minutes, I said forget the manicure, I'll just get a pedicure once it's my turn. At last, another woman strolls in and I'm hoping I will FINALLY have my toes done. Now. Even though I signed the sign in sheet, the woman goes to the lady who entered AFTER me (and was seated behind me) and asks HER what she wants. Why the hell did she skip over me?I go to pick my color, there aren't even that many options. I wanted a dark blue, there isn't one. Maybe the woman before me took the only one? Idk. Fine. Dark purple is fine.But then the woman makes me bleed, because she picked off too much "dead" skin. She came out with her ear piece in. I ignorantly assumed she would listen to music. No. She was on her phone. But whatever, I guess. I wasn't really in the mood for small talk ANYWAY.Did my nails look nice? Sure. I wonder if that's what keeps people coming back here for despite the terrible service and horribly long wait. But my toe hurt where she cut me, so I'm marking points off for that. And I was in there 1 hour & 45 minutes. So that horrible assault of my free time was actually not worth it.

7.description: I've been waiting for a fill in for over an hour. Other people have come and gone and I'm still waiting. I came here a couple of times before, on the fence about the services. This will be my last time.

8.description: I've only ever gotten pedicures here (it's the only salon service I ever really get, since I paint my fingernails and shape my eyebrows at home). The price is FABULOUS--I think it was only $22 or $23? I definitely paid less than $30 including tip. The nail techs sanitize their equipment right in front of you. One tip though: if you walk in and HAD made a reservation, be vocal about it. If it's busy, they have a sign-in sheet for customers and take care of each person in order (without cross-checking to prioritize reservations). I don't think they're being rude, it's just a disorganized system they use (and I went during prom season, when every nail salon is in a panic). Don't be shy--just be clear, and alert a nail tech you have a reservation and they will bump up your priority. Best pedicure I've ever had? No, but it was really nice, and worth it. They added a few details to make the pedicure better than average, like a hot towel and stones.

3.description: I love this place! The staff is super friendly and they do a great job. They are always available. They don't close often.

14.description: Walked in and walked out; this place has the same air quality issues as Fairy Nails down on Harper.  Went with a friend around 4:00 pm on Saturday and it looked busy, so we certainly would have had to wait.  The moment we stepped through the door, the noxious manicure fumes enveloped us, so we left right away.  Maybe the air would be cleaner if going on a weekday when business is slower?(I give HP Nails two stars for the benefit of the doubt - maybe their product is good!)

0.description: I absolutely love La'Drissa!  I have been seeing her now for over two years.  I used to struggle with facial hair/ingrowns, but she took care of ALL that!

3.description: I am so glad to have this store in the area!  It's great to have somewhere to go clothes shopping in Hyde Park.This is like any other discount store like Marshalls, TJ Max,etc.  They are hit or miss.  Sometimes you find a bunch of great items, sometimes you don't find anything.I have bought several nice dresses for great prices here.

1.description: I am so excited that Ross is on 47th Street!!! Yeah now I don't have to travel out to 94th and Western.

2.description: I had no idea this Ross was here until A friend of mine told me. I stopped in not really expecting to find much, but I was pleasantly surprised. I was looking for decorations for my classroom, and found lots of neat little items. I can't comment on the clothes selection since I didn't look at them. I will definitely return.

9.description: I had a problem with a returned purchase the  Manager Paul was nice the staff needs more training in customer service..

10.description: I have been to Ross a few times but never really been impressed with them. Although the store is nice and clean and the employees are friendly and helpful they still do not impress me. Most of the things they sell look like junk that I really don't need and does not really appeal to me

4.description: Had a great time going through the racks. Found some incredible deals in men's, women's, and home sections. Friendly and helpful staff.

6.description: Store is really empty. Very few selections for everything. I asked the cashier to double bag my pillows and she said she can only give me one bag. So I asked for a large bag to pack my other stuff in. She gave me a medium bag and when ask asked her again she was like "you mean Extra Large?!" Point is: she made a huge fuss about a freaking bag! It is close to were I live but I rather go downtown So i can have more options. I don't like to buy things just because it's the only thing they had in stores.

11.description: Thrilled to have this store in the Hyde Park/Kenwood/Woodlawn area. It's a lot like TJMaxx and Marshalls in terms of selection (clothing, home goods, toiletries, etc.) and prices.  I haven't seen much advertising so I'm not sure how many people in the area are aware that Ross is in the neighborhood or what its selection is like. I went there today and purchased some high-end shampoo & lotion for $2.99/bottle and nice glassware for $6.99 per 4 glasses. I will definitely be back!  Please stop by Ross sometime so we can keep a store like this in business in our neighborhood.  Easy parking.

5.description: Maybe its me but this store is full off rags. Not my cup of tea. I saw items that would be much better selling at the family dollar. I'm giving 2 stars because the young lady at the front door was nice when I came in and when I left out.  I will try coming back just to see if I see something  give it 1 more try.

7.description: It's about damn time a discount store made it to the Kenwood/Hyde Park area! Considering how the city treats the South and West Sides at large, this, in a sense, is "progress".The inventory is reasonably priced (except that fabric ottoman for $50, c'mon now, lol), so I have no complaints....except for the fact that the location may not restock a lot of items. So if you see something you like, you better buy it right then and there because you may not see that item EVER AGAIN!Did I mention it is ANIMAL FRIENDLY? YASSSS! Your pooch, cat, ferret, lobster or that endangered dodo is welcomed in the store and they don't have to be a service animal! My Coco came in ( she needed some PJS, yup, PJS) and had a blast with the employees and now everyone loves her whenever I bring her along!If you haven't walked into this store yet and you live in the area, you officially suck!

8.description: Ross is my favorite store for buying brand name items for a cheap price. The Ross on 47th is the best Ross that I have been to. The store is big and always clean. This one also has hidden gems and if you look hard enough, you'll find good deals. I once found an Anne Klein pea coat for $20 after spending two hours walking around the store. I like to stop by the home section every time I go there. There are some unique pieces and, without fail, the prices are a lot cheaper than the department stores. For example, I found a comforter set for $40 there. When I went to JC Penny, I found the same set for $150. Every time I want to purchase something, I'll stop by Ross first to see if I can get lucky and find it there.

0.description: So in the beginning I wasnt too much of a fan because there was a limited selection of things to choose from. But over time this store has improved big time! There's always more people in it now, and they have great decorative things like canvas paintings which I love for my room and I just recently bought a night stand and a chair for my room so don't underestimate what great things you might find here.

28.description: The first thing you'll notice about Fung's is that its a little rundown. Some of the characters are a bit shady, but it isn't in the nicest part of town. The real saving grace of this little asian-immigrant establishment is the food and its price. The service is average, sometimes curt and a little rough around the edges but otherwise fine.Above average Chinese food for amazingly dirt cheap prices. The meals easily can last for 2-3 meals and at less than $5-7, the value makes it worth the trip if you're nearby. However, its not mind blowing enough to be worth any trip over 15 minutes, but they do deliver. The hours are reasonable and they are open late. So if you're in the neighborhood and really craving that shrimp lobster fried rice, consider dropping by.

1.description: Orange chicken didn't even have a hint of orange flavor.   The shrimp fried rice it came with was just white rice doused in soy sauce with shrimp and a flavor that is just fish market. There's way too much oil in here. The "sauce" is oil with crushed red pepper flakes.  I've never had Chinese food so bad I had to throw it away. Until now.

9.description: Tons of food, really cheap, didn't get sick.But....it felt a little strange that, while we were waiting for our food (yes, if you really need some Fung's would advise either doing delivery or ordering ahead so you don't have to wait there...) at least five individuals actually came into the establishment to ask for food and/or money. I'm typically happy to give out food (not money) to someone who needs it....but this seemed a wee bit aggressive. Maybe I just need to get used to life on the South Side of Chicago.Also: Fung's totally gets a better rating than Regents Park management or MAC properties. Totally better.

23.description: 4 stars because of the rif raff outside the restaurant. Other than that the food is very good. Remember to call ahead usually a 10 min wait.

5.description: This place was gross. I had vegetable lo mein and it was ramen noodles. I also had broccoli and brown sauce and it was truly disappointing. I tried this place out because someone said it was close to nyc Chinese... That was a lie.

25.description: I was walking home from 47th street when I saw this Fung's Chop Suey. It's not a very nice place. I've passed by here a gazillion times but I never though to even glance at this until my stomach started calling. Inside is pretty empty - only a couple of tables, no deco at all, just an enlarged version of their full menu pasted on the wall...all the better to see! The lady behind the counter can't really understand English very well so do speak slowly. I ordered a Fung's Special to-go. My husband and I loved it to bits (yes! we shared!)! It was $8.95 in total but you get a serving worth of rice and 2 - 3 servings worth of the beef, chicken, shrimp, broccoli, chinese vege, and water chestnut in garlic brown sauce. The beef and chicken were tender, the shrimp fresh and crunchy, the sauce was tasty and flavorful. Of course it's not the Michelin kind of standard, but it's like what my grandma would cook and tastes just about as nice. Warms my heart to the core with such homecooked food!I wouldn't make a special trip here just to eat the food, but if you're in the neighborhood, no harm giving it a try!

12.description: It might look like a hole in the wall ???  but the food is very good !!   { the #7 pepper steak with fried rice is my favorite and i wish i had some right now } !

21.description: Surprisingly good for the hole-in-wall kind of place it is... We ordered delivery... Food came fast, was hot and in enormous quantity for the price... Truly good hot and sour soup, very good egg rolls (a bit greasy), very large "large" entrees with lots of big shrimp. First time ordered... Will definitely order again.

16.description: The last time I ordered from here was about 5 years ago when I lived across the street...The food use to be verrrrrrrrrrrrry greasy. The shrimp that they used the the fried rice had to been deveined..Yuck I am not trying to eat Shrimp poo poo. So I stopped going there.Some of my coworkers ordered from there and it smelled soo good..I said to myself I should try it again. They must have new management because my meal was awesome. I didn't get the shrimp tho I played it safe just in case. I got the Chicken and Broccoli with a brown sauce with black beans and spicy chicken fried rice with extra green onions. It's good!  I am eating it right now as I type!! Still a bit greasy but hey it cost 4.95.

17.description: Good, cheap, and huge portions.  Delivery experience was WAY better than pickup.

10.description: very cheap, tasty Egg Foo Young!

11.description: ABSOLUTELY PATHETIC!  I AM EMBARRASSED FOR THESE PEOPLE!I was charged $3 for delivery and I put in a 10% gratuity on top if it for Fung's Chop Suey, which is LESS THAN a mile away from my apartment.  And the driver had the AUDACITY to instruct me to come down and collect the food from his car!?!?!?What arrogance!  And when the restaurant called me to, I presume, clarify, all I did was ask for a refund.  Why would you charge 20% above the cost of my order for delivery and see that I have already granted gratuity only to them make me work for my food.  No, Sir!Crap ass service!

26.description: This is about as close to New York style Chinese food that you can find anywhere near Hyde Park and probably even the rest of Chicago. It totally blows all the other Chinese places around here away. Very fresh, well seasoned, flavorful food and at very cheap prices. I've tried their apps which are solid and a couple of their combo meals but the Mongolian chicken stands out with chunks of chicken and a spicy sauce.Delivery is cash only but it is free (tip nicely) and there's no minimum either which I guess is a huge oddity in Chicago. Everyone I've dealt with, the order taker on the phone and the delivery guy, have all been very nice and friendly.

27.description: When the food is fresh its really good.The problem is that its not always fresh.My favs here are the Orange chicken and the kung pao shrimp.The lady at the counter is ALWAYS an arse which is unfortunate.She really has a hard time with the words customer service and friendly

0.description: Great prices. Quick order turnaround. Get the combination Kung Pao... The small order. It's $5.25 for a ton of food

20.description: The last time I ordered from here was about 5 years ago when I lived across the street...The food use to be verrrrrrrrrrrrry greasy. The shrimp that they used the the fried rice had to been deveined..Yuck I am not trying to eat Shrimp poo poo. So I stopped going there.Some of my coworkers ordered from there and it smelled soo good..I said to myself I should try it again. They must have new management because my meal was awesome. I didn't get the shrimp tho I played it safe just in case. I got the Chicken and Broccoli with a brown sauce with black beans and spicy chicken fried rice with extra green onions. It's good!  I am eating it right now as I type!! Still a bit greasy but hey it cost 4.95.

19.description: I am still a fan but I wonder if this place is under new management . I have never had any problems till I placed an order while I was in South Holland . When I got there I had to wait almost 30 min for my order still I and the food wasn't that good . hope they get it together.

2.description: don't come here if you care about your health. yea, its cheap, yea the menu looks great, yea you may think its just your average chinese place. but no, i should've backed away from this place when i saw how unkept the interior and the kitchen looked. i saw the people in the back coughing and not washing their hands, but i thought nothing of it because i was trying to be cheap. i wouldve went to italian fiesta next door, but i never carry cash on me. so i ordered the chicken lo mein, and my god those were NOT lo mein noodles, and that was NOT chicken. whatever meat substance they put in there was very rubbery and pinkish on the inside but mostly white as if it were boiled or something, and thats not how i remember chicken lo mein to be. I don't know what kind of noodles they use but they weren't the regular lo mein noodles you'd expect. after a couple of bites, I just put the entire dish away because I couldn't continue to consume whatever it was they decided to give me. the noodles looked grey. the "chicken" looked grey and now i will be calling off work tomorrow because i had to throw up this meal, and I can't stop :) I repeat, do NOT go here. there are other chinese food places in the area, but you're honestly better off with thai food. eat at ur own risk.

18.description: I'm New to the area and I am anal about Chinese food since I have been eating it all my life. With that being said, I am definitely a fan of Fung's. Went there at random to see the quality of the food and it was GREAT. They give you more than enough food for a low price. A lunch special could be a meal for 2-3 people with all the food they give.

13.description: i usually get my chinese food from here during lunch.  I always order the beef with rice/gravy and fried won-ton.  My co-workers have tried lunch specials and they always give you a lot of food under $5.  The food is tasty and they prepare your food  fast which i like.  The smoothies are awesome and right @ $3.  One of my favorite places for lunch.

4.description: Today I ordered from Fung's and the food was not fresh. The rice tasted very old and the sweet and sour chicken sauce had an awful taste. When I called the restaurant to complain, the attendant answering the phone began to make outrageous comments towards me for calling about the food. I do not suggest anyone goes to this restaurant.

24.description: The food here is good but at times it is not very good. Also the lady who works here could use a lesson in customer service.

6.description: You mean, I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown to have decent Chinese in Hyde Park? This place was surprisingly good! I had the Mongolian Beef (great, but a few too many onions) and the beef chow-fun (great, but the noodles were just slightly overdone). I had been craving beef chow fun for years; not been able to find it since leaving NYC. I almost did a dance when I saw they had it, and it tasted great. Their service is friendly, they have great wonton soup, the prices are cheap.  I always call ahead. This is now my go-to Chinese restaurant in Hyde Park.

22.description: A good place for a ton of decent chinese food at cheap prices. Not the highest quality thing, but what do you expect for Chinese take out? The food settled the craving and hits the spot. The service is good and location is great for Hyde Parkers. Yes, the location could use a pick me up on the inside deco, but I feel badly for small businesses these days. It seems hard to weather the recession storm plus loads of Chicago taxes. As long as they keep delivering on service and standard Chinese, I will keep returning the few times a year when I want Chinese takeout.

15.description: My go-to, neighborhood spot for good chinese food! You can order ahead and go pick it up, which I recommend. Delivery for those that live in the neighborhood.

7.description: The food is good. I'm scoring this at 4 stars because the food was delivered fast and was yummy. The delivery charge is $3, which wasn't advertised on Grubhub.com like the other restaurants and a little too salty, but... overall.. good stuff.

8.description: This place doesn't look like much. However, the food was pretty good, much better quality than expected, and a step above your average Chinese take-out. The portions are also huge, and the prices were extremely reasonable. You would be hard pressed to find a better bang for your buck.

3.description: This place is a hit or miss. Whenever I order something new, I really hope that it taste good. My all time favs is the spicy chicken fried rice and broccoli and chicken fried rice combo. The customer service here needs improvement. If you're not a regular customer, don't expect smiles, friendly comments, or for the workers to be patient with you. I've been coming here for years and noticed a lot of bad service but I like a said its a real hit or miss.

14.description: I was walking home from 47th street when I saw this Fung's Chop Suey. It's not a very nice place. I've passed by here a gazillion times but I never though to even glance at this until my stomach started calling. Inside is pretty empty - only a couple of tables, no deco at all, just an enlarged version of their full menu pasted on the wall...all the better to see! The lady behind the counter can't really understand English very well so do speak slowly. I ordered a Fung's Special to-go. My husband and I loved it to bits (yes! we shared!)! It was $8.95 in total but you get a serving worth of rice and 2 - 3 servings worth of the beef, chicken, shrimp, broccoli, chinese vege, and water chestnut in garlic brown sauce. The beef and chicken were tender, the shrimp fresh and crunchy, the sauce was tasty and flavorful. Of course it's not the Michelin kind of standard, but it's like what my grandma would cook and tastes just about as nice. Warms my heart to the core with such homecooked food!I wouldn't make a special trip here just to eat the food, but if you're in the neighborhood, no harm giving it a try!

0.description: You can't miss this barber shop while traveling east on 47th street.  It's the light of the cornor of 47th and Drexel.  With it's lime green decor and highly professional and talented barbers, Another Barber Shop is one of the BEST barber shops in the city of Chicago.Recently, Another Barber Shop opened it's doors to students of Columbia to film a movie for a school project.  Not only are the doors open for film, but also quality conversation, a dynamite chess match and some of the best debate regarding sports in Chicago.  The barbershop has employed many young teens as a means to help keep them off the streets and to keep their time positive and productive.The barber's are Bwat "B" (owner), Sean, Bri, Sean, Reggie and Greg.The average cost of a cut is $20 which includes a shave and for an additional $5 you may request a lining done w/ a razor.The barbershop also offers discounted haircut prices for seniors and students.

3.description: Went today and ordered the 11 pc special for 13.99 and asked for spicy and a large order of Cajun rice. I get to the drive thru window and they again asked what my side was. (See previous reviewer about talking in the background) After receiving my order I noticed the receipt said mild. I question the lady and she says I asked for mild. I said no, I asked for spicy. Then she goes and says it's spicy and that she just rang it in whatever. I then had to look at my chix and thought to myself ok, it's looks a little dark so maybe it's spicy. Bitch lied. Unfortunately i didnt know till i got home. I knew i should have bit into a piece right in front of her ass but then again who's to say these careless workers will do something to my corrected order. Don't plan on going back to this ghetto ass place.

1.description: I came here on a Tuesday to grab a quick bite to eat, and the word "quick" is not one that I can use here...at least on a Tuesday.  Granted, the Tuesday special  (and the current $5 Box special) are extremely popular, but that's no excuse for the slow service myself (and several others) received.It took over ten minutes to get a $5 Box consisting of 3 mild strips, a side of mashed potatoes, a side of macaroni and cheese, and a soft drink.  Even if the tenders have just been dropped into the fryer, it shouldn't take 10 minutes to be served.Why'd it take so long?  Glad you asked!  If the entire crew is off having personal conversations, or the entire kitchen staff disappears, then of course it'll take that long.  Especially if the front lobby is full of customers just wanting their food.Finally after people started complaining, and the cashier even complained about the TEN ORDERS that were just sitting in queue, the staff reappeared, ARGUED (in plain view and hearing of the customers) over who's fault it was that nothing is getting pushed out, food started to move.Oh and by the way, remember that macaroni and cheese I wanted as a side?  Didn't get it.  The biscuit?  Burned.Fail.  Big time.

2.description: I love Popeyes but I seriously will never go here again first they told me 12 mins after 20mins I went in asked for my food and they said I still have to wait for fries so I spent a total of 30 mins before I got my food I'm not exaggerating i have the snaps with the time post to prove it then when she finally brings my food she did not apologize for the extra time I had to wait nor did they compensate me for they miss up "ma'am would you like some water while you wait or here's some extra fries" I don't need hand outs but a 17 extra min wait that's absurd especially with no notification of the extra wait or no apologies

5.description: I'm only giving this place 1-star because I can't give it zero stars. In short, I spent nearly $20 and more than 20 minutes on food that I never received. After waiting, waiting, and waiting, I requested a refund and was told by the manager that my food was "already ready." Seriously? If it were already ready, why isn't it in my hands??? I took my money and left, without food. I drove up the street to Subway and got two sandwiches under two minutes for nearly half the price I was paying at Popeyes. If you're as smart as I know you are, you'd avoid this place like the plague.

6.description: I love Popeyes. I recently moved from the Brighton Park area to near hyde park area and I went to this Popeyes. Theses people must HATE there job because they are rude all the way through. They cut you off on the intercom to aask you questions you already answered if they were listening and they will have conversations with someone else in the background. I don't understand how any of them still have jobs. This is defitnately a hood spot which sucks because its the closest to my house. But I will drive 15min out of my way to avoid this place. Its sad how you can't give certain people jobs because they will abuse the heck out of it.

7.description: went back to this place today. waited 30 min for some nuggets and tenders. This place is a disgrace. the manager after looking at the time I placed my order and I got it offered me a free pop !

8.description: Popeyes has some of the best chicken and sides hands down! But not this place!!!! Everytime I come here they are out of something. This location is incredibly ghetto with horrible service. Don't even go inside because it's hard to comunicate through their bulletproof windows and just to find out they don't have Mac & Cheese or other itmes. I wish they shut this place down and revamp it.

9.description: I love Popeye's, especially the mashed potatoes, and the fact that they give you honey with the biscuits. With that said, I'm the first to review this particular location, and I hope for your sake I'm the last. I have never gotten poorer fast food service in my life. Rarely have I encountered people as rude in my life. NEVER have I had to physically reach over the counter to grab my food while an employee stood directly in front of me at the register. I would rather pay a bum to sell me one of his limbs and eat it raw than go back to this Popeye's. Trust me on this one.

0.description: Thankfully my experience yesterday was a whole lot better than previous reviewers experiences.  I've actually eaten food from here a few times and was always impressed.  Yesterday was the first time I actually went inside and ordered it so now I feel I can give an acturate review of it.Upon entering you can't help but notice that the customers are completely walled off from the employees by thick bullet proof glass.  My first thoughts were oh no what have I walked into should I fear for my life and run before I get mugged?  Then I quickly realized that the bullet proof glass not only protects the employees, but also protects me.  Obviously the people they want to protect their employees from are aware that robbing the place through a frontal attempt would be futile.  Therefore they will not waste their time coming in to rob the place so the customers can feel pretty safe since those people won't be going in and attempting to rob the place and putting customers lives in danger.Now on to the food.  I love the food here.  The chicken reminds me of what fried chicken used to taste like decades ago at KFC.  Unlike KFC today the chicken here is not overly greasey and there's actually meat on the bone.  Also the flavoring is not just on the breading but in the meat too.  I really can't stand fast food biscuits, but I found myself eating 2 of theirs yesterday so that's a major compliment about their biscuits.  As for their sides of the ones I've had I really enjoyed and so far have not had a bad one.

4.description: Two stars because its local. This is the worst popeyes location I have ever been to. Each time I go here they are always out of chicken (I know right), don't have spicy chicken, 15 minute wait on chicken or they're just ridiculously rude at this location.  I'd stay just stay clear of this location and their hard old and cold biscuits.

12.description: Sunday evening about 7:30, badly picked-over salad bar featuring iceberg lettuce, shredded carrots, and potato salad that looked tired, plus for some reason a cold poached salmon. The soup ("beef noodle") was lukewarm, pale grey in color, and completely flavorless. The ambience was that of an upscale nursing home. Service in the mostly empty restaurant was sketchy, although regulars seemed to get more attentive service. The only thing this place has going for it is location, and that's not enough.

7.description: This is the first time we ate there. The servers were very very nice. I think they deserve 10 stars! They were very friendly and experienced. The only problem was the quality of the food! It wasn't crowded for Sunday and it has a really good lake view. So, I can say, it was a nice, peaceful Sunday brunch. If the owner of the place wants to take more attention and starts, she/he needs to invest more money for higher quality food and variety!

3.description: Good food. Good price. Good service. What else do you need?This place is a Hyde Park Gem. The service is second to none. It's directly across LSD from the lake so the view is very nice.  The have a different buffet offering everyday.  Friday nights are the best.   The Sunday brunch is awesome. I love this place.

1.description: Hello I am a North Sider Resident of Chicago and I just wanted to check this Cafe Restaurant out since it is visible and it was in the southside. I would say it is nothing great but just decent food. My disappointments was the staff not being responsible if not taking to long to find a waiter or waitress and that their bar serving Pina Coladas at $10 was bad and not that great. That is another reason why I was disappointed at the staff because they did not give a alcoholic beverage menu. I would go here only if this was the last restaurant on this earth. I also was unimpressed by Patrick the greater who seemed to be in a hurry.

2.description: Ribs were fall off the bone. Everything else was average at best...

9.description: Was staying right next door, was little irking for somewhere to eat with my family decided to give it a shot and glad we did, the food was amazing with good prices compared to other places we've eaten on our trip, would recommend the catfish fried or blackened we had both some of the best I've had and I've have had a lot of catfish I'm from Oklahoma

10.description: This is a great place to grab an afternoon lunch, or a classic dinner with family in friends. I always enjoy visiting this place, and the ambiance here is always great! Love it!

13.description: A bunch of older folks frequent this place but it's a cool spot to grab a reasonably priced yet strong drink and chill in the cut.  It's unlikely that you'll see anyone you know unless you're over the age of 50.  Food is also really good but a bit on the pricey side especially for the venue and location, IMO ($15 blackened salmon salad).

16.description: They have buffet brunch every Sunday. I'm not sure if it's the times that Ive arrived, but the food was never HOT, always lukewarm or cold. But I do know that is to slightly be expected with buffets. I just feel  they leave the same food out for the entirety of the  brunch. The food wasn't horrible, but it definitely wasnt five star. Things that I never eat at home, I want to be superb when I go out. For Instance, the gravy and biscuits, gravy is always lumpy and cold, biscuits are cold and dry. I went twice to be fair..and both experiences were MEH. They do have lunch and dinner, maybe those experiences are better, but I might return here just as a last resort breakfast spot.

17.description: I was staying at the ramada hotel next door and gave this place a try one night.  I had a burger and a drink in their lounge area, which had a big screen t.v. and the service was good. The food didn't take to long, not too pricey and was delicious.  I would probably eat here again if I stay at the hotel in the future.

15.description: We have passed the Lake Shore Café numerous times when traveling along Lake Shore Drive and wondered how nice their view of Lake Michigan would be.  We finally took the opportunity and went for their extensive Sunday Brunch Buffet (11.00 am - 4.00 pm) and were amazed not only by the window view but even more by their delicious and extensive buffet options.  Since the Lake Shore Café offers daily specials we are looking forward to returning on other days.  We are considering to invite our out of town friends to their Friday Seafood Buffet and to enjoy a Live Jazz Band while dining as a nice alternative to the downtown venues.

0.description: This is right off lake shore drive , and it has a great view of the lake . It's a restaurant that is a part of the hotel. We just wanted to try someplace with a view . Wait this is starting to sound shady lol  Ok so the restaurant is very cute with views of the lake ! And the food is good , it is  all comfort food !  my friends had the croissant sandwich and burger with fries and the patty melt . I had the Ruben with fries .We all enjoyed our meal and the view ! The waiters are very nice as well ! They don't let your drink get to empty and very quick with the refills ! We all paid around 11 dollars with the drink . The prices are very affordable !

5.description: This is my first review for this restaurant but I have been here about three times. I've only eaten in the actually restaurant and I have not had drinks or lounge/bar food in the lounge area. The quality of food that is served here is ridiculous. There is nothing on the menu that stands out. The menu is overpriced for the quality of food they serve. My last visit was on a Friday and there was a jazz band playing. Very nice music and they were entertaining. That's why I gave two stars. The only option was buffet which I didn't know before I arrived. The buffet had no theme, just random food that appeared was leftover from the week. I decided to try the jambalaya, crab balls and stuffed claims. What a waste of food. The buffet is $20 per person and totally not worth it. The atmosphere is nice, parking is not bad; however the food is not worth the trip.

11.description: Was not impressed at all with the quality of food or the service

8.description: Awesome!!! We came on a Sunday night at like 7 it was almost empty. I prefer it that way. They encouraged us to pick our table (another thing that I love). I ordered feticine Alfredo with chicken and my fiance ordered honey glazed porkchop with a side of French fries. The portion sizes are amazing!!!!! :-) the food is super flavorful. the unlimited salad bar rocks. We never did get the soup (unlimited soup and salad) but we didn't care. The food rocks!!!  The service is attentive without hovering and the bread rolls are warm and soft!  We WILL be coming back!!!! And I highly recommend!

4.description: I'm a Sunday brunch regular at Lake Shore Cafe, and for good reason! There's no other place in the City of Chicago that delivers great food, great drinks, and excellent customer service every single time. From the wide variety of food choices, views of the lake, and great overall ambiance- the lake shore cafe is perfect. Oh and did I mention Mimosa's.. Get there I'm sure you'll love it. Tell Ramon I said hello.

14.description: We took two coworkers who were both in  their mid 60's here for the Friday nite seafood buffet. The food was great. The band however are mid 60-70 yr old jazz musicians. They are ok if you are in that age bracket. The music is a bit loud, but I can't wait to take my dad this summer. Again, great seafood and a great place to take parents or grandparents. Oh yeah, all the older folks dress SOOO nice when they come there. We young people should take notes. Lol...

6.description: Went there for Sunday brunch.  Waffles were perfect!  Great spread, Great view.  A great place for brunch.  Haven't tried any other day but I looked at the menu and it looked like the dinners were worth checking out too!
